05c4f601-01c4-47d7-8650-2a4e8dc2b92a Gather the ingredients.
05c4f601-01c4-47d7-8650-2a4e8dc2b92a Stir together the brown sugar, smoked paprika, onion powder, garlic powder, crushed red pepper flakes, salt, and pepper in a small bowl.
05c4f601-01c4-47d7-8650-2a4e8dc2b92a Trim the extra fat or any loose skin off of the chicken thighs.
05c4f601-01c4-47d7-8650-2a4e8dc2b92a Rub the chicken with the rub mixture. Make sure to get the rub under the skin, on top of the skin and on the underside of the chicken. Cover the chicken with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
05c4f601-01c4-47d7-8650-2a4e8dc2b92a Preheat the grill or smoker to 180 F. Prepare your wood chips. If you are using a regular grill, place a pan of damp wood chips in a disposable pan under one side of the grill rack. Place the chicken, skin side up on the opposite side of the grill. This will “smoke” the meat for you without having a smoker.
05c4f601-01c4-47d7-8650-2a4e8dc2b92a While the chicken is cooking for the first 15 minutes, prepare the glaze. Add the jam, ketchup, peaches, brown sugar, molasses, whiskey, apple cider vinegar, garlic powder, and hoison sauce into a small saucepan. Stir to combine.
05c4f601-01c4-47d7-8650-2a4e8dc2b92a Cook on medium-low heat for 8 to 10 minutes, stirring frequently until the sauce is thickened. It should be quite thick and sticky.
05c4f601-01c4-47d7-8650-2a4e8dc2b92a Increase the grill or smoker temperature to 375 F. If you are using a grill or pellet grill, you can flip the chicken to sear the skin as well. This will make it extra crispy.
05c4f601-01c4-47d7-8650-2a4e8dc2b92a When the chicken is at about 160 F internally, you can brush the glaze over the top of the chicken skin. Finish cooking until the chicken reaches the internal temperature of 165 F, about 10 to 15 minutes. Serve immediately or enjoy cold!
bf55961f-5808-4538-ba3f-dc557b06e59b Gather the ingredients.
bf55961f-5808-4538-ba3f-dc557b06e59b Heat up a medium saucepan on medium-low. Add all of the ingredients, but just 1/4 teaspoon of cayenne powder. Allow the mixture to simmer for 5 to 8 minutes.
bf55961f-5808-4538-ba3f-dc557b06e59b Taste for flavor and add the remaining 1/4 teaspoon of cayenne if you'd like a spicier sauce.
bf55961f-5808-4538-ba3f-dc557b06e59b Remove from heat and allow to cool completely before using.
bf55961f-5808-4538-ba3f-dc557b06e59b Store covered in the refrigerator for up to a week.
bf55961f-5808-4538-ba3f-dc557b06e59b Enjoy.
72535853-9f48-4f9a-a568-a814bc0aed18 Gather the ingredients.
72535853-9f48-4f9a-a568-a814bc0aed18 Rinse the lemons clean. If you have any plans to use or otherwise eat the peel, you may even want to go so far as to scrub them with soap before rinsing them. Pat them dry. To release extra juice, roll them on a hard surface.
72535853-9f48-4f9a-a568-a814bc0aed18 Cut the lemons in half crosswise.
72535853-9f48-4f9a-a568-a814bc0aed18 Optional: Pop out and discard any visible seeds. Use the tip of a paring knife to urge any deeper-set seeds to the surface. This is a kind service to your fellow diners since it minimizes the chance that they'll bite into a bitter seed while enjoying their lovely grilled lemons.
72535853-9f48-4f9a-a568-a814bc0aed18 Use a pastry brush, silicone grilling brush, or a paper towel to brush the cut sides with a bit of oil. You can sprinkle the cut sides with fine sea salt, too, if you want to add a more intense savory effect to the grilled lemons.
72535853-9f48-4f9a-a568-a814bc0aed18 Set the lemons cut-side-down on the hot grill or in the frying pan. Cook until the lemons are heated through and charred on the cut side, about 3 minutes. Ideally, you'll cook them without moving them so they char nicely, but adjust them if the heat seems uneven so they char evenly.
72535853-9f48-4f9a-a568-a814bc0aed18 Enjoy!
95d888b2-854a-4f6c-b772-a9fbcb5f3f68 Gather the ingredients.
95d888b2-854a-4f6c-b772-a9fbcb5f3f68 If you choose to brine your chicken, combine the salt, sugar, and water in a plastic bowl and stir until the salt and sugar are completely dissolved.
95d888b2-854a-4f6c-b772-a9fbcb5f3f68 Apply a spice rub under the skin of the breast and in the chicken cavity. The rub can be almost any combination of herbs and spices, but if you have brined your chicken, it already has all the salt it needs, so avoid a rub with extra salt. If you have skipped the brining step, use a rub that contains salt.
95d888b2-854a-4f6c-b772-a9fbcb5f3f68 Set up your full-size charcoal grill for smoking. The trick is to separate the fire from the food. To do this, light enough charcoal to cover half the coal grate with two layers of burning coals. It is best to light the charcoal with a charcoal chimney; this allows you to light more charcoal outside the grill if necessary.
95d888b2-854a-4f6c-b772-a9fbcb5f3f68 Place one of the aluminum pans on the coal grate next to the burning coals, but not on the coals. This is the drip pan that helps to keep the grill clean and prevents any dripping fat from reaching the fire which can cause flare-ups.
95d888b2-854a-4f6c-b772-a9fbcb5f3f68 Heat the grill to 250 F to 275 F/120 C to 135 C and then adjust the vents on the grill to hold that temperature. While the grill is heating up, take the chicken out of the refrigerator to come to room temperature. Once the grill is ready, place the chicken, breast-side up, on the grill grates directly over the drip pan on the coals and next to the pan of water on the grate.
95d888b2-854a-4f6c-b772-a9fbcb5f3f68 Replace the grill lid and let the chicken cook for about 1 hour to 90 minutes. It is important to keep an eye on the grill to ensure that the fire is still burning and that the temperature is being maintained.
95d888b2-854a-4f6c-b772-a9fbcb5f3f68 After about 90 minutes, it is time to flip and turn the chicken. Since our makeshift smoker won't cook evenly, it is important to do this halfway through the cooking time. Flip the chicken upside down, placing the side that was away from the fire close to the fire. This should make for an evenly cooked chicken.
95d888b2-854a-4f6c-b772-a9fbcb5f3f68 The total cooking time is about 3 hours depending on the size of the chicken. As the chicken gets close to being done, it is time to start checking the temperature. Make sure to use a reliable meat thermometer; a high-quality digital thermometer is recommended. Check the center of each breast as well as the thickest part of each thigh. If the part away from the fire is lower in temperature, you might want to rotate the chicken again. Look for a temperature around 185 F/85 C. Chicken is cooked at 165 F/75 C, but it is best to overcook the chicken to make it easier to shred. Generally, any type of barbecue is overcooked to maximize tenderness.
95d888b2-854a-4f6c-b772-a9fbcb5f3f68 After the chicken has rested for 15 minutes, it's time to start shredding the meat. This is best done with a pair of insulated food gloves so the hot chicken can be easily handled. It is something of a messy job, so a large, clean workspace is needed.
95d888b2-854a-4f6c-b772-a9fbcb5f3f68 There is no trick to shredding the meat, so you may need to try out a few techniques before you find what works for you. Start by pulling off the skin and breaking down the larger pieces of meat, removing bones and fat as you go. Once you have the pile of meat, taking a portion at a time, use two forks to shred. Either pull each fork away from each other or use one to hold the meat and the other to pull away, shredding the chicken meat.
95d888b2-854a-4f6c-b772-a9fbcb5f3f68 To keep the meat warm, place it in a large pot over a low flame, tossing occasionally, or if you are going to be eating later, a slow cooker on the warm setting works well. Once the shredded chicken is warmed, add your desired barbecue sauce, tossing to evenly coat. Enjoy!
06d0cf74-4ae1-436a-8115-d6e866e180f7 Gather the ingredients.
06d0cf74-4ae1-436a-8115-d6e866e180f7 Heat a gas or charcoal grill to medium-high heat (you should be able to hold your hand about 1 inch above the cooking grate for 3 to 4 seconds before pulling it away from the intensity of the heat).
06d0cf74-4ae1-436a-8115-d6e866e180f7 While the grill heats, trim off and discard any wilted greens at the top of the spring onions. Cut off and discard the root end of the onions as well. Be careful to cut right at the bottom of the onion and the top of the roots so the bulb stays together and you can cook and serve the onions intact.
06d0cf74-4ae1-436a-8115-d6e866e180f7 Brush the spring onions with olive oil or vegetable oil. Be liberal with the application of the oil — it prevents the onions from sticking to the hot grill and adds tons of flavor as it mixes with the juices from the onions.
06d0cf74-4ae1-436a-8115-d6e866e180f7 Put the spring onions on the preheated grill and cook them, turning once, until grill marks appear on both sides and the spring onions feel fork tender all the way through, about 15 minutes total cooking time.
06d0cf74-4ae1-436a-8115-d6e866e180f7 Sprinkle the grilled spring onions with salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste.
06d0cf74-4ae1-436a-8115-d6e866e180f7 Spritz the onions with fresh lemon juice or serve the lemon wedges on the side so everyone can dress their own plate.
2639d68e-ae30-4668-bfda-459b1bdc6e6f Gather the ingredients.
2639d68e-ae30-4668-bfda-459b1bdc6e6f Heat the oven to 350 F.
2639d68e-ae30-4668-bfda-459b1bdc6e6f Sprinkle the chicken pieces liberally with salt, pepper, and garlic powder, if using.
2639d68e-ae30-4668-bfda-459b1bdc6e6f In a saucepan, combine barbecue sauce ingredients, blending well.
2639d68e-ae30-4668-bfda-459b1bdc6e6f Bring to a gentle boil over medium heat. Reduce the heat to low, and continue simmering for 1 minute.
2639d68e-ae30-4668-bfda-459b1bdc6e6f Arrange the chicken pieces in a shallow roasting pan or baking dish, skin-side down, in a single layer.
2639d68e-ae30-4668-bfda-459b1bdc6e6f Brush the chicken with about half of the sauce.
2639d68e-ae30-4668-bfda-459b1bdc6e6f Bake in the preheated oven for 25 minutes.
2639d68e-ae30-4668-bfda-459b1bdc6e6f Turn the chicken skin-side up. Brush with remaining barbecue sauce.
2639d68e-ae30-4668-bfda-459b1bdc6e6f Bake until juices of the legs and thighs run clear when pierced with a fork and temperature reads at least 165 F, about 20 to 30 minutes longer.
2639d68e-ae30-4668-bfda-459b1bdc6e6f Broil briefly for a few minutes in the end, if you'd like crispier skin.
2639d68e-ae30-4668-bfda-459b1bdc6e6f Serve with your choice of sides and enjoy!
5fb1f6ad-fa46-4f34-8747-66a9a500299b Whisk together the marinade ingredients in a large bowl or a plastic bag. Add the chicken to the marinade, cover and let sit in the refrigerator for at least 20 minutes and no more than 3 hours.
5fb1f6ad-fa46-4f34-8747-66a9a500299b While the chicken is marinating, prepare the pickled vegetables. Add the salt and sugar to the warm water and stir until everything has dissolved. Add in the vinegar and stir. Place the carrots and radishes in a large bowl and pour the vinegar mixture over the top Cover and place in the refrigerator for at least 20 minutes and up to 1 week.
5fb1f6ad-fa46-4f34-8747-66a9a500299b Heat your grill or grill pan on medium-high heat. Add the marinated chicken and cook for about 4 minutes per side or until completely cooked through. Remove the chicken from the heat and set aside until you're ready to assemble the sandwiches.
5fb1f6ad-fa46-4f34-8747-66a9a500299b Split the bread, but don't cut it all the way through, leaving a hinge. Toast the baguettes if you wish, then slather one side with mayo and the other with the pate. Add the chicken as the first layer, then top with the pickled vegetables, jalapenos, cilantro, and cucumber. Cut in half and serve with more mayo, Sriracha, and extra toppings! Dig in immediately for best results.
008c959d-74a7-4328-9b2c-4ddf3fd761a0 Place chicken in the slow cooker.
008c959d-74a7-4328-9b2c-4ddf3fd761a0 Add the sliced onion, if using.
008c959d-74a7-4328-9b2c-4ddf3fd761a0 Pour barbecue sauce over the chicken.
008c959d-74a7-4328-9b2c-4ddf3fd761a0 Cover and cook on LOW for 6 to 8 hours or until the chicken is fully cooked
008c959d-74a7-4328-9b2c-4ddf3fd761a0 Shred chicken and serve hot.
eddb2e58-9af2-4e55-8f05-ffce5524f8c2 Gather the ingredients.
eddb2e58-9af2-4e55-8f05-ffce5524f8c2 To make the brine, combine salt, white sugar, and hot water in a large plastic or glass container that you can cover. Stir to mix. Add cold water and cayenne, if using. Continue stirring to dissolve.
eddb2e58-9af2-4e55-8f05-ffce5524f8c2 Add chicken drumsticks, cover, and refrigerate for 4 hours.
eddb2e58-9af2-4e55-8f05-ffce5524f8c2 Meanwhile, gather the ingredients for the sauce.
eddb2e58-9af2-4e55-8f05-ffce5524f8c2 Make barbecue sauce by combining ingredients in a medium saucepan.
eddb2e58-9af2-4e55-8f05-ffce5524f8c2 Simmer over low heat for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
eddb2e58-9af2-4e55-8f05-ffce5524f8c2 Remove from heat and allow to cool for 10 to 15 minutes.
eddb2e58-9af2-4e55-8f05-ffce5524f8c2 Preheat grill to a medium-low heat (around 275 F/135 C).
eddb2e58-9af2-4e55-8f05-ffce5524f8c2 Remove the chicken legs from the brine and discard brine. Rinse chicken thoroughly to remove all traces of the brine from the surface. Pat dry with paper towels.
eddb2e58-9af2-4e55-8f05-ffce5524f8c2 Grill chicken legs for about 30 to 35 minutes, turning often (about every 5 minutes) to make sure all sides are cooked evenly.
eddb2e58-9af2-4e55-8f05-ffce5524f8c2 During the last 15 to 20 minutes, start brushing sauce over the surface every 5 minutes, rotating the chicken to coat evenly, until the chicken is done (an internal temperature of should be at least 165 F/75 C, but you may want to get closer to 180 F/82 C), and the sauce has cooked down to a sticky consistency.
eddb2e58-9af2-4e55-8f05-ffce5524f8c2 Remove chicken from heat, place on a large serving platter, and tent loosely with aluminum foil. Let drumsticks rest for 5 to 7 minutes.
eddb2e58-9af2-4e55-8f05-ffce5524f8c2 Serve and enjoy!
9f7b0ba6-91c0-448d-b047-137a90697205 Split each chicken breast so that you have four halves. Place the chicken breasts in a large bowl.
9f7b0ba6-91c0-448d-b047-137a90697205 Whisk together the lime juice, seasoned salt, pepper, and olive oil. Pour it over the chicken. Cover the chicken and let marinade for at least 20 minutes or up to 2 hours in the refrigerator. Any longer will cause the lime juice to "cook" the chicken (i.e. ceviche) so don't let it marinade for too long!
9f7b0ba6-91c0-448d-b047-137a90697205 Heat up your grill or grill pan to medium-high heat so that you will get nice grill marks. Grill the chicken for about 5 minutes on each side or until cooked through. Remove from the heat and allow to rest for about 5 minutes. Then slice into narrow strips.
9f7b0ba6-91c0-448d-b047-137a90697205 Toss the strips with the barbecue sauce in a medium-sized bowl.
9f7b0ba6-91c0-448d-b047-137a90697205 Heat up a cast iron skillet or griddle to medium-low heat. Quesadillas can burn easily, so monitor the temperature closely. Place a tortilla on the pan, top with about 1/4 of the cheese, some of the red onion and about 1/4 of the chicken. Place another tortilla on top. Cover with a lid to help allow the cheese to melt.
9f7b0ba6-91c0-448d-b047-137a90697205 Flip the quesadilla and finish cooking for a minute or two on the other side. Repeat with the rest of the quesadillas. You can keep them warm in a 200 F oven while you are cooking the rest of the quesadillas.
9f7b0ba6-91c0-448d-b047-137a90697205 Cut each quesadilla into quarters. Garnish with cilantro leaves, more barbecue sauce, and sour cream. Enjoy!
9a943c7c-a778-49a5-818d-8872883d17f6 Gather the ingredients.
9a943c7c-a778-49a5-818d-8872883d17f6 In a large resealable food storage bag (plastic), combine the oil, vinegar, sugar, ketchup, onion, Worcestershire sauce, salt, garlic, and Tabasco. Add the chicken and turn to coat thoroughly. Seal the bag and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight, turning occasionally.
9a943c7c-a778-49a5-818d-8872883d17f6 Pour marinade into a saucepan and bring to a full rolling boil over high heat. Remove from the heat and set aside.
9a943c7c-a778-49a5-818d-8872883d17f6 Heat the grill to moderate or medium-high heat, about 350 F to 375 F.
9a943c7c-a778-49a5-818d-8872883d17f6 First, sear the chicken over direct heat for about 2 to 3 minutes per side.
9a943c7c-a778-49a5-818d-8872883d17f6 Continue grilling the chicken leg quarters over indirect heat -- not directly over coals or gas burners -- turning frequently and basting with the reserved boiled marinade, for about 35 to 55 minutes, depending on size.
9a943c7c-a778-49a5-818d-8872883d17f6 The chicken should be fork tender and juices will run clear. The temperature should register at least 165 F on an instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the meat but not touching bone.
9a943c7c-a778-49a5-818d-8872883d17f6 Serve and enjoy!
ff764670-0694-4a53-9d4a-e54363352113 Preheat oven to 450 F.
ff764670-0694-4a53-9d4a-e54363352113 If necessary, cut whole wings into two pieces, discarding the tips. Cover two baking sheets with heavy-duty foil and spray lightly with non-stick oil. Season the wings with salt and spread out evenly on baking pans. Bake for about 20 minutes, remove and turn the wings over; cook for another 15 to 20 minutes until the wings are cooked through and well-browned.
ff764670-0694-4a53-9d4a-e54363352113 While the chicken wings are baking mix the rest of the ingredients in a large mixing bowl. Taste sauce and add more spice if so desired. After the wings are cooked, transfer them to the bowl (use tongs or slotted spatula, so the grease stays in the pan). Toss with a spatula to completely coat. Let sit for 3 minutes and toss again, repeat several times. The chicken wings will soak in the sauce as they rest, and the glaze will slightly thicken as it cools.
ff764670-0694-4a53-9d4a-e54363352113 Toss well one last time and transfer to a serving platter. The wings should be well-coated with sauce, but not drippy. If you want, you can keep the wings in a warm oven at 200 F for 15 minutes for a "drier" chicken wing.
ff764670-0694-4a53-9d4a-e54363352113 Can be served warm or room temp.
173ab744-eb38-49e5-acdd-cead89bd2c65 Mix all ingredients together in a saucepan and let simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from the heat.
173ab744-eb38-49e5-acdd-cead89bd2c65 Once the chicken is cooked, shred the chicken and add the sauce to coat it. You can vary the amount of barbecue sauce added to your taste.
f9abecfa-e747-4d27-a297-173fbbd22057 Place the chicken breasts in a large resealable plastic bag.
f9abecfa-e747-4d27-a297-173fbbd22057 Combine the remaining ingredients and pour them over the chicken.
f9abecfa-e747-4d27-a297-173fbbd22057 Seal the bag and allow it to marinate in the refrigerator for 30 minutes to 1 hour.
f9abecfa-e747-4d27-a297-173fbbd22057 Preheat the grill for medium heat.
f9abecfa-e747-4d27-a297-173fbbd22057 Remove the chicken from the bag and reserve the marinade.
f9abecfa-e747-4d27-a297-173fbbd22057 Place chicken on a lightly oiled grill grate and brush with marinade two to three times during the first half of the cooking time.
f9abecfa-e747-4d27-a297-173fbbd22057 Cook the chicken breasts for 20 minutes or until temperature reaches 165 F/75 C at the center (or thickest) part of the breast.
0dacf418-5d49-439c-9c84-1e6dc05684cb Gather the ingredients.
0dacf418-5d49-439c-9c84-1e6dc05684cb Preheat grill to medium heat and lightly oil the cooking grate.
0dacf418-5d49-439c-9c84-1e6dc05684cb Combine ground chicken, carrots, green onions, garlic, herbs, salt, and pepper together in a large mixing bowl. Do not overmix.
0dacf418-5d49-439c-9c84-1e6dc05684cb Shape mixture into 4 to 6 patties and place on wax paper. The mixture will be soft.
0dacf418-5d49-439c-9c84-1e6dc05684cb Place patties on oiled grill and allow to cook for 12 to 15 minutes, turning once. The patties are cooked once they reach an internal temperature of 165 F.
0dacf418-5d49-439c-9c84-1e6dc05684cb Remove from heat and place onto toasted buns. Serve with your favorite condiments.
0dacf418-5d49-439c-9c84-1e6dc05684cb Enjoy!
48e032ae-ab34-49d6-8a2a-d88ad6625a34 Gather the ingredients.
48e032ae-ab34-49d6-8a2a-d88ad6625a34 Place wings in a resealable plastic bag.
48e032ae-ab34-49d6-8a2a-d88ad6625a34 Combine the remaining ingredients.
48e032ae-ab34-49d6-8a2a-d88ad6625a34 Reserve half of the mixture by placing it into an airtight container and storing it in the refrigerator until ready to use.
48e032ae-ab34-49d6-8a2a-d88ad6625a34 Pour remaining half of mixture into the bag with wings, coat well, seal bag, and allow it to marinate in the refrigerator for 2 to 4 hours.
48e032ae-ab34-49d6-8a2a-d88ad6625a34 At the end of the marinating time, place reserved marinade into a small saucepan. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low and let the mixture simmer for 6 to 8 minutes.
48e032ae-ab34-49d6-8a2a-d88ad6625a34 Remove from heat and let cool to room temperature. If the mixture becomes too thick, add a small bit of water (1 to 2 tablespoons).
48e032ae-ab34-49d6-8a2a-d88ad6625a34 Preheat grill for direct medium heat.
48e032ae-ab34-49d6-8a2a-d88ad6625a34 Remove wings from bag and discard marinade.
48e032ae-ab34-49d6-8a2a-d88ad6625a34 Place the wings on the grill and cook for 10 minutes of direct heat. Cook over indirect heat for the remaining 15 to 20 minutes.
48e032ae-ab34-49d6-8a2a-d88ad6625a34 Make sure to watch for flare-ups.
48e032ae-ab34-49d6-8a2a-d88ad6625a34 Remove the meat once it has reached a safe internal temperature of 165 F and place it into a large bowl.
48e032ae-ab34-49d6-8a2a-d88ad6625a34 Pour cooked sauce over the top (it might need to be rewarmed either in the microwave for 30 seconds or on the stovetop for a few minutes.)
48e032ae-ab34-49d6-8a2a-d88ad6625a34 Using tongs, flip wings around sauce until well coated. Plate, top with mint or cilantro leaves and serve. Enjoy!
f2751b04-3758-413e-80b9-f33110614a97 Place skinless quartered chicken in a shallow glass dish.
f2751b04-3758-413e-80b9-f33110614a97 Combine all remaining ingredients, except butter or ghee, in a bowl.
f2751b04-3758-413e-80b9-f33110614a97 Pour mixture onto chicken. Cover dish and allow to marinate in the refrigerator for 8 to 12 hours.
f2751b04-3758-413e-80b9-f33110614a97 Remove chicken from refrigerator and allow to stand for 20 to 30 minutes.
f2751b04-3758-413e-80b9-f33110614a97 Meanwhile, take half cup butter and melt in a saucepan; cook for 3 to 5 minutes.
f2751b04-3758-413e-80b9-f33110614a97 Preheat grill for medium-high heat.
f2751b04-3758-413e-80b9-f33110614a97 Place chicken on lightly oiled grill rack and cook for 35 to 45 minutes, turning chicken and basting with melted butter often.
f2751b04-3758-413e-80b9-f33110614a97 When chicken is fully cooked (or reaches an internal temperature of 165 F in multiple spots), remove from grill and serve with remaining melted butter on top.
968dd0dc-7238-4ba1-9778-cdc2feb09e69 Preheat grill. Combine butter, onion, garlic and curry powder. Mix well.
968dd0dc-7238-4ba1-9778-cdc2feb09e69 Coat chicken thighs with vegetable oil and season with salt and pepper. Apply about 1 tablespoon of curry butter mixture under the skin of each chicken thigh.
968dd0dc-7238-4ba1-9778-cdc2feb09e69 Place onto hot grill, seasoning side up. Grill over medium heat, turning occasionally until internal temperature reaches 165 F, about 35 minutes depending on how large the thighs are.
601aa22c-933f-4df2-8557-74ee41f5dda4 Combine lemonade concentrates with soy sauce, salt, garlic powder, marjoram, paprika, and black pepper in blender and mix until smooth.
601aa22c-933f-4df2-8557-74ee41f5dda4 Place chicken in a large resealable plastic bag.
601aa22c-933f-4df2-8557-74ee41f5dda4 Pour in half of the lemonade mixture into the plastic bag.
601aa22c-933f-4df2-8557-74ee41f5dda4 Turn to coat and let sit for 30 minutes.
601aa22c-933f-4df2-8557-74ee41f5dda4 Preheat grill.
601aa22c-933f-4df2-8557-74ee41f5dda4 Remove chicken from the marinade and place on hot grill.
601aa22c-933f-4df2-8557-74ee41f5dda4 Grill chicken for about 6 to 7 minutes per side basting with reserved marinade.
601aa22c-933f-4df2-8557-74ee41f5dda4 Continue grilling chicken until done, about 12 to 15 minutes or until it reaches an internal temperature of 165 F/75 C, and serve.
5bd8a94b-8533-402a-9904-3f124415b2c1 Tear a piece of aluminum foil paper about 12 inches long. Fold in half and put on the grill top, folding edges under the grill to secure it in place.
5bd8a94b-8533-402a-9904-3f124415b2c1 Remove any excess fat or skin hanging from chicken, and rinse with cool water. Pat dry with paper towels. Season chicken well inside and out with Cajun seasoning. Make sure to get under the skin of the breast.
5bd8a94b-8533-402a-9904-3f124415b2c1 Open can of beer and pour out 1 ounce of liquid—you can either drink it or discard it. Add liquid crab boil to beer. Separate chicken skin from the neck area by pushing a finger between the skin and meat. While holding pocket open, pour beer into the pocket. Do this in several areas. A large injection needle also works well for doing this.
5bd8a94b-8533-402a-9904-3f124415b2c1 Next, slide the bottom-end of the chicken over the can of beer. While holding the beer can and the chicken, gently place on the foil-covered grill. Close grill cover and cook for about 45 to 60 minutes or until the juices run clear and the chicken is done. The internal temperature must be 165 F in the breast meat and 175 F in the thigh area.
5bd8a94b-8533-402a-9904-3f124415b2c1 Once cooked, using heat-resistant gloves, carefully remove the chicken from the grill (still with the beer can inserted) and place onto a large cutting board with a lip to collect any juices.
5bd8a94b-8533-402a-9904-3f124415b2c1 Remove beer can and loosely tent the bird with aluminum foil. Let it rest for 8 to 10 minutes before carving. Reserve any juices from the beer can and cutting board to make a pan sauce or gravy.
970b6266-d8f8-46a3-88a1-652f6c06f984 Gather the ingredients.
970b6266-d8f8-46a3-88a1-652f6c06f984 Whisk together the dressing/marinade ingredients in a bowl or measuring cup until the ingredients are emulsified and completely combined.
970b6266-d8f8-46a3-88a1-652f6c06f984 Pour half of the mixture into a large bowl and reserve the other half for the dressing. Add the chicken breasts, toss to coat, and cover. Store in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes or up to 2 hours. Any longer and the lemon juice will start to break down the chicken and cause it to become mushy when cooked.
970b6266-d8f8-46a3-88a1-652f6c06f984 Heat a grill pan or your grill on high heat. Add the chicken and cook for about 5 minutes per side. Don’t move the chicken too soon or the grill marks will not form. Cook until the internal temperature reaches 165 F.
384c4430-542f-4a8d-b3f1-42ec8fc92f3e Combine marinade ingredients in a large mixing bowl.
384c4430-542f-4a8d-b3f1-42ec8fc92f3e Add the wings to the mixing bowl and toss them to coat.
384c4430-542f-4a8d-b3f1-42ec8fc92f3e Cover the wings with plastic wrap and allow them to marinate in a refrigerator for 4 to 8 hours.
384c4430-542f-4a8d-b3f1-42ec8fc92f3e Preheat grill for high heat.
384c4430-542f-4a8d-b3f1-42ec8fc92f3e Place wings on the grill.
384c4430-542f-4a8d-b3f1-42ec8fc92f3e Reserve the remaining marinade.
384c4430-542f-4a8d-b3f1-42ec8fc92f3e Cook the wings for 5 minutes per side.
384c4430-542f-4a8d-b3f1-42ec8fc92f3e Baste wings liberally with remaining marinade.
384c4430-542f-4a8d-b3f1-42ec8fc92f3e Reduce heat to medium and continue cooking the wings for an additional 30 minutes.
384c4430-542f-4a8d-b3f1-42ec8fc92f3e When done, remove from grill and serve immediately.
a78f588f-c91b-4e70-a16d-817f0d012c7c Make a dry rub by sifting the pepper, onion powder, chili powder, garlic powder, and seasoned salt into a bowl to blend.
a78f588f-c91b-4e70-a16d-817f0d012c7c Place the chicken wings in a large resealable plastic bag. Pour in the dry rub and shake to coat the wings well.
a78f588f-c91b-4e70-a16d-817f0d012c7c Marinate for at least 30 minutes (at room temperature) or as long as 24 hours (in the refrigerator).
a78f588f-c91b-4e70-a16d-817f0d012c7c Prepare coals using three pounds of charcoal. Make sure the coals are in a pile to one side of your grill or smoker.
a78f588f-c91b-4e70-a16d-817f0d012c7c After the coals have turned white, place 2 cups of soaked and drained apple wood chips on the pile of coals.
a78f588f-c91b-4e70-a16d-817f0d012c7c Set the wings on the grate so they will cook by indirect heat—in other words, not over the coals—and smoke for 25 minutes.
a78f588f-c91b-4e70-a16d-817f0d012c7c Turn the wings and smoke for another 20 to 25 minutes.
a78f588f-c91b-4e70-a16d-817f0d012c7c Mix the honey, barbecue sauce, and apple juice together in a small saucepan.
a78f588f-c91b-4e70-a16d-817f0d012c7c Cook over medium heat until warmed through, about two to three minutes.
a78f588f-c91b-4e70-a16d-817f0d012c7c Place the wings in a disposable foil pan and pour the warm sauce over the wings.
a78f588f-c91b-4e70-a16d-817f0d012c7c Toss to coat evenly.
a78f588f-c91b-4e70-a16d-817f0d012c7c Cover and smoke for another 20 to 30 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the glaze is finished the way you like it.
a78f588f-c91b-4e70-a16d-817f0d012c7c If you're using a grill, you can move the aluminum pan directly over the coals while you're glazing the wings. Chicken wings are fully cooked once the internal temperature reaches 175 F.
a78f588f-c91b-4e70-a16d-817f0d012c7c Remove from heat and serve.
1e67f2b3-ba71-4397-9cb0-68cdfc99b117 Combine all ingredients in a saucepan and allow to simmer for 8 to 10 minutes.
1e67f2b3-ba71-4397-9cb0-68cdfc99b117 Once the sauce has cooked through, remove from heat and allow to cool before using.
1e67f2b3-ba71-4397-9cb0-68cdfc99b117 Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 5 days after preparation.
ba7c248b-724e-4aec-8086-81801258a0df Gather the ingredients.
ba7c248b-724e-4aec-8086-81801258a0df Preheat grill. Combine all ingredients (except chicken wings) in a small saucepan and let boil for 2 minutes. Remove from heat, pour into a large bowl and let cool.
ba7c248b-724e-4aec-8086-81801258a0df Add chicken wings to the marinade and marinate in the refrigerator for 2 hours or more.
ba7c248b-724e-4aec-8086-81801258a0df Grill over medium heat for 10 to 15 minutes or until cooked through.
ba7c248b-724e-4aec-8086-81801258a0df Serve chicken wings with celery and carrot sticks.
ba7c248b-724e-4aec-8086-81801258a0df Enjoy!
a49cf6a2-feb5-4653-806a-70aef1a21a50 Gather the ingredients.
a49cf6a2-feb5-4653-806a-70aef1a21a50 With a sharp knife, make several deep slashes through the skin and flesh of the chicken: two across the breast, two across the thigh, one across the leg.
a49cf6a2-feb5-4653-806a-70aef1a21a50 In a wide, shallow dish, combine the rice vinegar, garlic, and 1/4 cup of the barbecue sauce.
a49cf6a2-feb5-4653-806a-70aef1a21a50 Add the chicken and coat with the marinade. Once coated turn the chicken skin-side down in the dish, cover, and refrigerate for 1 to 3 hours.
a49cf6a2-feb5-4653-806a-70aef1a21a50 Remove the chicken from the marinade, pat dry with paper towels, and place on a foil-lined baking sheet.
a49cf6a2-feb5-4653-806a-70aef1a21a50 In a small bowl, mix together the dry rub ingredients and sprinkle over both sides of the chicken.
a49cf6a2-feb5-4653-806a-70aef1a21a50 Build a medium fire in your charcoal grill (you may use a gas grill, but charcoal is recommended for this recipe). When all of the charcoal is covered in gray ash, brush the grates lightly with oil and place the chicken skin-side down on the grill.
a49cf6a2-feb5-4653-806a-70aef1a21a50 Cook for just 3 to 4 minutes to lightly char the skin and create some grill marks, then turn over so the skin side is up. Brush the top of the chicken generously with barbecue sauce.
a49cf6a2-feb5-4653-806a-70aef1a21a50 Cover the grill and cook, without turning the chicken again, for 35 to 40 minutes, or until the internal temperature is 165 to 170 F. Baste with sauce every 5 minutes.
5dc43a2a-f86f-4dac-8fea-e71acb15f67d Gather the ingredients.
5dc43a2a-f86f-4dac-8fea-e71acb15f67d Thoroughly dry the chicken.
5dc43a2a-f86f-4dac-8fea-e71acb15f67d Sprinkle the chicken pieces with the salt, taking care to work some under the skin.
5dc43a2a-f86f-4dac-8fea-e71acb15f67d Cover and chill at least two hours and up to overnight.
5dc43a2a-f86f-4dac-8fea-e71acb15f67d Let the chicken come to room temperature for about 30 minutes before grilling.
5dc43a2a-f86f-4dac-8fea-e71acb15f67d Meanwhile, prepare a gas grill for indirect heat. Turn all burners on high and close the lid. When temperature inside the grill reaches 400 F, turn off one burner. The area over the turned-off burner is the indirect heat section.​
5dc43a2a-f86f-4dac-8fea-e71acb15f67d Brush the cooking grate with vegetable oil.
5dc43a2a-f86f-4dac-8fea-e71acb15f67d Set the chicken skin-side down on the indirect heat section of the grill. Close the lid on a gas grill and cook for 15 minutes.
5dc43a2a-f86f-4dac-8fea-e71acb15f67d Turn the chicken over, close the lid on the gas grill, and cook 10 minutes.
5dc43a2a-f86f-4dac-8fea-e71acb15f67d Move chicken to the direct heat section and cook, turning once, until skin is brown and crispy–about five minutes. (Pay close attention: any dripping fat or added oils or marinades catch fire easily. You may want to keep a spray bottle of water nearby to douse flames.)
5dc43a2a-f86f-4dac-8fea-e71acb15f67d Test the chicken for doneness by cutting into ​its center. It should be slightly pink (it will finish cooking while it rests). If the center is very pink, return the chicken to the indirect heat section and cook another five minutes.
5dc43a2a-f86f-4dac-8fea-e71acb15f67d Let the chicken rest at least 10 minutes, covered with foil, before serving.
5dc43a2a-f86f-4dac-8fea-e71acb15f67d Serve hot, warm, or at room temperature.
5dc43a2a-f86f-4dac-8fea-e71acb15f67d Enjoy!
4b8bb564-b0e3-4128-9ea5-42b08d6ab41e Gather the ingredients.
4b8bb564-b0e3-4128-9ea5-42b08d6ab41e In a medium saucepan, bring 2 cups of water to a boil.
4b8bb564-b0e3-4128-9ea5-42b08d6ab41e Add the salt and sugar, and stir until dissolved.
4b8bb564-b0e3-4128-9ea5-42b08d6ab41e Add the remaining 6 cups of cold water and stir in the whole peppercorns and allspice berries. Let the mixture cool completely before using it.
4b8bb564-b0e3-4128-9ea5-42b08d6ab41e Place the pork tenderloin in a large bowl, stock pot, or plastic container.
4b8bb564-b0e3-4128-9ea5-42b08d6ab41e Pour the cooled brine mixture over the pork. Cover it with a lid or plastic wrap, and store in the refrigerator. Brine the pork for 8 to 12 hours.
4b8bb564-b0e3-4128-9ea5-42b08d6ab41e When ready to cook, remove the meat from the brine. Quickly rinse it under cool water, and pat dry with paper towels. Do not over-rinse as this will remove all the salt and will leave the meat quite bland.
4b8bb564-b0e3-4128-9ea5-42b08d6ab41e Coat the tenderloin with the salt-free seasoning rub of your choice, and cook as directed per the grilling or oven roasting instructions of your preferred recipe.
a3812f60-c219-482a-b67d-0322c1897521 Gather the ingredients.
a3812f60-c219-482a-b67d-0322c1897521 Preheat grill for medium heat.
a3812f60-c219-482a-b67d-0322c1897521 Combine all rub ingredients in a small mixing bowl. Set aside.
a3812f60-c219-482a-b67d-0322c1897521 Remove giblets and the neck from chicken if needed.
a3812f60-c219-482a-b67d-0322c1897521 Sprinkle all over with rub, including cavity and under breast skin.
a3812f60-c219-482a-b67d-0322c1897521 Open can of beer and discard (or drink) half of it.
a3812f60-c219-482a-b67d-0322c1897521 Place minced garlic, rosemary, thyme, lemon juice, and pepper flakes in it.
a3812f60-c219-482a-b67d-0322c1897521 Make sure to pierce two more holes on the top of beer can to release steam.
a3812f60-c219-482a-b67d-0322c1897521 Place chicken on top of the can.
a3812f60-c219-482a-b67d-0322c1897521 Place the bird on grill balanced by the beer can.
a3812f60-c219-482a-b67d-0322c1897521 Grill over indirect medium heat for 1 1/2 to 2 hours until the internal temperature of the thigh reaches 180 F/82 C.
a3812f60-c219-482a-b67d-0322c1897521 Remove chicken when finished cooking and let sit (with beer can still intact), for 10 minutes before carving.
a3812f60-c219-482a-b67d-0322c1897521 Wearing heat-resistant gloves, carefully remove can from chicken cavity. Discard.
a3812f60-c219-482a-b67d-0322c1897521 Place chicken onto cutting board and carve.
a3812f60-c219-482a-b67d-0322c1897521 Serve with your favorite side dishes. Enjoy!
c7dfdf54-c937-420a-bf08-d3da147bb66f Cut lemons in half and squeeze out the juice into a medium plastic or glass bowl. Add remaining ingredients and mix well.
c7dfdf54-c937-420a-bf08-d3da147bb66f Marinate chicken or pork for 1 to 2 hours in the mixture. The mixture can be made ahead of time and stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for 1 week and in the freezer for up to 3 months.
7997349f-4d34-4c50-af8d-2cf8af786044 Gather the ingredients.
7997349f-4d34-4c50-af8d-2cf8af786044 Place the chicken breasts between sheets of plastic wrap and pound to flatten slightly and make uniform in thickness.
7997349f-4d34-4c50-af8d-2cf8af786044 Lightly sprinkle the chicken with a blackened seasoning blend or Cajun seasoning. Set aside.
7997349f-4d34-4c50-af8d-2cf8af786044 In a medium saucepan, simmer the cream for about 4 minutes to reduce slightly.
7997349f-4d34-4c50-af8d-2cf8af786044 Blend flour with butter and whisk into the cream.
7997349f-4d34-4c50-af8d-2cf8af786044 Add the Cajun seasoning and hot sauce, to taste, along with Worcestershire sauce. Taste and adjust seasonings, as needed. Keep warm.
7997349f-4d34-4c50-af8d-2cf8af786044 Cook linguine or fettuccine in boiling salted water, following package directions; drain well.
7997349f-4d34-4c50-af8d-2cf8af786044 While the pasta is cooking, heat a grill pan over medium-high heat, or preheat broiler or outdoor grill.
7997349f-4d34-4c50-af8d-2cf8af786044 Sear chicken for about 2 minutes on each side.
7997349f-4d34-4c50-af8d-2cf8af786044 Reduce heat to medium and continue to cook, turning, for about 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and keep warm.
7997349f-4d34-4c50-af8d-2cf8af786044 Arrange hot cooked linguine on serving plates. Slice chicken and arrange on each serving of linguine. Spoon sauce over each serving.
7997349f-4d34-4c50-af8d-2cf8af786044 Sprinkle servings with diced tomatoes and green onions.
7997349f-4d34-4c50-af8d-2cf8af786044 Serve and enjoy!
7317fb38-8667-4d50-be8d-bc39d781c881 Gather the ingredients.
7317fb38-8667-4d50-be8d-bc39d781c881 Fill a large pot with water. Add 2 tablespoons of salt and bring to a boil. Add chicken wings and cook on a low simmer for 15 minutes.
7317fb38-8667-4d50-be8d-bc39d781c881 Meanwhile, preheat grill to medium-high heat.
7317fb38-8667-4d50-be8d-bc39d781c881 Place honey into a microwave-safe dish and heat in the microwave for 15 to 20 seconds. Enough to loosed into a bit. Stir.
7317fb38-8667-4d50-be8d-bc39d781c881 Combine warmed honey with hot sauce, butter, lime juice, and 1 teaspoon of salt.
7317fb38-8667-4d50-be8d-bc39d781c881 With the chicken wings boiled (but not necessarily cooked through), divide sauce in half and place chicken wings in half of the sauce.
7317fb38-8667-4d50-be8d-bc39d781c881 Place wings on hot grill and cook until done, about 10 minutes or until the internal temperature of wings reaches 175 185 F.
7317fb38-8667-4d50-be8d-bc39d781c881 When done, remove wings from the grill and dip in the reserved sauce. Serve hot. Rewarm sauce if needed. Just place into the microwave for 10 to 15 seconds, stir and it's ready to go to the table.
6ce00fc8-1ad8-46f8-9f3d-6d197040f730 Gather the ingredients.
6ce00fc8-1ad8-46f8-9f3d-6d197040f730 Place chicken breasts on a large cutting board and cover with clear plastic wrap. Take a kitchen mallet and flatten breasts evenly to about 1/2 inch thick.
6ce00fc8-1ad8-46f8-9f3d-6d197040f730 Place remaining ingredients into a food processor and pulse to make the chimichurri sauce. Do not puree mixture, but leave a little texture to the ingredients.
6ce00fc8-1ad8-46f8-9f3d-6d197040f730 Place chicken breasts into a resealable plastic bag and pour chimichurri mixture over top. Make sure to coat chicken well with marinade before sealing bag. Place into the refrigerator for 2 to 6 hours in a refrigerator. The longer the marinade time, the more flavor will be infused into the breast.
6ce00fc8-1ad8-46f8-9f3d-6d197040f730 Preheat grill for medium-high heat.
6ce00fc8-1ad8-46f8-9f3d-6d197040f730 Take chicken out of the bag and discard marinade. Place chicken onto to grill and cook 5 minutes per side, or until the thickest part of the meat reaches 165 F. Remove from heat and serve.
6ce00fc8-1ad8-46f8-9f3d-6d197040f730 Serve and enjoy!
bc40b087-70ff-48f0-a227-2d68e6e40c68 Prepare the chicken by rinsing thoroughly with cold water. Drain excess water from the inside cavity and pat dry.
bc40b087-70ff-48f0-a227-2d68e6e40c68 Place chicken in a shallow baking dish and pour some of the lime juice over the top and inside the cavity. Grab the chicken by the breast skin and place your hand between the skin and the breast creating a pocket. Using a basting brush, baste lime juice into the breast meat pocket, making sure to reserve some for later. Rub under the skin with fresh chopped cilantro.
bc40b087-70ff-48f0-a227-2d68e6e40c68 Place chicken in a large glass baking dish and cover with plastic wrap. Place in the refrigerator for 1 hour.
bc40b087-70ff-48f0-a227-2d68e6e40c68 Preheat grill at high heat. Remove chicken from the refrigerator.
bc40b087-70ff-48f0-a227-2d68e6e40c68 Coat the entire chicken with taco seasoning, stuff with fresh lime halves deep into the chicken cavity and add a little fresh chopped cilantro.
bc40b087-70ff-48f0-a227-2d68e6e40c68 Place the chicken securely on the rotisserie rod and truss legs and wings with string. Cook chicken for 1 1/2 to 2 hours, or until the internal temperature is between 165-175 degrees F/75-80 degrees C.
924bd63f-471a-44a7-b97d-cf89efda21e3 Gather the ingredients.
924bd63f-471a-44a7-b97d-cf89efda21e3 Cut off and discard chicken wing tips and then cut each wing in half at the joint.
924bd63f-471a-44a7-b97d-cf89efda21e3 Preheat the broiler and oil the rack in the broiler pan. Line inside of broiler pan with foil to catch drips.
924bd63f-471a-44a7-b97d-cf89efda21e3 Arrange the chicken wings in a single layer on the oiled rack. Sprinkle with salt and freshly ground black pepper.
924bd63f-471a-44a7-b97d-cf89efda21e3 Combine remaining ingredients in a large bowl and whisk until well blended. Remove about 1/2 cup of the sauce and refrigerate until serving time. Set the remaining sauce aside.
924bd63f-471a-44a7-b97d-cf89efda21e3 Broil the chicken wings about 6 inches from the heat source, for 10 to 12 minutes. Turn them over and continue broiling for 10 to 12 minutes longer, turning frequently.
924bd63f-471a-44a7-b97d-cf89efda21e3 Put the wings in the bowl with the barbecue sauce and coat thoroughly. Place them back on the rack and broil for a few minutes longer, turning to heat both sides.
924bd63f-471a-44a7-b97d-cf89efda21e3 Serve immediately or transfer them to a slow cooker or chafing dish to keep warm on the low or warm setting.
3566f142-49c1-43e3-b1a0-fc36bc00cb54 Remove insides from the chicken and pat dry with paper towels.
3566f142-49c1-43e3-b1a0-fc36bc00cb54 Sprinkle the outside of the chicken evenly with the Cajun seasoning.
3566f142-49c1-43e3-b1a0-fc36bc00cb54 Fold the tips of the chicken wings behind the back of the chicken. Allow the chicken to stand at room temperature for about 20 minutes (if it's a hot day, refrigerate the chicken for 60 minutes).
3566f142-49c1-43e3-b1a0-fc36bc00cb54 Heat the barbecue grill to medium heat.
3566f142-49c1-43e3-b1a0-fc36bc00cb54 When the grill is heated to medium (about 400 F) open a 12-ounce can of beer. Pour about half the beer out of the can (preferably into a glass, to drink it while you're cooking). Make 3 or 4 additional holes in the top of the beer can with a can opener.
3566f142-49c1-43e3-b1a0-fc36bc00cb54 Set the beer can on a flat surface and place the cavity of the chicken directly over the can. With the can as the base, balance the bird on 3 points like a tripod, with the two legs and the can as the 3 points that stabilize the chicken.
3566f142-49c1-43e3-b1a0-fc36bc00cb54 Set the chicken on the hot grill directly over the coals or burners, stabilizing it on the grill just as it was on the flat surface. Close the lid and cook for 1 hour and 15 minutes. Check the temperature with a meat thermometer placed into the thick part of the thigh. The temperature should reach 170 F, and the juices should be clear and not pink.
3566f142-49c1-43e3-b1a0-fc36bc00cb54 If the temperature has not reached 170 F, continue cooking the chicken, checking the temperature every few minutes, until the temperature has reached 170 F.
3566f142-49c1-43e3-b1a0-fc36bc00cb54 Place a sturdy baking sheet or platter near the grill and carefully transfer the chicken to it. Allow the chicken to stand for 10 minutes, then carefully lift the chicken off the can of beer. Cut the chicken into serving pieces and serve.
3566f142-49c1-43e3-b1a0-fc36bc00cb54 The chicken is best hot but can be enjoyed cold or at room temperature.
f1bac72d-f978-4cfc-ba27-cee8d75ab676 Combine all marinade ingredients in a small bowl.
f1bac72d-f978-4cfc-ba27-cee8d75ab676 Remove giblets and wing tips from chicken.
f1bac72d-f978-4cfc-ba27-cee8d75ab676 Wash out the chicken cavity and pat dry.
f1bac72d-f978-4cfc-ba27-cee8d75ab676 Place chicken in a deep dish, coat with yogurt mixture, cover and allow the chicken to marinate in the refrigerator for 2 to 3 hours.
f1bac72d-f978-4cfc-ba27-cee8d75ab676 Preheat grill.
f1bac72d-f978-4cfc-ba27-cee8d75ab676 Remove chicken from dish and discard marinade.
f1bac72d-f978-4cfc-ba27-cee8d75ab676 Place chicken on rotisserie spit and cook over indirect medium-high heat for 2 hours, or until the internal temperature reaches between 165 and 170 F (75 C.)
f1bac72d-f978-4cfc-ba27-cee8d75ab676 If heat is too high, reduce and cook over medium heat instead.
f1bac72d-f978-4cfc-ba27-cee8d75ab676 Once cooked, remove from heat and loosely tent with aluminum foil.
f1bac72d-f978-4cfc-ba27-cee8d75ab676 Let chicken rest for 10 minutes before carving.
8d39e004-cd11-4d89-bde0-fe8ee7eead4c Gather the ingredients.
8d39e004-cd11-4d89-bde0-fe8ee7eead4c Mix all ingredients together in medium bowl.
8d39e004-cd11-4d89-bde0-fe8ee7eead4c Use immediately or store in an airtight container in a cool dry place (a cupboard will do), for up to 6 months after preparation.
8d39e004-cd11-4d89-bde0-fe8ee7eead4c Enjoy!
23a1fcbe-41f1-4bff-88fa-86e911ad3f40 Combine all ingredients except the chicken and mix well.
23a1fcbe-41f1-4bff-88fa-86e911ad3f40 Separate out 1/3 of the mixture and brush over the entire surface of the chicken inside and out. It's best if you can get as much as possible under the skin, particularly over the breasts.
23a1fcbe-41f1-4bff-88fa-86e911ad3f40 Place chicken on rotisserie spit and grill over medium-low heat on the grill with a drip pan under the chicken. After 20 minutes of cooking time brush with part of remaining of the mixture.
23a1fcbe-41f1-4bff-88fa-86e911ad3f40 Repeat after another 20 minutes.
23a1fcbe-41f1-4bff-88fa-86e911ad3f40 Continue grilling until chicken has reached an internal temperature of 165 F in multiple areas, particularly the thigh area. Chicken should take about 1 1/2 hours to cook.
23a1fcbe-41f1-4bff-88fa-86e911ad3f40 Remove from heat and let chicken rest for 10 minutes before carving.
23a1fcbe-41f1-4bff-88fa-86e911ad3f40 Serve and enjoy!
922056cf-6917-44d8-95a4-83b9157d15c2 Preheat an electric skillet to 275 F. Add oil.
922056cf-6917-44d8-95a4-83b9157d15c2 Season chicken on both sides with salt and pepper. When oil is hot, add chicken to the skillet. Brown for 2 minutes on the first side. Flip.
922056cf-6917-44d8-95a4-83b9157d15c2 Add the barbecue sauce and orange soda.
922056cf-6917-44d8-95a4-83b9157d15c2 Cook, basting occasionally, 35-40 minutes until chicken is cooked through.
44c79578-4690-434b-8086-fe3b87e8eeec Gather the ingredients.
44c79578-4690-434b-8086-fe3b87e8eeec Pat the turkey legs dry.
44c79578-4690-434b-8086-fe3b87e8eeec In a large pot, combine the soda, sugar, hot sauce, red pepper flakes, and black pepper. Bring to a low boil and add the turkey legs.
44c79578-4690-434b-8086-fe3b87e8eeec Boil over medium heat for about 30 minutes or until the turkey legs register an internal temperature of 165 F/74 C. Preheat the grill to medium heat.
44c79578-4690-434b-8086-fe3b87e8eeec Place the onion slices on the heated grill and put the turkey legs on top of the onion slices.
44c79578-4690-434b-8086-fe3b87e8eeec Brush with the turkey legs honey and sprinkle them with the steak seasoning.
44c79578-4690-434b-8086-fe3b87e8eeec Grill over a medium heat for about 15 minutes watching carefully to avoid burning. Turn the turkey legs as needed. The skin should be crispy brown and the legs should reach an internal temperature of between 165 to 175 F when done.
44c79578-4690-434b-8086-fe3b87e8eeec Once cooked, remove the turkey legs from the grill.
44c79578-4690-434b-8086-fe3b87e8eeec Serve with your choice of sides and enjoy!
6187e857-ac49-4750-888f-98555ef34f2e Combine the yogurt, salt, black pepper, turmeric, mustard, curry powder, cardamom, lemon juice, and vinegar in a large glass or plastic bowl.
6187e857-ac49-4750-888f-98555ef34f2e Add the cubed chicken into the bowl, toss to combine, cover with plastic wrap, and place in the refrigerator for 1 to 4 hours.
6187e857-ac49-4750-888f-98555ef34f2e Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
6187e857-ac49-4750-888f-98555ef34f2e Remove the chicken pieces and thread onto skewers, alternating with the sliced onion, using about 5 pieces of chicken per skewer.
6187e857-ac49-4750-888f-98555ef34f2e Place the kebabs on the grill and cook for 10 to 12 minutes, turning occasionally, until cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 165 F.
6187e857-ac49-4750-888f-98555ef34f2e Remove from the heat and garnish with tomato slices, green pepper rings, and fresh mint or parsley.
b8b14377-4347-4f26-8298-fa7792d21930 Combine all ingredients except the chicken and pour into a shallow baking dish or resealable plastic bag. Add chicken and turn to coat.
b8b14377-4347-4f26-8298-fa7792d21930 Cover and place in refrigerator to marinate in jerk seasoning for 30 minutes to 1 hour. Preheat grill. Remove chicken from jerk marinade and pour marinade into a saucepan.
b8b14377-4347-4f26-8298-fa7792d21930 Bring to a boil. Place chicken on grill cooking approximately 7 to 10 minutes per side (or until done), basting periodically with remaining cooked jerk marinade.
00a3c633-1eaf-4189-90bd-0be6e7a98b5d Gather the ingredients.
00a3c633-1eaf-4189-90bd-0be6e7a98b5d In a small bowl, combine 1/2 cup/120 mL soy sauce with the sake (or dry sherry), sugar, ginger, and chives. Mix well, ensuring the sugar is dissolved.
00a3c633-1eaf-4189-90bd-0be6e7a98b5d Place chicken pieces and half of the marinade in a resealable plastic bag. Toss to coat and refrigerate for about 1 hour. Reserve the remaining marinade for grilling.
00a3c633-1eaf-4189-90bd-0be6e7a98b5d Preheat the grill to medium-high heat. Remove chicken from the marinade and thread onto skewers, alternating the chicken with the scallions. Discard the marinade.
00a3c633-1eaf-4189-90bd-0be6e7a98b5d Place the skewers on the hot grill. Brush with the reserved marinade during the first 2 to 4 minutes and grill for a total of about 6 to 8 minutes (internal temperature of 165 F), turning the skewers a few times.
00a3c633-1eaf-4189-90bd-0be6e7a98b5d In a small saucepan, heat up the remaining 1/2 cup/120 mL of soy sauce to use for dipping.
00a3c633-1eaf-4189-90bd-0be6e7a98b5d Serve and enjoy!
1133b562-c2ee-4636-8446-b3ee7ca5803d ﻿Gather the ingredients.
1133b562-c2ee-4636-8446-b3ee7ca5803d In a medium sized container add the salt, sugar, and peppercorns. Add 1/2 cup of boiling or very hot water, and stir until the salt and sugar are mostly dissolved. Add another 3 cups of very cold water, maybe a few ice cubes. Place the pork chops in the brine, and let them sit at room temperature for about 45 minutes.
1133b562-c2ee-4636-8446-b3ee7ca5803d Preheat a grill to medium high.
1133b562-c2ee-4636-8446-b3ee7ca5803d Remove the pork chops from the brine and pat dry with paper towels. Wrap each pork chop with a piece of prosciutto, pressing so that the prosciutto seals itself.
1133b562-c2ee-4636-8446-b3ee7ca5803d Brush the pork chops with olive oil and grill for about 4 minute on each side until the just pink in the center, or cooed to an internal temperature of 140°F.
1133b562-c2ee-4636-8446-b3ee7ca5803d Let the chops sit for a minute or so before serving.
7304aed3-fa55-4131-9679-89c618bebc68 Gather the ingredients.
7304aed3-fa55-4131-9679-89c618bebc68 Put the pork shoulder in the slow cooker, cutting the roast to fit if necessary.
7304aed3-fa55-4131-9679-89c618bebc68 Add the water or other liquid and sprinkle the pork lightly with kosher salt, freshly ground black pepper, and cayenne pepper, if using.
7304aed3-fa55-4131-9679-89c618bebc68 Cover and cook on LOW for 7 to 9 hours.
7304aed3-fa55-4131-9679-89c618bebc68 Drain off the excess liquids, shred the meat with two forks, and discard any excess fat and bone.
7304aed3-fa55-4131-9679-89c618bebc68 Return the meat to the crockpot and pour about 1 cup of barbecue sauce over. Cover and cook another 1 to 2 hours.
7304aed3-fa55-4131-9679-89c618bebc68 Serve the shredded barbecued pork with extra barbecue sauce on the side.
92b8751d-e517-46e1-aeeb-6a9caeebbead Gather the ingredients.
92b8751d-e517-46e1-aeeb-6a9caeebbead Combine all the sauce ingredients in a small saucepan until brown sugar is dissolved. Remove sauce from the heat and allow to cool for about 10 to 15 minutes.
92b8751d-e517-46e1-aeeb-6a9caeebbead Remove membrane from back of ribs and any extra fatty pieces. Place the ribs in a large dish.
92b8751d-e517-46e1-aeeb-6a9caeebbead Cover ribs with half of the sauce and allow to marinate in the refrigerator for 5 to 6 hours. Reserve the other half of sauce for later.
92b8751d-e517-46e1-aeeb-6a9caeebbead Preheat grill for medium heat.
92b8751d-e517-46e1-aeeb-6a9caeebbead Remove ribs from the dish, reserve marinade.
92b8751d-e517-46e1-aeeb-6a9caeebbead Place the ribs on the grill and allow them to cook for 20 minutes, turning once.
92b8751d-e517-46e1-aeeb-6a9caeebbead Cover ribs loosely with foil and cook for an additional hour and a half.
92b8751d-e517-46e1-aeeb-6a9caeebbead Once ribs reach an internal temperature of 165 F, remove from heat, place on a cutting board, and let ribs rest for 5 to 10 minutes.
92b8751d-e517-46e1-aeeb-6a9caeebbead Carefully open foil packaging and discard.
92b8751d-e517-46e1-aeeb-6a9caeebbead Heat reserved sauce, brush some over ribs, and carve.
92b8751d-e517-46e1-aeeb-6a9caeebbead Serve the remaining sauce with ribs.
691c6b36-1c80-41e2-a15c-7fcfff7e055e Gather the ingredients.
691c6b36-1c80-41e2-a15c-7fcfff7e055e Place one sliced onion at the bottom of the slow cooker.
691c6b36-1c80-41e2-a15c-7fcfff7e055e Stud the pork roast with cloves (or put them in a small cheesecloth bag or tea strainer), if using. Season with salt and pepper.
691c6b36-1c80-41e2-a15c-7fcfff7e055e Place the pork in the slow cooker on top of the sliced onion. Cover with the second sliced onion and add 2 cups of water.
691c6b36-1c80-41e2-a15c-7fcfff7e055e Cover and cook on low 9 to 12 hours, or until the pork is very tender and falling apart.
691c6b36-1c80-41e2-a15c-7fcfff7e055e Remove the pork roast from the pot. Remove and discard the cloves and excess fat and liquids along with bones if the roast was not boneless. You may also discard the sliced onions, if desired.
691c6b36-1c80-41e2-a15c-7fcfff7e055e When the pork roast is cool enough to handle, use a fork or your fingers to pull it apart until the entire roast is shredded. If you make pulled pork often, you might want to buy meat shredding claws.
691c6b36-1c80-41e2-a15c-7fcfff7e055e Return the pulled pork to the slow cooker. Add the finely chopped onion, barbecue sauce, and optional red pepper flakes, and optional liquid smoke. Cover the pot and continue to cook on the high setting for 1 to 2 hours, or until the onions are tender.
691c6b36-1c80-41e2-a15c-7fcfff7e055e Serve the pulled pork on large, crusty buns with your favorite barbecue sauce. Garnish with dill pickles, thinly sliced raw onion, and pickled banana peppers. Serve with crisp, homemade slaw, either piled on the pork sandwiches or on the side.
0b2d98a1-1fff-415e-90d1-4e961eb158c7 To make rub, place peppercorns and mustard seed in a coffee grinder. Pulverize into a medium grind and place in a small bowl. Add remaining rub ingredients.
0b2d98a1-1fff-415e-90d1-4e961eb158c7 Season pork shoulder all over with rub, wrap in plastic, and place in refrigerator for 12 to 15 hours.
0b2d98a1-1fff-415e-90d1-4e961eb158c7 Remove roast from the fridge and let meat stand at room temperature for 30 to 45 minutes before grilling. Season with kosher salt right before putting it onto the grill.
0b2d98a1-1fff-415e-90d1-4e961eb158c7 While roast is resting, whisk ingredients for mop in a medium bowl. Set aside until ready to use.
0b2d98a1-1fff-415e-90d1-4e961eb158c7 Preheat grill and follow instructions for using the rotisserie. Secure roast on rotisserie rod and cook over direct low heat for 3 1/2 to 4 hours. The internal temperature should be at least 145 F/63 C when done.
0b2d98a1-1fff-415e-90d1-4e961eb158c7 After the first hour of cooking, apply mop every 20 minutes for the remainder of cook time. Remove roast from the rotisserie, cover with foil, and let stand 10 minutes before slicing.
5b149297-277b-410b-9d87-d473469de0c6 Gather the dry rub ingredients and ham.
5b149297-277b-410b-9d87-d473469de0c6 Make the Rub: The night before you smoke the ham, mix together the pepper, paprika, sugar, salt, dry mustard, and cayenne in a small bowl.
5b149297-277b-410b-9d87-d473469de0c6 Rub the spice mixture over the surface of the ham.
5b149297-277b-410b-9d87-d473469de0c6 Wrap the ham in aluminum foil and let it sit in the refrigerator overnight to soak up all the flavors.
5b149297-277b-410b-9d87-d473469de0c6 The next morning, remove the ham from the refrigerator and let it sit for 1 hour.
5b149297-277b-410b-9d87-d473469de0c6 Gather the basting sauce ingredients and ham.
5b149297-277b-410b-9d87-d473469de0c6 Prepare the smoker. You will be smoking at about 210 F/100 C for 5 to 6 hours, or until the ham reaches 140 F. (If you use a digital meat thermometer you can set the temperature to 140 F and you'll be notified once the ham reaches the desired temperature.)
5b149297-277b-410b-9d87-d473469de0c6 Make the basting sauce: In a saucepan, mix together the chicken stock, pineapple juice, vegetable oil, dry mustard, and ground cloves. Warm over medium heat until completely mixed.
5b149297-277b-410b-9d87-d473469de0c6 Score the ham with a sharp knife, scoring in a diamond pattern about 1/4-inch deep.
5b149297-277b-410b-9d87-d473469de0c6 Tent the scored ham with foil to prevent it from drying out, and place ham in the smoker.
5b149297-277b-410b-9d87-d473469de0c6 Baste the ham with the sauce once every hour, re-covering the ham with the foil.
5b149297-277b-410b-9d87-d473469de0c6 Gather the glaze ingredients.
5b149297-277b-410b-9d87-d473469de0c6 While the ham is smoking, prepare the glaze: Mix together the honey, pineapple juice, dry mustard, and a pinch of ground cloves.
5b149297-277b-410b-9d87-d473469de0c6 Brush the ham generously with the glaze a couple of times during the last hour of smoking, re-covering with the foil to prevent drying out.
5b149297-277b-410b-9d87-d473469de0c6 Serve with your favorite sides and enjoy.
b25f1f14-10a3-4ad5-ae38-e6c79e5e1304 Gather the ingredients.
b25f1f14-10a3-4ad5-ae38-e6c79e5e1304 In a small bowl or container, mix all of the ingredients: brown sugar, paprika, salt, black pepper, cayenne, and dry mustard. Make sure there are no clumps fro the brown sugar and that it all has a fine consistency.
b25f1f14-10a3-4ad5-ae38-e6c79e5e1304 Seal the container until you are ready to use the rub.
b25f1f14-10a3-4ad5-ae38-e6c79e5e1304 Enjoy!
408cb0cc-3f88-404d-994b-cc8d93cff949 Gather the ingredients.
408cb0cc-3f88-404d-994b-cc8d93cff949 Preheat the oven to 450 F.
408cb0cc-3f88-404d-994b-cc8d93cff949 In a bowl, combine the chili powder, garlic powder, salt, pepper, onion powder, and ground mustard.
408cb0cc-3f88-404d-994b-cc8d93cff949 Place the pork in a roasting pan and rub all over with the spice mixture.
408cb0cc-3f88-404d-994b-cc8d93cff949 Roast the pork for 1 hour. Remove from the oven.
408cb0cc-3f88-404d-994b-cc8d93cff949 Reduce the oven temperature to 325 F. Pour apple juice over the roast and sprinkle the chopped garlic over the juice. Cover the roasting pan tightly with foil, return to the oven, and roast for about 2 to 2 1/2 hours, or until the pork is tender and easy to shred with a fork.
408cb0cc-3f88-404d-994b-cc8d93cff949 Meanwhile, prepare the barbecue sauce. In a saucepan, combine the ketchup, cider vinegar, onion, Worcestershire sauce, brown sugar, mustard, and garlic powder. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Simmer, uncovered and stirring occasionally, for about 15 minutes, or until thickened.
408cb0cc-3f88-404d-994b-cc8d93cff949 Remove the pork from the liquids, shred, and serve with the sauce.
408cb0cc-3f88-404d-994b-cc8d93cff949 If desired, mix about 1 cup of the sauce into the shredded pork and serve hot from a slow cooker or chafing dish. Serve with the reserved sauce.
9bd9f124-b152-4379-af0f-cce9fb2066c6 Gather the ingredients.
9bd9f124-b152-4379-af0f-cce9fb2066c6 Spray a 4-quart slow cooker with nonstick cooking spray.
9bd9f124-b152-4379-af0f-cce9fb2066c6 Cut the ribs into 2 or 3 rib portions and place them in the prepared slow cooker.
9bd9f124-b152-4379-af0f-cce9fb2066c6 Sprinkle the ribs with salt and pepper and pour cola over all of it.
9bd9f124-b152-4379-af0f-cce9fb2066c6 Cover the crockpot and cook on low for 8 to 9 hours until the ribs are tender and at least 170 F.
9bd9f124-b152-4379-af0f-cce9fb2066c6 Drain the liquid from the slow cooker and discard.
9bd9f124-b152-4379-af0f-cce9fb2066c6 Pour the barbecue sauce and thyme into the crock pot on top of the drained ribs and mix so the ribs are coated.
9bd9f124-b152-4379-af0f-cce9fb2066c6 Cover the crock pot and cook on low for 1 to 2 hours until ribs are glazed.
9bd9f124-b152-4379-af0f-cce9fb2066c6 Serve immediately.
df828bc2-dc90-4e6b-87a2-2dd50db62eae Gather the ingredients.
df828bc2-dc90-4e6b-87a2-2dd50db62eae In a small bowl, whisk together water, vinegar, mustard, oil, chili powder, garlic powder, and cayenne until well mixed.
df828bc2-dc90-4e6b-87a2-2dd50db62eae Let the flavors marry for a few hours in the refrigerator before using.
df828bc2-dc90-4e6b-87a2-2dd50db62eae This mop can be stored covered in the refrigerator for about one week.
038992ed-db05-44b6-a098-fd207adeeacc Mix all ingredients together.
038992ed-db05-44b6-a098-fd207adeeacc Store in an airtight container and keep in a cool and dark place. Can be stored for up to 6 months after preparation.
038992ed-db05-44b6-a098-fd207adeeacc Apply rub evenly over ribs. The general rule is what sticks is the perfect amount.
50f498c4-4355-4f4c-9509-e03c12b530d4 Combine marinade ingredients in a small bowl.
50f498c4-4355-4f4c-9509-e03c12b530d4 Place the pork chops in a shallow glass dish.
50f498c4-4355-4f4c-9509-e03c12b530d4 Pour marinade over chops, cover, and allow to marinate in the refrigerator for 1 to 3 hours.
50f498c4-4355-4f4c-9509-e03c12b530d4 Preheat grill for medium heat.
50f498c4-4355-4f4c-9509-e03c12b530d4 Remove the chops from glass dish and discard marinade.
50f498c4-4355-4f4c-9509-e03c12b530d4 Place pork chops on a lightly oiled grill rack and allow to cook for 20 to 25 minutes, turning once.
50f498c4-4355-4f4c-9509-e03c12b530d4 Once internal temperature reaches 145 F/65 C, the until the pork chops are done.
50f498c4-4355-4f4c-9509-e03c12b530d4 Remove from the heat, let the pork chops rest for 5 minutes and serve with your favorite sides.
c5294e8f-c8e5-4240-bddc-5d5cec69e77b Gather the ingredients.
c5294e8f-c8e5-4240-bddc-5d5cec69e77b Prepare glaze first. Bring ketchup, brown sugar, maple syrup, and water to a simmer over medium heat. Stir often and watch for burning. Reduce heat if necessary. Add cider vinegar and salt. Stir through. Add bourbon and let the mixture simmer for 3-4 more minutes over medium-low heat. Once all ingredients are well combined and sugar has melted through, remove glaze from heat and let cool.
c5294e8f-c8e5-4240-bddc-5d5cec69e77b Preheat grill for medium heat with indirect cooking.
c5294e8f-c8e5-4240-bddc-5d5cec69e77b Cut off any straggling pieces of fat or meat from the spare ribs. Using a paper towel, grasp membrane on the back of the ribs and pull away from the bone.
c5294e8f-c8e5-4240-bddc-5d5cec69e77b Blot the rack of ribs dry with paper towels. Combine seasoning rub and apply all over ribs, front and back.
c5294e8f-c8e5-4240-bddc-5d5cec69e77b Place ribs onto the grill and cook for 2 to 3 hours or until the internal temperature of the meat reaches at least 185 F. Adjust heat and placement of ribs on the grill as needed.
c5294e8f-c8e5-4240-bddc-5d5cec69e77b Warm the glaze in the microwave or stove top. There is no need to bring it back to a simmer, but warm it enough so that it doesn't reduce the temperature of the ribs on the grill once applied.
c5294e8f-c8e5-4240-bddc-5d5cec69e77b Begin brushing glaze onto ribs during the second half of grilling or when they reach an internal temperature of about 135 degrees. Repeat process several times during the remaining cook time. This will provide you with a nice caramelized candied coating on the ribs.
c5294e8f-c8e5-4240-bddc-5d5cec69e77b Once they have reached the appropriate temperature, remove ribs from grill and tent with foil. Let meat rest for 10 minutes before slicing. Slice between bones and serve with your favorite sides.
c5294e8f-c8e5-4240-bddc-5d5cec69e77b If you'd like a little extra glaze for the table, simply double the recipe and divide mixture in half. Save one-half for basting and other to serve with the cooked ribs.
c5294e8f-c8e5-4240-bddc-5d5cec69e77b Serve and enjoy.
a925c1e1-387b-495e-8356-b4147fdea973 Place pork roast in the slow cooker insert; add chopped onion, salt and pepper and a generous sprinkling of garlic powder.
a925c1e1-387b-495e-8356-b4147fdea973 Cover and cook on low for about 9 to 11 hours, or until very tender and shreddable.
a925c1e1-387b-495e-8356-b4147fdea973 Drain all juices off and shred or chop pork; add vinegar and barbecue sauce (and liquid smoke, if using).
a925c1e1-387b-495e-8356-b4147fdea973 Continue cooking on high for about 1 hour. Serve with buns and tangy coleslaw for topping.
a925c1e1-387b-495e-8356-b4147fdea973 The recipe makes about 8 to 10 generous servings.
a9dd7095-0393-4ed7-8981-969d3294dda7 Heat oven to 350 F. Line a 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking pan with aluminum foil.
a9dd7095-0393-4ed7-8981-969d3294dda7 Arrange the pork chops in a single layer in the foil-lined pan and scatter the onion slices over the chops.
a9dd7095-0393-4ed7-8981-969d3294dda7 To make the barbecue sauce, whisk together all of the ingredients in a bowl until thoroughly combined. Pour the sauce over the pork chops.
a9dd7095-0393-4ed7-8981-969d3294dda7 Bake the pork chops, uncovered, for 1 hour, or until the meat is tender.
a9dd7095-0393-4ed7-8981-969d3294dda7 Transfer the pork chops to a platter and spoon the sauce over them.
bf490635-d176-4a29-bcfb-6f230969c223 In a saucepan, melt butter and add flour, stirring well to form a roux. Cook for about 1-2 minutes.
bf490635-d176-4a29-bcfb-6f230969c223 Add milk 1/2 a cup/120 mL at a time while whisking mixture together.
bf490635-d176-4a29-bcfb-6f230969c223 Add cheese and all ingredients except, jalapenos. Whisk until thick and melted through. This process should take about 8-10 minutes total.
bf490635-d176-4a29-bcfb-6f230969c223 Once cheese sauce has reached a good thick consistency, add jalapenos and stir through.
bf490635-d176-4a29-bcfb-6f230969c223 Keep cheese sauce on a warm setting until the hot dogs are cooked.
bf490635-d176-4a29-bcfb-6f230969c223 Preheat grill for medium-high heat.
bf490635-d176-4a29-bcfb-6f230969c223 Wrap each hot dog with a strip of bacon. You might need to cut bacon to fit.
bf490635-d176-4a29-bcfb-6f230969c223 Place hot dogs onto the grill and cook for 8 minutes, occasionally turning until the hot dog is cooked and bacon is good and crisp.
bf490635-d176-4a29-bcfb-6f230969c223 Remove from heat, place into a warmed hot dog or deli bun, top with cheese sauce and serve.
2b064a0c-5eaf-4b2f-903b-c4e59d28ab12 Gather the ingredients.
2b064a0c-5eaf-4b2f-903b-c4e59d28ab12 In a medium mixing bowl, combine rub ingredients into a paste. Coat pork shoulder with rub, cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate 1 hour.
2b064a0c-5eaf-4b2f-903b-c4e59d28ab12 Preheat smoker and prepare for an 8-hour smoke. Make sure wood chips are soaked and drained before using them. Add charcoal and wood chips as necessary to keep the temperature low, or between 200 and 225 F/95 to 110 C. Smoke pork shoulder for about 8 hours or until internal temperatures reach 185 F/85 C.
2b064a0c-5eaf-4b2f-903b-c4e59d28ab12 Once the pork is cooked, remove from the smoker. Wrap tightly in foil and allow to sit for an hour. While pork is resting, prepare finishing sauce. Blend together everything except the ketchup.
2b064a0c-5eaf-4b2f-903b-c4e59d28ab12 Pour into a saucepan and add the ketchup. Simmer over low heat for 15 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside.
2b064a0c-5eaf-4b2f-903b-c4e59d28ab12 Unwrap pork butt and shred. Combine pork with 1/3 of the table sauce. Keep warm and serve on white bread buns with remaining sauce on the side. Top with coleslaw.
2b064a0c-5eaf-4b2f-903b-c4e59d28ab12 Enjoy!
7590755f-ffd3-444c-8a5c-c0a16c85ec41 Heat oven to 325 F.
7590755f-ffd3-444c-8a5c-c0a16c85ec41 In a large Dutch oven or kettle, heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Rub ribs all over with the seasoning blend then sear on all sides, about 2 minutes on each side.
7590755f-ffd3-444c-8a5c-c0a16c85ec41 Remove the ribs and set aside. Add bacon to the pot and cook for about 3 to 4 minutes, or until cooked but not crisp. Add the onions and cook, stirring, for 2 minutes. Add the ribs back to the pot and add apple juice, beef broth, and cider vinegar; bring to a simmer. cover tightly and bake for 2 hours. Add the cabbage, cover, and continue cooking, basting occasionally, for about 30 to 45 minutes longer, or until cabbage is tender.
eb8cde5c-329f-47b6-9d71-80254e940e5b Gather the ingredients. Preheat the oven to 325 F.
eb8cde5c-329f-47b6-9d71-80254e940e5b In a small saucepan, heat the butter with the vinegar, water, brown sugar, garlic powder, onion powder, and black and cayenne peppers. Cook, stirring until butter has melted.
eb8cde5c-329f-47b6-9d71-80254e940e5b Remove from the heat, let cool a bit, and then cover the sauce and refrigerate until it's time to baste the ribs.
eb8cde5c-329f-47b6-9d71-80254e940e5b Remove the silver skin from the back of the ribs. Use a kitchen towel or paper towel to grasp the edge of the skin and then pull. It should pull off in one piece.
eb8cde5c-329f-47b6-9d71-80254e940e5b Cut the pork ribs into serving size pieces of one, two, or three ribs each. Place the spareribs on a rack in a roasting pan, meaty-side up.
eb8cde5c-329f-47b6-9d71-80254e940e5b Roast uncovered for about 1 1/2 hours.
eb8cde5c-329f-47b6-9d71-80254e940e5b Brush with the sauce and continue roasting for about 45 minutes to 1 hour, turning and brushing with the sauce several times, until ribs are cooked through.
eb8cde5c-329f-47b6-9d71-80254e940e5b Serve with your favorite sides and enjoy!
da01f92e-3b7a-4bb6-b91b-0884a9fb94e4 Heat oven to 350 F.
da01f92e-3b7a-4bb6-b91b-0884a9fb94e4 Slice pork tenderloins crosswise into rounds about one inch thick. Lightly sprinkle both sides of the medallions with salt and pepper; press both sides into the flour.
da01f92e-3b7a-4bb6-b91b-0884a9fb94e4 Put enough olive oil in a large nonstick skillet or sauté pan to coat the bottom of the pan; heat over medium heat. Add the pork medallions and brown for about 2 minutes on each side. Remove the medallions to a plate.
da01f92e-3b7a-4bb6-b91b-0884a9fb94e4 Add the mushrooms and green onions to the pan. Cook until mushrooms are just tender.
da01f92e-3b7a-4bb6-b91b-0884a9fb94e4 Meanwhile, combine the glaze ingredients in a bowl; stir to blend thoroughly.
da01f92e-3b7a-4bb6-b91b-0884a9fb94e4 Put the pork tenderloin back in the skillet and pour glaze over all; stir to coat all pieces of pork.
da01f92e-3b7a-4bb6-b91b-0884a9fb94e4 Transfer to the oven and bake for 20 to 25 minutes, stirring once. (If the skillet is not ovenproof, transfer everything to a baking pan.)
da01f92e-3b7a-4bb6-b91b-0884a9fb94e4 Serve pork with glaze. Enjoy!
0a22861b-e667-4c9a-a72b-5a41896a67d8 Gather the ingredients.
0a22861b-e667-4c9a-a72b-5a41896a67d8 Combine all ingredients in a saucepan and simmer while stirring until the sugar dissolves.
0a22861b-e667-4c9a-a72b-5a41896a67d8 Remove from heat and serve warm.
0a22861b-e667-4c9a-a72b-5a41896a67d8 Serve with your favorite pulled pork recipe.
0a22861b-e667-4c9a-a72b-5a41896a67d8 Enjoy!
69d14319-4ffc-4dd8-b713-2e401dfd8fdc Heat the oven to 375 F. Line a large rimmed baking or roasting pan with foil.
69d14319-4ffc-4dd8-b713-2e401dfd8fdc Arrange the ribs in the prepared pan and sprinkle all over with the kosher salt, freshly ground black pepper, and garlic powder. Let the ribs stand for about 10 minutes.
69d14319-4ffc-4dd8-b713-2e401dfd8fdc Bake for about 1 to 1 1/2 hours, or until the ribs are very tender.
69d14319-4ffc-4dd8-b713-2e401dfd8fdc In 1-quart saucepan, mix together remaining ingredients. Simmer for 10 minutes.
69d14319-4ffc-4dd8-b713-2e401dfd8fdc Prepare the grill.
69d14319-4ffc-4dd8-b713-2e401dfd8fdc Remove the ribs from the baking pan and brush with sauce.
69d14319-4ffc-4dd8-b713-2e401dfd8fdc Grill over direct heat, basting and turning frequently, for about 15 minutes, or until browned.
4be9a5be-9bf9-4b26-a1f7-e902bb429ede Gather the ingredients.
4be9a5be-9bf9-4b26-a1f7-e902bb429ede Fire up the grill.
4be9a5be-9bf9-4b26-a1f7-e902bb429ede In a medium bowl, mix the softened cream cheese and shredded colby jack together. Transfer to a pastry bag fitted with a round tip. If you don't have a pastry bag, use a zip-lock freezer bag, then use scissors to cut away one of the corners.
4be9a5be-9bf9-4b26-a1f7-e902bb429ede Cut off the stem end of the jalapenos. Use a small, thin knife - such as a grapefruit or steak knife - to remove the seeds and soft white membranes inside the peppers, leaving a hollow cone, open at one end. Take care not to split the peppers.
4be9a5be-9bf9-4b26-a1f7-e902bb429ede Pipe the cheese mixture into the peppers.
4be9a5be-9bf9-4b26-a1f7-e902bb429ede Divide the sausage into 12 4-ounce portions. Flatten each of the portions into a thin oval, then wrap the sausage around the stuffed peppers, encasing them completely. If your jalapenos vary in size and shape you may have to make some adjustments in order to fully wrap them.
4be9a5be-9bf9-4b26-a1f7-e902bb429ede Sear the armadillo eggs on the grill with direct heat for about 2 minutes on each side, then reduce the heat and move them to a spot with indirect heat, if possible, and close the grill. Cook for about 15 minutes, or until the cheese begins to escape, bubbling through its sausage enclosure. Remove from the grill and serve immediately.
56b65f0b-76fd-4dd2-949b-57054a03ef5f Gather the ingredients.
56b65f0b-76fd-4dd2-949b-57054a03ef5f Combine all ingredients. Store in an airtight container.
56b65f0b-76fd-4dd2-949b-57054a03ef5f Apply to ribs while they are smoking in small amounts.
eb1af5f3-ff4f-44c7-8844-15d10b3f72a2 Cut pork tenderloin into 6 to 8 1-inch round pieces. Place pork into a resealable plastic bag. Add sprigs of thyme and rosemary. Combine remaining ingredients in a small bowl. Pour mixture over pork, seal bag, and allow to marinate in the refrigerator for 4 to 12 hours.
eb1af5f3-ff4f-44c7-8844-15d10b3f72a2 Preheat the grill for medium heat. Remove pork from bag and place onto grill. Reserve marinade. Brush with marinade and cook for 7 minutes. Turn pork and cook for additional 7 minutes. When the meat reaches 140 degrees F/60 degrees C, remove from grill and serve. Discard any remaining marinade.
354991cf-8042-4088-a5ad-9353eb24bc2c Place pork chops into​ a resealable plastic bag.
354991cf-8042-4088-a5ad-9353eb24bc2c Combine marinade ingredients and pour over chops.
354991cf-8042-4088-a5ad-9353eb24bc2c Make sure meat is well coated.
354991cf-8042-4088-a5ad-9353eb24bc2c Seal bag and place into refrigerator for 1 to 1 1/2 hours.
354991cf-8042-4088-a5ad-9353eb24bc2c Preheat grill for medium-high heat.
354991cf-8042-4088-a5ad-9353eb24bc2c Remove chops from bag and place onto grill.
354991cf-8042-4088-a5ad-9353eb24bc2c Cook for 10 minutes per side, or until internal temperature reaches 165 F (75 C).
354991cf-8042-4088-a5ad-9353eb24bc2c Once cooked, remove from grill and let rest for 5 minutes before serving.
1b3eeb62-e6aa-430e-b6b0-30d63112791a Mix together parsley, garlic, oil, rosemary, orange and lemon peel, sugar, oregano, salt, and pepper.
1b3eeb62-e6aa-430e-b6b0-30d63112791a Spread mixture over each chop, cover and refrigerate for 4 to 24 hours.
1b3eeb62-e6aa-430e-b6b0-30d63112791a Preheat grill as hot as it will go.
1b3eeb62-e6aa-430e-b6b0-30d63112791a Using either a table knife or spoon, remove as much of the marinade from the chops as you can and grill pork chops for 2 to 3 minutes on each side.
1b3eeb62-e6aa-430e-b6b0-30d63112791a Once chops reach an internal temperature between 145 to 150 F, remove from heat and let rest for a few minutes.
1b3eeb62-e6aa-430e-b6b0-30d63112791a Serve with your favorite sides.
152c2c4d-9daf-4a39-9090-18c15209cacb Place pork loin in a large glass baking dish. Combine marinade in and pour over meat. Make sure all sides are well coated with mixture. Cover with plastic wrap and place in refrigerator for 4 to 6 hours.
152c2c4d-9daf-4a39-9090-18c15209cacb Preheat grill for medium-high heat. Place onto grill and sear for 2 minutes on each side. Reduce heat to medium or medium-low and grill pork roast for 45 minutes or until internal temperature reaches 165 F, in thickest part of the meat. Once cooked through, remove heat and let meat rest before carving.
8b5861c0-fcd5-43b6-abfc-1bed566595a3 Place pork shoulder roast in a lightly greased 3 1/2 to 5-quart slow cooker.
8b5861c0-fcd5-43b6-abfc-1bed566595a3 Combine onion, barbecue sauce, honey, and hot pepper; pour over roast.
8b5861c0-fcd5-43b6-abfc-1bed566595a3 Cover and cook on LOW setting for 7 to 9 hours.
8b5861c0-fcd5-43b6-abfc-1bed566595a3 Serve on buns, topped with slaw if desired.
9a93795b-ea67-4c71-adfe-c5bc45377cc5 Combine the dry ingredients in a saucepan. Slowly add vinegar, stirring until it's well mixed.
9a93795b-ea67-4c71-adfe-c5bc45377cc5 Add remaining ingredients and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer, stirring frequently for about 10 minutes.
54a3845c-bb43-4cd0-95db-eecc85d4467c Combine all ingredients, except pork chops, in a medium bowl.
54a3845c-bb43-4cd0-95db-eecc85d4467c Place pork chops in a resealable plastic bag and add ​the marinade.
54a3845c-bb43-4cd0-95db-eecc85d4467c Seal and place in refrigerator for 6 to 8 hours. Make sure to turn every hour.
54a3845c-bb43-4cd0-95db-eecc85d4467c Take the chops out of the refrigerator and remove from marinade. Save marinade for basting.
54a3845c-bb43-4cd0-95db-eecc85d4467c Preheat grill for medium heat.
