54a3845c-bb43-4cd0-95db-eecc85d4467c Place the chops on the grill, cover, and allow to cook for 35 minutes. Baste with marinade during the cooking process.
54a3845c-bb43-4cd0-95db-eecc85d4467c Remove chops from grill, let them rest for 5 minutes then serve.
77830608-d644-4e07-9bda-03f6378529f2 Gather the ingredients.
77830608-d644-4e07-9bda-03f6378529f2 Drain pineapple reserving 1/4 cup of the juice into a large measuring cup. Add soy sauce, vegetable oil, onion, garlic, and brown sugar and stir to combine.
77830608-d644-4e07-9bda-03f6378529f2 Place pork chops and pineapple slices in a large resealable bag. Pour marinade mixture over the top. Seal bag and refrigerator for 2 hours.
77830608-d644-4e07-9bda-03f6378529f2 Preheat grill to high. Remove ​pork chops from marinade and place on hot grill. Cook for about 8 to 10 minutes, turn over and baste with marinade. Cook 7 to 10 more minutes (for a total of 15 to 20 minutes), or until internal temperature reaches 165 F. Discard any remaining marinade after basting.
77830608-d644-4e07-9bda-03f6378529f2 During the last few minutes of cooking, place the pineapple slices on the grill and cook for 2 to 3 minutes or until browned on the surface.
77830608-d644-4e07-9bda-03f6378529f2 Top pork chops with pineapple slices, remove from the grill and serve.
d636a571-611c-4a4b-a31a-a11ed52fb646 Preheat oven to 350 F.
d636a571-611c-4a4b-a31a-a11ed52fb646 In a large bowl combine eggs, melted butter, and milk.
d636a571-611c-4a4b-a31a-a11ed52fb646 Add remaining casserole ingredients into the bowl (combine but do not over mix).
d636a571-611c-4a4b-a31a-a11ed52fb646 Place into a casserole dish, and top with chunky salsa.
d636a571-611c-4a4b-a31a-a11ed52fb646 Bake casserole for 40-45 minutes until it has set up all the way through and has a golden brown color on top.
d636a571-611c-4a4b-a31a-a11ed52fb646 Remove from oven and let cool for 10 minutes.
d636a571-611c-4a4b-a31a-a11ed52fb646 Cut into serving pieces, and top with avocado pieces and sour cream.
1bb51532-7056-4a7e-8cb7-e6ad3a9e700e Preheat grill for medium-high heat.
1bb51532-7056-4a7e-8cb7-e6ad3a9e700e Trim fat and make a pocket in each chop.
1bb51532-7056-4a7e-8cb7-e6ad3a9e700e Season chops with salt and pepper.
1bb51532-7056-4a7e-8cb7-e6ad3a9e700e Combine remaining ingredients in a small bowl and stuff about 1/4 cup of mixture into each chop.
1bb51532-7056-4a7e-8cb7-e6ad3a9e700e Press to close. If too bulky, use toothpicks to close pork chops and prevent stuffing from spilling out.
1bb51532-7056-4a7e-8cb7-e6ad3a9e700e Place chops on grill rack and cook for 30 to 35 minutes or until the internal temperature reaches 160 F.
1bb51532-7056-4a7e-8cb7-e6ad3a9e700e Once cooked, remove from grill and serve with your favorite side dishes.
782a57a4-9a42-438e-bba4-d9ca1d0b0d21 Gather the ingredients.
782a57a4-9a42-438e-bba4-d9ca1d0b0d21 While technically optional, the first step for the best tasting grilled steak is to salt it. Put the salt in a small bowl or ramekin. If using the pepper and/or cayenne, add them to the salt and mix.
782a57a4-9a42-438e-bba4-d9ca1d0b0d21 Liberally sprinkle the skirt steak with sea salt or kosher salt and let it sit for at least 30 minutes at room temperature or up to overnight in the fridge. In any case, bring the meat to about room temperature, or at least let it sit out to take the chill off before cooking it to help ensure even cooking.
782a57a4-9a42-438e-bba4-d9ca1d0b0d21 While the meat sits, make sure the cooking grate on your charcoal or gas grill is cleaned and well-oiled, then heat the grill to high heat. You should be able to hold your hand about an inch over the grill grate for 1 second before it feels too hot. If using a charcoal grill, build the fire to one side so you'll also have a cooler area where you can move the steak(s) if it's seared and browned on the outside but not quite ready to take off the grill completely (if you're using a gas grill you'll be able to turn off a burner if need be).
782a57a4-9a42-438e-bba4-d9ca1d0b0d21 Set the steak(s) on the grill and cook, without moving, until that side is seared and releases from the grill of its own accord, about 3 minutes for medium-rare, 4 minutes for medium.
782a57a4-9a42-438e-bba4-d9ca1d0b0d21 Turn and cook on the other side to the same effect, about 3 to 4 more minutes. You can use a meat thermometer to get an accurate temperature if you like. For rare, remove the steak(s) at 120 F to 125 F; medium-rare 125 F to 130 F; and medium 130 F to 135 F.
782a57a4-9a42-438e-bba4-d9ca1d0b0d21 Remove the steak(s) from the grill, cover loosely with foil, and let sit at least 10 minutes. This resting time allows the meat to finish cooking and the juices to redistribute evenly throughout the steak. It is extremely important to achieving a properly cooked steak when everything is said and done, so despite the temptation, don't skip this step!
782a57a4-9a42-438e-bba4-d9ca1d0b0d21 Use a sharp knife to slice the steak against the grain and serve hot, warm, or room temperature. Skirt steak is particularly flavorful, so any cold leftovers are more than usually delicious.
782a57a4-9a42-438e-bba4-d9ca1d0b0d21 Perfectly grilled steak is perfectly tasty with just salt and pepper.
43ef1ad6-750e-4da4-a80e-012e002b7cfb Heat the grill to medium.
43ef1ad6-750e-4da4-a80e-012e002b7cfb Put all the ingredients in a large mixing bowl. If you are using bread slices, wet them and squeeze out the water before adding them to the bowl.
43ef1ad6-750e-4da4-a80e-012e002b7cfb Briskly knead together all the ingredients for several minutes until well-blended. Set aside to rest for a few minutes.
43ef1ad6-750e-4da4-a80e-012e002b7cfb Break off an apricot-sized piece of the meat mixture and form the desired shape with your hands. Flattened meatballs or patties cook up the best.
43ef1ad6-750e-4da4-a80e-012e002b7cfb Place each patty on the grill. Grill patties, turning once until browned on both sides.
5618300e-ee48-461d-aed1-0d90051295a6 Gather the ingredients.
5618300e-ee48-461d-aed1-0d90051295a6 Trim excess fat from beef ribs.
5618300e-ee48-461d-aed1-0d90051295a6 Combine salt, pepper, and cayenne.
5618300e-ee48-461d-aed1-0d90051295a6 Rub over the ribs.
5618300e-ee48-461d-aed1-0d90051295a6 Preheat grill and prepare for indirect grilling with a drip pan.
5618300e-ee48-461d-aed1-0d90051295a6 Place ribs on grill over drip pan and close the lid.
5618300e-ee48-461d-aed1-0d90051295a6 Cook for about 3 to 3 1/2 hours over a medium low, indirect heat (try to keep the temperature under 265 F/130 C).
5618300e-ee48-461d-aed1-0d90051295a6 To prepare sauce combine onion, honey, ketchup, chili peppers, garlic, and mustard in a saucepan.
5618300e-ee48-461d-aed1-0d90051295a6 Heat over a medium-low temperature, stirring until even and warmed through.
5618300e-ee48-461d-aed1-0d90051295a6 When the ribs are nearly finished cooking, begin brushing the sauce on them until you get a thick coating.
5618300e-ee48-461d-aed1-0d90051295a6 Once cooked through, remove from heat and let stand for 5 minutes.
5618300e-ee48-461d-aed1-0d90051295a6 Cut into individual ribs and serve.
5618300e-ee48-461d-aed1-0d90051295a6 Make a little extra sauce to serve on the side.
5618300e-ee48-461d-aed1-0d90051295a6 Enjoy!
602811b4-6d04-4482-a638-9685f374382f In a medium bowl, whisk together paprika, salt, garlic powder, onion powder, black pepper, dried parsley, cayenne pepper, cumin, coriander, hot chili powder, oregano, and if desired, the brown sugar until thoroughly mixed.
602811b4-6d04-4482-a638-9685f374382f Pat the brisket dry on all sides using paper towels. With a spoon, sprinkle the rub liberally onto the meat. Simultaneously press it in and rub it with your fingertips until it adheres to the entire surface. Turn the meat and repeat on all sides.
602811b4-6d04-4482-a638-9685f374382f Let the brisket sit for up to 24 hours (in the refrigerator) or cook immediately according to your recipe.
b3854a12-9785-4285-a36c-feb5025812ae Gather the ingredients.
b3854a12-9785-4285-a36c-feb5025812ae Prepare grill for indirect grilling by placing a large dripping pan underneath the grate, directly below where the roast will be placed. Make sure you know the weight of your prime rib to help you figure the cooking time and ingredient amounts. Plan on grilling over indirect heat for 12 to 14 minutes per pound. If you are using a smaller roast, adjust the ingredients and cooking times accordingly.
b3854a12-9785-4285-a36c-feb5025812ae Aim for a grill temperature of about 375 F.
b3854a12-9785-4285-a36c-feb5025812ae Periodically add water to the pan to keep the drippings from burning away, especially if you want to make gravy.
b3854a12-9785-4285-a36c-feb5025812ae With a sharp paring knife, make a series of 1/2-inch deep holes spaced every 2 inches all over the roast.
b3854a12-9785-4285-a36c-feb5025812ae Insert the garlic slivers in every other hole and a leaf from the rosemary in the rest.
b3854a12-9785-4285-a36c-feb5025812ae Combine black pepper, dried rosemary, salt, and paprika, and rub the mixture over the surface of the meat.
b3854a12-9785-4285-a36c-feb5025812ae When the grill is ready, place the roast on the well-oiled grate directly over the dripping pan.
b3854a12-9785-4285-a36c-feb5025812ae Cook for about 12 to 14 minutes per pound. An 18-pound roast will take about 3 1/2 to 4 hours. It is very important to use an accurate meat thermometer to check for doneness. You do not want to overcook this roast.
b3854a12-9785-4285-a36c-feb5025812ae When the meat reaches an internal temperature of 115 F to 125 F, remove it from the grill.
b3854a12-9785-4285-a36c-feb5025812ae Place the roast on a platter and cover loosely with foil. The meat will continue cooking, and the internal temperature will continue to rise. Tent loosely with aluminum foil and let rest for at least 15 minutes but no more than 30 minutes.
b3854a12-9785-4285-a36c-feb5025812ae Once the roast has rested, slice it.
b3854a12-9785-4285-a36c-feb5025812ae Serve with your favorite sides and enjoy.
35a32db4-6398-4dbf-beda-962db6b6fdaf Gather the ingredients.
35a32db4-6398-4dbf-beda-962db6b6fdaf Place prime rib roast onto a large cutting board. Combine seasoning ingredients and spread over roast. Make sure it is well coated.
35a32db4-6398-4dbf-beda-962db6b6fdaf Prepare grill for rotisserie cooking following the instructions in your grill manual.
35a32db4-6398-4dbf-beda-962db6b6fdaf Place the rib roast bone-side down. If you are using a boneless rib roast just place it on its side. Lift the roast from the ends and rotate it to find its approximate center.
35a32db4-6398-4dbf-beda-962db6b6fdaf Using a long, thin blade knife, cut through the center end to end.
35a32db4-6398-4dbf-beda-962db6b6fdaf Run the rotisserie skewer through the hole and loosely secure with the rotisserie forks.
35a32db4-6398-4dbf-beda-962db6b6fdaf Place roast on grill and adjust to center; then tighten the forks.
35a32db4-6398-4dbf-beda-962db6b6fdaf Remove from roast grill in order to preheat grill to a high temperature.
35a32db4-6398-4dbf-beda-962db6b6fdaf Place an aluminum drip pan under the space where the roast will sit. Add about 1 cup of water to the drip pan, if you intend to make gravy with the rendered juices.
35a32db4-6398-4dbf-beda-962db6b6fdaf Using heat-resistant gloves, return roast to grill once it has pre-heated.
35a32db4-6398-4dbf-beda-962db6b6fdaf Leave the grill on high for 20 minutes, then reduce the temperature to medium-low. Continue cooking until the internal temperature reaches at least 120 F (140 F for medium done), about 3 to 4 hours.
35a32db4-6398-4dbf-beda-962db6b6fdaf Remove from grill and rotisserie rod, cover with aluminum foil, and allow to rest for 15 to 20 minutes.
35a32db4-6398-4dbf-beda-962db6b6fdaf Carve and place onto a platter.
47719950-22bc-4b49-8516-17093abd0532 Divide ground beef into three equal parts. Spread each part of the ground beef out on a piece of plastic wrap, spreading into a thin, large square. The meat should be about a third of an inch thick. Spread about one-third of the macaroni and cheese. This might be too much so adjust as necessary.
47719950-22bc-4b49-8516-17093abd0532 Using the plastic wrap, roll the whole packed into a large, hot dog shape, making sure to keep the macaroni inside. Seal the edges of the meat to make a stuffed burger dog. Continue with remaining ingredients.
47719950-22bc-4b49-8516-17093abd0532 Preheat grill to a medium-high heat. Gently place burger dogs over direct heat and grill for about 15 minutes, rolling to cook evenly. Remove from grill, place on hoagie buns and top with melted cheese sauce and jalapenos. Omit jalapenos if preferred.
6d797305-2254-4417-b502-3808b90b3d7d Gather the ingredients.
6d797305-2254-4417-b502-3808b90b3d7d Place the steak or steaks into a resealable plastic bag and pour the Italian dressing over the steaks, making sure meat is well coated. Release the air from the bag and seal. Place the bag into the refrigerator for 4 to 12 hours.
6d797305-2254-4417-b502-3808b90b3d7d Remove the bag containing steaks at least 30 minutes before grilling. Let it stand at room temperature during this time.
6d797305-2254-4417-b502-3808b90b3d7d Preheat the grill for medium-high heat.
6d797305-2254-4417-b502-3808b90b3d7d Remove the steaks from the bag and discard the marinade.
6d797305-2254-4417-b502-3808b90b3d7d Season the steaks with salt, lemon pepper, and black pepper.
6d797305-2254-4417-b502-3808b90b3d7d Place the steaks onto the grill and cook for 6 to 7 minutes per side, depending on thickness and desired doneness.
6d797305-2254-4417-b502-3808b90b3d7d Once the steaks have reached the preferred doneness, remove them from the heat onto a warmed plate and let the meat rest for 5 to 7 minutes before serving. This allows the juices to be evenly distributed. They will run out if you cut the meat too soon. Serve with your choice of sides and enjoy!
e4a59b26-eedd-440a-974e-dafe19a384c1 Remove prime rib roast from the refrigerator and let stand at room temperature for 1 hour. Meanwhile combine garlic, salt, pepper, oregano, and rosemary together and rub over the surface of the roast. Place prime rib fat side up in a smoker-safe roasting pan.
e4a59b26-eedd-440a-974e-dafe19a384c1 Prepare smoker for a 4- to 6-hour smoke at a temperature of about 225 F/110 C. When the smoker is up to temperature, put the roasting pan with the prime rib on the top rack and add several water-soaked chunks of wood. A mixture of apple and mesquite work well for this recipe.
e4a59b26-eedd-440a-974e-dafe19a384c1 About halfway through smoking, add chopped vegetables to the roasting pan with the prime rib and throw some more wood chunks on the fire.
e4a59b26-eedd-440a-974e-dafe19a384c1 When done, remove the roasting pan from the smoker. Place prime rib roast on a carving board to rest for about 10 minutes. Place vegetables on a serving dish and keep warm.
e4a59b26-eedd-440a-974e-dafe19a384c1 Place the roasting pan on the stove over medium heat. Add red wine and water to deglaze the pan. Stir well and loosen any pieces of meat and vegetables. Add Worcestershire sauce, salt, and pepper. Heat for about 2 to 3 minutes. Carve prime rib roast and serve with vegetables and au jus.
06ccd933-241c-4aa7-88bd-ccc0cada9b4a Combine coriander seeds, peppercorns and mustard seeds in a spice grinder. Grind coarsely.
06ccd933-241c-4aa7-88bd-ccc0cada9b4a Add in remaining ingredients and mix well.
82d25b62-9410-4df9-b53a-25d366122faf Preheat smoker and add wood chips of your choice. Clean and dry the brisket. Combine rub ingredients and apply onto brisket.
82d25b62-9410-4df9-b53a-25d366122faf Place brisket in the smoker for 8 to 10 hours. Keep the smoker temperature at about 225 F/110 C. To increase tenderness, take the brisket out of the smoker, wrap in aluminum foil and place in the oven at 180 to 200 F/80 to 95 C for the last two hours. Typically after 8 to 10 hours a piece of meat will have absorbed as much smoke as it can and additional smoking may impart a bitter flavor.
82d25b62-9410-4df9-b53a-25d366122faf Take brisket off of heat and allow to sit for 20 minutes before slicing.
7890e050-8f8e-4c4f-a3c4-37ce81463032 Put the pot roast in the slow cooker with 1/2 cup water.
7890e050-8f8e-4c4f-a3c4-37ce81463032 Cover and cook on LOW for 10 to 12 hours, until very tender, or HIGH for about 5 to 6 hours).
7890e050-8f8e-4c4f-a3c4-37ce81463032 Drain and discard the liquids.
7890e050-8f8e-4c4f-a3c4-37ce81463032 Remove meat; shred with forks. Discard fat.
7890e050-8f8e-4c4f-a3c4-37ce81463032 Put the shredded beef back in the slow cooker and stir in ketchup, cola, mustard, smoke flavoring, and Tabasco.
7890e050-8f8e-4c4f-a3c4-37ce81463032 Cover and cook on HIGH for 1 hour longer.
7890e050-8f8e-4c4f-a3c4-37ce81463032 Serve on toasted or warmed split buns.
9eab7c2f-1c14-4bf9-a70f-099b4dde1b99 Gather the ingredients.
9eab7c2f-1c14-4bf9-a70f-099b4dde1b99 Trim the skirt steak of fat.
9eab7c2f-1c14-4bf9-a70f-099b4dde1b99 Mix marinade together then combine it with skirt steak in a resealable plastic bag or flat baking dish.
9eab7c2f-1c14-4bf9-a70f-099b4dde1b99 Make sure the skirt steak is well coated then let it sit overnight.
9eab7c2f-1c14-4bf9-a70f-099b4dde1b99 Prepare smoker to 200 to 220 F/95 to 105 C.
9eab7c2f-1c14-4bf9-a70f-099b4dde1b99 Remove skirt steak from marinade and let sit for 30 minutes at room temperature.
9eab7c2f-1c14-4bf9-a70f-099b4dde1b99 Mix toppings together.
9eab7c2f-1c14-4bf9-a70f-099b4dde1b99 If you wish to sop (soak) the skirt steak with the marinade during the cooking, put the remaining marinade in a pan and boil for five minutes.
9eab7c2f-1c14-4bf9-a70f-099b4dde1b99 Keep warm for sopping (soaking).
9eab7c2f-1c14-4bf9-a70f-099b4dde1b99 Place skirt steak in smoker and sop (soak) every 20 minutes.
9eab7c2f-1c14-4bf9-a70f-099b4dde1b99 Smoke for 1 to 1 1/2 hours.
9eab7c2f-1c14-4bf9-a70f-099b4dde1b99 If you have a separate gas grill, preheat before the skirt steak is done smoking. If not, preheat the oven.
9eab7c2f-1c14-4bf9-a70f-099b4dde1b99 Remove the skirt steak from the smoker and place on grill or under the broiler.
9eab7c2f-1c14-4bf9-a70f-099b4dde1b99 Cook on each side of the skirt steak for one minute.
9eab7c2f-1c14-4bf9-a70f-099b4dde1b99 Let the skirt steak sit for 10 minutes, then cut into thin slices across the grain.
9eab7c2f-1c14-4bf9-a70f-099b4dde1b99 While the skirt steak is sitting, place foil-wrapped tortillas on the grill or in the oven to warm
9eab7c2f-1c14-4bf9-a70f-099b4dde1b99 Put out the meat, tortillas, topping mixture and any other topping, like sour cream and guacamole, and let your guests put their own traditional fajitas together.
9eab7c2f-1c14-4bf9-a70f-099b4dde1b99 Enjoy!
035bcb87-563b-4524-8d29-3e363c0a7a1a Gather the ingredients.
035bcb87-563b-4524-8d29-3e363c0a7a1a Place the brisket onto a large cutting board.
035bcb87-563b-4524-8d29-3e363c0a7a1a Combine the brown sugar, Worcestershire sauce, minced garlic, mild chili powder, ground black pepper, yellow mustard, salt, paprika, and cumin in a small bowl.
035bcb87-563b-4524-8d29-3e363c0a7a1a Rub the mixture over the surface of the brisket, making sure to get every square inch of the meat. If you are adding liquid smoke, sprinkle it over the meat.
035bcb87-563b-4524-8d29-3e363c0a7a1a Wrap the seasoned brisket tightly with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 8 to 12 hours.
035bcb87-563b-4524-8d29-3e363c0a7a1a Preheat the oven to 300 F / 150 C.
035bcb87-563b-4524-8d29-3e363c0a7a1a Gently remove the brisket from plastic wrap and rewrap it in aluminum foil. Do not wrap the brisket too tightly—make sure to give it some room for steam.
035bcb87-563b-4524-8d29-3e363c0a7a1a Place the brisket in a roasting pan on a roasting rack and poke a couple of holes in the foil on the top. This will help to release some steam as it cooks.
035bcb87-563b-4524-8d29-3e363c0a7a1a Cook the brisket for 4 1/2 to 5 hours. It is done when the internal temperature reaches 185 F / 85 C.
035bcb87-563b-4524-8d29-3e363c0a7a1a Using heat-resistant gloves, remove the foil and let the meat rest for 5 to 10 minutes before carving.
035bcb87-563b-4524-8d29-3e363c0a7a1a Slice the brisket across the grain. Serve it with your favorite side sauce.
035bcb87-563b-4524-8d29-3e363c0a7a1a Enjoy!
320e2fd3-0201-44c1-bd72-938cc5bed22f Gather the ingredients.
320e2fd3-0201-44c1-bd72-938cc5bed22f Preheat the oven to 325 F.
320e2fd3-0201-44c1-bd72-938cc5bed22f Place a large double thickness of heavy-duty foil in a 9x13x2-inch pan—enough foil to cover and seal foil around the chuck roast.
320e2fd3-0201-44c1-bd72-938cc5bed22f Place chuck roast on the foil in pan. Mix the cream of mushroom soup, onion soup mix and barbecue sauce (directions below) together. Pour over meat. Seal foil tightly, leaving about 1" clearance between meat and foil.
320e2fd3-0201-44c1-bd72-938cc5bed22f Bake the chuck roast in the preheated oven for 2 1/2 to 3 hours, or until meat is very tender. Let chuck roast sit for 10 minutes before slicing.
320e2fd3-0201-44c1-bd72-938cc5bed22f Serve with the pan drippings over noodles or serve in sandwiches.
320e2fd3-0201-44c1-bd72-938cc5bed22f Enjoy!
6708d2b4-f25a-4fab-8f94-f9ecbab21ea7 To prepare the basting sauce, combine all sauce ingredients in a saucepan (tomato sauce, barbecue sauce, cola, honey, brown sugar, apple cider vinegar, white pepper, and hot sauce.
6708d2b4-f25a-4fab-8f94-f9ecbab21ea7 Let mixture come to a boil and then reduce and allow to simmer for 5 minutes. If the sauce is too thick, add 2 to 3 tablespoons water. Remove the sauce from the heat and set it aside.
6708d2b4-f25a-4fab-8f94-f9ecbab21ea7 If you are using frozen ribs, they should be thawed. Remove the membrane from the underside of the ribs. Trim off any loose fat or meat.
6708d2b4-f25a-4fab-8f94-f9ecbab21ea7 Place the ribs in a large pot with cold water. Bring the water to a boil. Parboil the ribs for 5 minutes and remove them onto a baking sheet. You might need to do the ribs in batches since they can be so large.
6708d2b4-f25a-4fab-8f94-f9ecbab21ea7 Mix the brown sugar, salt, paprika, and white pepper in a small bowl. This is the rib rub.
6708d2b4-f25a-4fab-8f94-f9ecbab21ea7 After ribs are parboiled, apply the rib rub to each side of the ribs. Don't worry if some of the rub falls off. The right amount is the amount that sticks.
6708d2b4-f25a-4fab-8f94-f9ecbab21ea7 Preheat the grill. Place the beef ribs on the grill and cook over medium-low heat. Rewarm the basting sauce. Once the ribs have reached 165 F, begin basting. Turn and baste the ribs with the basting sauce every 10 minutes, until finished cooking, about 1 1/2 hours. Remove the ribs from the heat and serve immediately.
2e4edb89-34c4-4c9b-b130-f1ea0a6ebce8 Gather the ingredients.
2e4edb89-34c4-4c9b-b130-f1ea0a6ebce8 In a blender combine garlic, parsley, cilantro and basil. Blend until fine.
2e4edb89-34c4-4c9b-b130-f1ea0a6ebce8 Add olive oil, rice wine vinegar, Tabasco, salt, and pepper. Blend until smooth.
2e4edb89-34c4-4c9b-b130-f1ea0a6ebce8 Pour half the mixture into a resealable bag and add tri-tip.
2e4edb89-34c4-4c9b-b130-f1ea0a6ebce8 Turn the tri-tip to coat and refrigerate for about 4 hours.
2e4edb89-34c4-4c9b-b130-f1ea0a6ebce8 Place the remaining half of the sauce in a container and refrigerate until you need it.
2e4edb89-34c4-4c9b-b130-f1ea0a6ebce8 Preheat grill.
2e4edb89-34c4-4c9b-b130-f1ea0a6ebce8 Remove tri-tip from bag and place on hot grill.
2e4edb89-34c4-4c9b-b130-f1ea0a6ebce8 Turn the tri-tip after 2 minutes and grill for 2 more minutes.
2e4edb89-34c4-4c9b-b130-f1ea0a6ebce8 Turn down the heat or move to a cooler part of the grill.
2e4edb89-34c4-4c9b-b130-f1ea0a6ebce8 Grill for another 4 minutes per side then continue grilling over indirect heat.
2e4edb89-34c4-4c9b-b130-f1ea0a6ebce8 Continue cooking until done, about 15 more minutes.
2e4edb89-34c4-4c9b-b130-f1ea0a6ebce8 When done, remove the tri-tip from the grill and allow to rest for 5 minutes.
2e4edb89-34c4-4c9b-b130-f1ea0a6ebce8 Meanwhile, heat the remaining sauce until just warm.
2e4edb89-34c4-4c9b-b130-f1ea0a6ebce8 Cut tri-tip into thin strips and serve with sauce over the top.
cb309aae-a110-4ec8-a755-a2f519afa331 Gather the ingredients. Prepare the smoker for a 3-hour smoke at 225 F to 250 F (107 C to 120 C).
cb309aae-a110-4ec8-a755-a2f519afa331 Trim any loose fat off the roast, but leave all of the attached fat.
cb309aae-a110-4ec8-a755-a2f519afa331 In a small bowl, combine olive oil with black pepper, minced garlic, and sea salt.
cb309aae-a110-4ec8-a755-a2f519afa331 Rub the seasoned oil all over the roast, especially concentrating on the top side.
cb309aae-a110-4ec8-a755-a2f519afa331 Place the roast into the smoker, fat side up (bone side down). If your smoker's heat is from one side (an offset smoker), place the bone ends away from the heat to start.
cb309aae-a110-4ec8-a755-a2f519afa331 Rotate the roast halfway through the cooking time to ensure it is cooking evenly. Smoke the roast until the thickest part reaches 125 F (52 C), about 2 to 3 hours.
cb309aae-a110-4ec8-a755-a2f519afa331 Remove the roast from the smoker and place it onto a cutting board or into a large baking dish. Loosely cover with aluminum foil and let rest in a warm place for about 20 to 30 minutes before carving.
cb309aae-a110-4ec8-a755-a2f519afa331 Serve and enjoy.
bbc8b4c3-e346-4fc5-a94c-ec8ef9013abe Gather the ingredients.
bbc8b4c3-e346-4fc5-a94c-ec8ef9013abe Melt butter in a medium saucepan. Add onions and garlic and sauté until translucent.
bbc8b4c3-e346-4fc5-a94c-ec8ef9013abe Add remaining ingredients and mix well.
bbc8b4c3-e346-4fc5-a94c-ec8ef9013abe Bring to a boil over a medium-high heat.
bbc8b4c3-e346-4fc5-a94c-ec8ef9013abe As soon as the sauce starts to bubble, reduce the heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes or until the sauce reaches the desired thickness.
bbc8b4c3-e346-4fc5-a94c-ec8ef9013abe Remove from heat and let cool for 10 minutes before using.
bbc8b4c3-e346-4fc5-a94c-ec8ef9013abe Enjoy!
e1ff80cc-0813-41ce-8f73-1099e5d2d5cc Gather the ingredients.
e1ff80cc-0813-41ce-8f73-1099e5d2d5cc Preheat grill to medium heat.
e1ff80cc-0813-41ce-8f73-1099e5d2d5cc Season ribs with salt, pepper, and garlic.
e1ff80cc-0813-41ce-8f73-1099e5d2d5cc Place on grill and sear on each side. Continue grilling until the ribs are nearly done.
e1ff80cc-0813-41ce-8f73-1099e5d2d5cc Place ribs in a broiler pan on a rack. Fill the bottom of the pan with the water and liquid smoke.
e1ff80cc-0813-41ce-8f73-1099e5d2d5cc Close the pan or cover it to seal. Place in the oven at 275 F/135 C for 2 to 4 hours. The longer you leave them, the more tender they will be.
e1ff80cc-0813-41ce-8f73-1099e5d2d5cc Brush with plenty of heated barbecue sauce right before you serve.
e1ff80cc-0813-41ce-8f73-1099e5d2d5cc Pair with your choice of sides and enjoy!
eb55aca9-8911-424d-8e1b-de32175b8fd4 Gather the ingredients.
eb55aca9-8911-424d-8e1b-de32175b8fd4 Combine all ingredients and mix until the sugar is completely dissolved.
eb55aca9-8911-424d-8e1b-de32175b8fd4 Marinate brisket overnight. Discard marinade when done.
eb55aca9-8911-424d-8e1b-de32175b8fd4 Grill or smoke as directed.
eb55aca9-8911-424d-8e1b-de32175b8fd4 Enjoy!
2561cb65-5ef2-4c2b-9014-dab1be9f3a2b Mix ingredients together in bowl and apply rub to brisket 2 to 4 hours before cooking.
2561cb65-5ef2-4c2b-9014-dab1be9f3a2b Refrigerate meat for a minimum of 4 to 6 hours to enhance flavor. This rub can be stored for several months in an airtight container, in a dark, cool place.
6d86847b-bbed-4293-8d7f-5bd505deff86 Gather the ingredients.
6d86847b-bbed-4293-8d7f-5bd505deff86 In a large, flat, and shallow pan, combine all the marinade ingredients and mix well.
6d86847b-bbed-4293-8d7f-5bd505deff86 Place brisket in the pan.
6d86847b-bbed-4293-8d7f-5bd505deff86 Marinate the brisket in the fridge covered for 12 hours (up to 24 hours) turning it over two or three times during the process so all parts are well marinated.
6d86847b-bbed-4293-8d7f-5bd505deff86 Remove from refrigerator and allow the meat to reach room temperature.
6d86847b-bbed-4293-8d7f-5bd505deff86 Prepare the smoker. You will want to smoke the cut for about 4 to 5 hours at 220 to 240 F.
6d86847b-bbed-4293-8d7f-5bd505deff86 If using a water smoker, put the remaining marinade in the water pan to add flavor.
6d86847b-bbed-4293-8d7f-5bd505deff86 Place brisket on the smoker and cook until the internal temperature reaches 180 F/80 C. Check the temperature at the 4-hour mark.
6d86847b-bbed-4293-8d7f-5bd505deff86 Remove and rest the meat for at least one hour.
6d86847b-bbed-4293-8d7f-5bd505deff86 Slice meat against the grain.
6d86847b-bbed-4293-8d7f-5bd505deff86 Serve hot!
51666be2-f7ef-4c68-b656-0b4ab0fef589 Place all ingredients in a large pot and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes.
51666be2-f7ef-4c68-b656-0b4ab0fef589 Once sauce has cooked, remove from heat and allow to cool slightly. Use the mop on meat every hour during the cooking process.
80bddaff-12e2-4830-9104-ac8dee3b4104 Gather the ingredients.
80bddaff-12e2-4830-9104-ac8dee3b4104 Prepare smoker for an 8-hour cooking time. Soak wood chips in bourbon and 1/2 cup water.
80bddaff-12e2-4830-9104-ac8dee3b4104 Rub roast with sea salt, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, and coarse black pepper and place on the top grate. Put a few handfuls of wood chips onto the fire.
80bddaff-12e2-4830-9104-ac8dee3b4104 Close the lid and check every 40 to 50 minutes, adding more wood chips each time. Smoke the roast for about 8 hours or until internal temperature reaches 130 for rare, 135 for medium-rare, and 140 to 145 F for medium.
80bddaff-12e2-4830-9104-ac8dee3b4104 Allow prime rib to rest for 10 minutes before carving.
80bddaff-12e2-4830-9104-ac8dee3b4104 Serve and enjoy!
95bf9f38-005c-4e8d-986a-298ae357ad05 Gather the ingredients.
95bf9f38-005c-4e8d-986a-298ae357ad05 Combine espresso beans, brown sugar, garlic powder, black pepper, and chili powder. Rub mixture onto steaks and place into a resealable container. Cover and allow to refrigerate for an hour.
95bf9f38-005c-4e8d-986a-298ae357ad05 Preheat grill for medium heat. Remove steaks from fridge and place on grill. Cook for about 1 to 1 1/2 hours, depending on the thickness of roast and desired doneness.
95bf9f38-005c-4e8d-986a-298ae357ad05 Once cooked, remove from heat allow to sit for 5 minutes before slicing.
95bf9f38-005c-4e8d-986a-298ae357ad05 Serve and enjoy!
fceec715-9d7c-4248-a7d4-0bbd6a737642 Gather the ingredients.
fceec715-9d7c-4248-a7d4-0bbd6a737642 Place the frozen meatballs in the bottom of your slow cooker.
fceec715-9d7c-4248-a7d4-0bbd6a737642 Add the onions, beer, ketchup, and red wine vinegar along with all the seasonings.
fceec715-9d7c-4248-a7d4-0bbd6a737642 Stir well to ensure everything is thoroughly combined.
fceec715-9d7c-4248-a7d4-0bbd6a737642 Cover and cook on low for 8 to 10 hours.
fceec715-9d7c-4248-a7d4-0bbd6a737642 Serve and enjoy!
9a21c506-6d89-45e6-ac1a-1161cc137e73 Gather the ingredients.
9a21c506-6d89-45e6-ac1a-1161cc137e73 Combine vegetable oil, sherry, soy sauce, brown sugar, garlic, ​and ginger. Mix well.
9a21c506-6d89-45e6-ac1a-1161cc137e73 Place in a baking dish and add sirloin. Turn to coat well, cover with plastic wrap and place into refrigerator for 1 to 8 hours.
9a21c506-6d89-45e6-ac1a-1161cc137e73 Preheat grill.
9a21c506-6d89-45e6-ac1a-1161cc137e73 Thread sirloin pieces, peppers, pineapple, and onions onto skewers.
9a21c506-6d89-45e6-ac1a-1161cc137e73 Grill over high heat until the meat is done, (about 8 to 10 minutes) turning occasionally.
a78e20b6-198d-4f61-8583-c025bbcfdd7b Gather the ingredients. Preheat the grill for high heat.
a78e20b6-198d-4f61-8583-c025bbcfdd7b In a large bowl, mix together the ground beef, minced onion, and pressed garlic.
a78e20b6-198d-4f61-8583-c025bbcfdd7b Form into 4 equal patties
a78e20b6-198d-4f61-8583-c025bbcfdd7b Sprinkle each pattie with Montreal steak seasoning.
a78e20b6-198d-4f61-8583-c025bbcfdd7b Grill the burgers for 4 to 5 minutes per side, or until cooked to your liking.
a78e20b6-198d-4f61-8583-c025bbcfdd7b Place hamburger patties on an onion roll and top with red onion, lots of roasted red peppers, and avocado slices. Enjoy!
dafb3064-eb59-4231-bebc-f50ac2c077fa Preheat smoker and add wood chips (follow your instruction manual).
dafb3064-eb59-4231-bebc-f50ac2c077fa Clean and dry the brisket. Apply brisket rub evenly. Place brisket in smoker for 8 to 10 hours. Keep the smoker temperature at about 220 F. To increase tenderness, take the brisket out of the smoker, wrap in aluminum foil and place in oven at 180 to 200 F for the last two hours. Typically after 8 to 10 hours a piece of meat will have absorbed as much smoke as it can and additional smoking may impart a bitter flavor.
dafb3064-eb59-4231-bebc-f50ac2c077fa Allow brisket to sit for 20 to 30 minutes before slicing it.
d25a267f-d191-4951-be52-cd811cec9af8 Gather the ingredients.
d25a267f-d191-4951-be52-cd811cec9af8 Combine all ingredients and mix thoroughly until salt has dissolved.
d25a267f-d191-4951-be52-cd811cec9af8 If making ahead of time, store in an airtight container in a refrigerator for up to 5 days after preparation.
c427a14b-eb2e-42f9-bee2-a3c300c3e53a Gather the ingredients.
c427a14b-eb2e-42f9-bee2-a3c300c3e53a Drain pineapple juice in a bowl.
c427a14b-eb2e-42f9-bee2-a3c300c3e53a Add teriyaki sauce and mix.
c427a14b-eb2e-42f9-bee2-a3c300c3e53a Place pineapple slices and 3 tablespoons of pineapple teriyaki mixture in a resealable plastic bag.
c427a14b-eb2e-42f9-bee2-a3c300c3e53a Turn to coat and set aside.
c427a14b-eb2e-42f9-bee2-a3c300c3e53a Shape hamburger into 4 patties and spoon remaining pineapple teriyaki sauce over top.
c427a14b-eb2e-42f9-bee2-a3c300c3e53a Preheat grill.
c427a14b-eb2e-42f9-bee2-a3c300c3e53a Butter ​the buns.
c427a14b-eb2e-42f9-bee2-a3c300c3e53a Place burger patties on hot grill and grill until done (one patty reach an internal temperature of 165 degrees).
c427a14b-eb2e-42f9-bee2-a3c300c3e53a Place buns on grill cut side down to toast lightly.
c427a14b-eb2e-42f9-bee2-a3c300c3e53a Remove pineapple slices from bag and place on grill and cook until slightly browned and warmed through.
c427a14b-eb2e-42f9-bee2-a3c300c3e53a Assemble burgers with a patty, pineapple slices, lettuce, onion slices, Swiss cheese, and bacon.
c427a14b-eb2e-42f9-bee2-a3c300c3e53a Enjoy.
415a2350-0c2d-4aaa-9ed0-174ce10e35f7 Gather the ingredients.
415a2350-0c2d-4aaa-9ed0-174ce10e35f7 Whisk the balsamic vinegar, olive oil, shallot, garlic, parsley, dijon, sugar, beef bouillon, salt, pepper, and meat tenderizer in a bowl. Add in about a 1/2 cup of water and stir again.
415a2350-0c2d-4aaa-9ed0-174ce10e35f7 Score the chuck roast with a sharp knife making 6 or 7 large cuts all over one side of the meat.
415a2350-0c2d-4aaa-9ed0-174ce10e35f7 Add the marinade to a plastic bag and then add the steak. Seal the bag and massage the steak inside the marinade. Place it on a plate to catch any drips or leaks and refrigerate for at least 6 hours, ideally overnight. You can even marinate up to 24 hours. Since the meat is so thick it will not break down easily.
415a2350-0c2d-4aaa-9ed0-174ce10e35f7 Prepare the grill. Charcoal works best for flavor and low and slow cooking but you can use a gas grill as well. Heat your bricks and then lay them on each side of the grill. Place a disposable pan in the center where there aren’t hot bricks to catch the drippings.
415a2350-0c2d-4aaa-9ed0-174ce10e35f7 Sear one side of the meat over the coals and then place it on the center of the grill, over the grill pan. If you’re using a gas grill, place it under a burner that is not on, with the other burners around it turned on to medium-high heat. You can also throw in a few wood smoke chips on top of the charcoal for a nice smokey flavor. Close the cover to the grill and cook for about 5 minutes on the first side.
415a2350-0c2d-4aaa-9ed0-174ce10e35f7 Flip and cook for an additional 20 minutes or until the internal temperature has reached 145 F which is the right temperature for “medium" (the best temperature for serving this cut of meat).
415a2350-0c2d-4aaa-9ed0-174ce10e35f7 Remove the steak from the grill and allow to rest for 2 to 3 minutes. Slice against the grain (do the best you can, chuck steaks grains can change across the meat due to the configuration of the muscle).
415a2350-0c2d-4aaa-9ed0-174ce10e35f7 Serve with your favorite sauce like chimichurri. Enjoy!
76254436-b875-4d40-add9-b61163c6a1f1 In large shallow glass dish, combine wine, thyme, oil, garlic, salt and pepper.
76254436-b875-4d40-add9-b61163c6a1f1 Add steak and turn to coat.
76254436-b875-4d40-add9-b61163c6a1f1 Cover with plastic wrap and marinate in refrigerator for 8 to 24 hours, turning steak occasionally to coat with marinade.
76254436-b875-4d40-add9-b61163c6a1f1 Prepare and heat grill.
76254436-b875-4d40-add9-b61163c6a1f1 Place steak on greased grill over hot coals.
76254436-b875-4d40-add9-b61163c6a1f1 Brush with marinade to coat.
76254436-b875-4d40-add9-b61163c6a1f1 Cover grill and cook steak for 7 to 8 minutes per side or until medium, or 145 F on a meat thermometer.
76254436-b875-4d40-add9-b61163c6a1f1 Remove steaks from grill, cover, and let stand for 5 minutes before carving.
76254436-b875-4d40-add9-b61163c6a1f1 Discard remaining marinade.
76254436-b875-4d40-add9-b61163c6a1f1 Cut steak in half and refrigerate one of the halves until chilled; wrap and refrigerate for up to 2 days.
76254436-b875-4d40-add9-b61163c6a1f1 Cut remaining steak into serving size pieces. You can also thinly slice remaining half across the grain on an angle and serve.
1b19244e-455b-4596-af9f-897fc83c6758 Gather the ingredients.
1b19244e-455b-4596-af9f-897fc83c6758 Place the steak or steaks into a resealable plastic bag and pour the Italian dressing over the steaks, making sure meat is well coated. Release the air from the bag and seal. Place the bag into the refrigerator for 4 to 12 hours.
1b19244e-455b-4596-af9f-897fc83c6758 Remove the bag containing steaks at least 30 minutes before grilling. Let it stand at room temperature during this time.
1b19244e-455b-4596-af9f-897fc83c6758 Preheat the grill for medium-high heat.
1b19244e-455b-4596-af9f-897fc83c6758 Remove the steaks from the bag and discard the marinade.
1b19244e-455b-4596-af9f-897fc83c6758 Season the steaks with salt, lemon pepper, and black pepper.
1b19244e-455b-4596-af9f-897fc83c6758 Place the steaks onto the grill and cook for 6 to 7 minutes per side, depending on thickness and desired doneness.
1b19244e-455b-4596-af9f-897fc83c6758 Once the steaks have reached the preferred doneness, remove them from the heat onto a warmed plate and let the meat rest for 5 to 7 minutes before serving. This allows the juices to be evenly distributed. They will run out if you cut the meat too soon. Serve with your choice of sides and enjoy!
68e2c8df-079d-42b9-9cd7-7a423504b1c8 Preheat oven to 425 F.
68e2c8df-079d-42b9-9cd7-7a423504b1c8 Preheat an ovenproof skillet, preferably cast-iron with raised grill ridges, over medium-high heat. Add olive oil and let heat for 2 to 3 minutes.
68e2c8df-079d-42b9-9cd7-7a423504b1c8 Sprinkle steaks with salt and pepper on both sides.
68e2c8df-079d-42b9-9cd7-7a423504b1c8 Place in skillet and sear for 3 to 4 minutes on the first side until the steaks release easily from the pan and have a dark brown crust. Turn and sear for 3 to 4 minutes on the second side.
68e2c8df-079d-42b9-9cd7-7a423504b1c8 Place a pat of butter on top of each steak, and place the pan in the oven.
68e2c8df-079d-42b9-9cd7-7a423504b1c8 Roast for 8 to 13 minutes until the desired doneness, which should be at least 140 F for rare. Remove pan from oven, cover with foil, and let steaks stand for 10 minutes before serving.
1003ce86-991b-4ff2-9d65-67f31f2d8f1c Gather the ingredients.
1003ce86-991b-4ff2-9d65-67f31f2d8f1c Heat a gas or charcoal grill to medium-high heat (you should be able to hold your hand about 1 inch above the cooking grate for 3 to 4 seconds before pulling it away from the intensity of the heat).
1003ce86-991b-4ff2-9d65-67f31f2d8f1c While the grill heats, trim off and discard any wilted greens at the top of the spring onions. Cut off and discard the root end of the onions as well. Be careful to cut right at the bottom of the onion and the top of the roots so the bulb stays together and you can cook and serve the onions intact.
1003ce86-991b-4ff2-9d65-67f31f2d8f1c Brush the spring onions with olive oil or vegetable oil. Be liberal with the application of the oil — it prevents the onions from sticking to the hot grill and adds tons of flavor as it mixes with the juices from the onions.
1003ce86-991b-4ff2-9d65-67f31f2d8f1c Put the spring onions on the preheated grill and cook them, turning once, until grill marks appear on both sides and the spring onions feel fork tender all the way through, about 15 minutes total cooking time.
1003ce86-991b-4ff2-9d65-67f31f2d8f1c Sprinkle the grilled spring onions with salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste.
1003ce86-991b-4ff2-9d65-67f31f2d8f1c Spritz the onions with fresh lemon juice or serve the lemon wedges on the side so everyone can dress their own plate.
ed70413d-2e09-4a61-81f0-49fefba1ef44 Gather the ingredients.
ed70413d-2e09-4a61-81f0-49fefba1ef44 Place the flap steaks into a resealable plastic bag.
ed70413d-2e09-4a61-81f0-49fefba1ef44 Combine marinade ingredients together and pour over the steaks, making sure all surfaces are well coated. Carefully let air out of the bag, seal, and place into refrigerator for 2 to 8 hours.
ed70413d-2e09-4a61-81f0-49fefba1ef44 Preheat the grill for medium-high heat.
ed70413d-2e09-4a61-81f0-49fefba1ef44 Remove the steaks from the bag and place them onto the grill grate. Cook, turning occasionally, for 20 to 25 minutes, or to your desired doneness.
ed70413d-2e09-4a61-81f0-49fefba1ef44 Once cooked, remove the steaks from the heat and place them onto a cutting board. Let steaks rest for 5 minutes before slicing.
ed70413d-2e09-4a61-81f0-49fefba1ef44 Serve with your favorite sides and enjoy!
e6a51817-0d95-4371-8b38-18b924aef7ea Gather the ingredients.
e6a51817-0d95-4371-8b38-18b924aef7ea Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
e6a51817-0d95-4371-8b38-18b924aef7ea For charcoal make a two-layer fire, so you have a hot side and a medium side.
e6a51817-0d95-4371-8b38-18b924aef7ea Combine wet rub ingredients and slather onto both sides of steak.
e6a51817-0d95-4371-8b38-18b924aef7ea Let steaks sit for a few minutes.
e6a51817-0d95-4371-8b38-18b924aef7ea Place steaks on a hot grill and cook for about 2 minutes per side, as long as there are good grill marks.
e6a51817-0d95-4371-8b38-18b924aef7ea Reduce heat or move to the medium side of the grill.
e6a51817-0d95-4371-8b38-18b924aef7ea Continue grilling for 10 to 12 minutes or until the steaks reach the desired doneness.
e6a51817-0d95-4371-8b38-18b924aef7ea Once cooked, remove from heat and let steaks rest for at least 5 minutes.
e6a51817-0d95-4371-8b38-18b924aef7ea Serve with your favorite sides. We recommend grilled vegetables.
e6a51817-0d95-4371-8b38-18b924aef7ea Enjoy!
296f3798-0013-4148-854f-99fddf8e1efd Preheat grill to high heat.
296f3798-0013-4148-854f-99fddf8e1efd For charcoal make a two-layer fire, so you have a hot side and a medium-hot side.
296f3798-0013-4148-854f-99fddf8e1efd Melt butter in a frying pan over medium heat.
296f3798-0013-4148-854f-99fddf8e1efd Add mushrooms to the frying pan and saute until mushrooms have sweated off most of their moisture.
296f3798-0013-4148-854f-99fddf8e1efd Add beef broth to the frying pan and stir, reducing the heat until the liquid starts to thicken.
296f3798-0013-4148-854f-99fddf8e1efd Add heavy cream to the frying pan and turn heat to low.
296f3798-0013-4148-854f-99fddf8e1efd Season t-bone steaks with salt and pepper as desired.
296f3798-0013-4148-854f-99fddf8e1efd Place on hot grill and cook for about 90 seconds to 2 minutes per side, as long as you get good grill marks.
296f3798-0013-4148-854f-99fddf8e1efd Reduce heat or move to the medium-hot side of the grill. Continue grilling for 5 to 7 minutes or until the steaks reach the desired doneness.
296f3798-0013-4148-854f-99fddf8e1efd Remove steaks from the grill then cover and allow to rest for 5 minutes.
296f3798-0013-4148-854f-99fddf8e1efd Give the mushrooms a stir.
296f3798-0013-4148-854f-99fddf8e1efd When steaks are ready, plate, and top with 1/4 of the mushrooms each.
f73933e5-e4d9-4e8d-b3f4-2f73f88f4d3b Gather the ingredients.
f73933e5-e4d9-4e8d-b3f4-2f73f88f4d3b Prepare smoker for an 8-hour cooking time. Soak wood chips in bourbon and 1/2 cup water.
f73933e5-e4d9-4e8d-b3f4-2f73f88f4d3b Rub roast with sea salt, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, and coarse black pepper and place on the top grate. Put a few handfuls of wood chips onto the fire.
f73933e5-e4d9-4e8d-b3f4-2f73f88f4d3b Close the lid and check every 40 to 50 minutes, adding more wood chips each time. Smoke the roast for about 8 hours or until internal temperature reaches 130 for rare, 135 for medium-rare, and 140 to 145 F for medium.
f73933e5-e4d9-4e8d-b3f4-2f73f88f4d3b Allow prime rib to rest for 10 minutes before carving.
f73933e5-e4d9-4e8d-b3f4-2f73f88f4d3b Serve and enjoy!
5aac8900-772a-4324-8339-9f4eff0ad474 With a long and sharp knife, cut a pocket into the meat horizontally about 3/4 of the way through.
5aac8900-772a-4324-8339-9f4eff0ad474 Combine garlic, spinach, parsley, lemon, and 1/2 teaspoon (2.5 ml) of salt and black pepper each. Spread mixture evenly inside pocket.
5aac8900-772a-4324-8339-9f4eff0ad474 Wrap in foil or plastic wrap and refrigerate for four to six hours.
5aac8900-772a-4324-8339-9f4eff0ad474 Preheat grill.
5aac8900-772a-4324-8339-9f4eff0ad474 Remove meat from plastic, season with 1 teaspoon (5 mL) salt and remaining 1/2 teaspoon (2.5 ml) black pepper.
5aac8900-772a-4324-8339-9f4eff0ad474 Place on hot grill.
5aac8900-772a-4324-8339-9f4eff0ad474 Cook over medium heat for about 20 to 25 minutes, turning occasionally.
5aac8900-772a-4324-8339-9f4eff0ad474 Make sure to turn carefully to avoid disrupting the stuffing.
5aac8900-772a-4324-8339-9f4eff0ad474 For added flavor, add wood chips for smoke. For a charcoal grill, spread water-soaked chips directly over coals. For a gas grill, wrap wet wood chips in foil and place under the cooking grate in one corner.
5aac8900-772a-4324-8339-9f4eff0ad474 Once the internal temperature of the meat reaches 160 to 165 degrees, remove from heat and let rest for 10 minutes. Slice and serve.
14acfaad-7966-4b7d-b01e-0702ecf0bbd9 Place flank steak into a resealable plastic bag.
14acfaad-7966-4b7d-b01e-0702ecf0bbd9 Combine the remaining ingredients in a blender or food processor.
14acfaad-7966-4b7d-b01e-0702ecf0bbd9 Pour mixture over flank steak making sure it is well distributed, seal bag and place into the refrigerator for 2 to 8 hours.
14acfaad-7966-4b7d-b01e-0702ecf0bbd9 Preheat grill for medium heat.
14acfaad-7966-4b7d-b01e-0702ecf0bbd9 Remove flank steak from the bag but do not throw away the marinade.
14acfaad-7966-4b7d-b01e-0702ecf0bbd9 Place the flank steak onto the grill and cook for 8 to 10 minutes per side.
14acfaad-7966-4b7d-b01e-0702ecf0bbd9 While steak is cooking, place reserved marinade into a saucepan and bring to a boil for 2 minutes, stirring constantly.
14acfaad-7966-4b7d-b01e-0702ecf0bbd9 Reduce heat and allow to simmer for 8 to 10 minutes. Reducing the heat can be done using the side burner of your grill.
14acfaad-7966-4b7d-b01e-0702ecf0bbd9 Once steak is cooked, remove from heat and allow it rest for 5 minutes before carving. Slice meat and top with sauce and diced tropical fruit.
657389e3-72ff-4a29-a91f-75e8782c58af Combine tequila, black pepper, lemon juice, lemon zest, and minced garlic in a non-metal bowl.
657389e3-72ff-4a29-a91f-75e8782c58af Place the steaks in a resealable plastic bag.
657389e3-72ff-4a29-a91f-75e8782c58af Pour marinade over steaks making sure all surfaces are well coated.
657389e3-72ff-4a29-a91f-75e8782c58af Carefully release air out of bag and seal.
657389e3-72ff-4a29-a91f-75e8782c58af Place steaks into a refrigerator for 4 to 12 hours.
657389e3-72ff-4a29-a91f-75e8782c58af Preheat grill for medium-high heat.
657389e3-72ff-4a29-a91f-75e8782c58af Remove steaks from bag and reserve marinade.
657389e3-72ff-4a29-a91f-75e8782c58af Season steaks with salt and place onto grill.
657389e3-72ff-4a29-a91f-75e8782c58af Cook the steaks 6 to 7 minutes per side or until they've reached the desired doneness.
657389e3-72ff-4a29-a91f-75e8782c58af Place reserved marinade into a saucepan and bring to a boil.
657389e3-72ff-4a29-a91f-75e8782c58af Add 1/2 teaspoon salt to the mixture. Reduce heat and simmer for 4 to 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. It can easily be done if your grill unit has a side burner. If not, cook sauce while steaks are resting.
657389e3-72ff-4a29-a91f-75e8782c58af Once the steaks are cooked, remove from heat and let meat rest for 7 to 10 minutes. Top with cooked sauce and serve. If you'd prefer no sauce, then, by all means, serve as is.
edcc9db7-4e72-4b9c-aed6-4ead613daaf9 In a medium skillet, toast cumin seeds for 2 to 3 minutes over medium heat. Make sure to move the pan around so that the seeds do not burn. Once the seeds have a deep brown (not charred) color and spice smells fragrant, remove from heat.
edcc9db7-4e72-4b9c-aed6-4ead613daaf9 Place toasted cumin into a coffee or spice grinder and grind into a powder. Place into a bowl and add remaining ingredients. Form into a paste. This rub can be stored for 10 days in the refrigerator in an airtight container. Make this a day ahead before using on steaks to allow the flavors to bloom.
edcc9db7-4e72-4b9c-aed6-4ead613daaf9 To use, simply apply 1 to 2 tablespoons of mixture (depending on the size of cut) to steaks. Grill as directed.
7aac1cbf-04dd-4cce-8cb2-1d8ab215bda1 Gather the ingredients.
7aac1cbf-04dd-4cce-8cb2-1d8ab215bda1 Season steak with salt and pepper.
7aac1cbf-04dd-4cce-8cb2-1d8ab215bda1 Combine half of the shallot, 1/4 cup (60 mL) balsamic vinegar, 2 tablespoons (30 mL) olive oil, 1 tablespoon (15 mL) sugar, and 2 tablespoons (30 mL) soy sauce in a resealable bag. Mix well.
7aac1cbf-04dd-4cce-8cb2-1d8ab215bda1 Add steaks and let sit for 2 hours or more.
7aac1cbf-04dd-4cce-8cb2-1d8ab215bda1 Cut portobello mushrooms in half then cut mushrooms (portobello and cremini) into 1/4-inch slices.
7aac1cbf-04dd-4cce-8cb2-1d8ab215bda1 Cut the remaining half of shallot and scallion tops into two pieces.
7aac1cbf-04dd-4cce-8cb2-1d8ab215bda1 In a skillet melt half of the butter and add one half of the shallot that was just cut. Heat over medium for 1 minute.
7aac1cbf-04dd-4cce-8cb2-1d8ab215bda1 Add portobellos and season with salt and pepper. Simmer for 8 minutes and then transfer the portobellos and the one half of the shoot to a bowl and keep warm.
7aac1cbf-04dd-4cce-8cb2-1d8ab215bda1 Heat the remaining half of the butter in the skillet and repeat the process with the last half of the cut shallot and cremini mushrooms, except reduce the cooking time to 6 minutes.
7aac1cbf-04dd-4cce-8cb2-1d8ab215bda1 Once the creminis are cooked down, add the portobello pieces back in to reheat.
7aac1cbf-04dd-4cce-8cb2-1d8ab215bda1 In a small bowl mix 1 tablespoon of olive oil, 2 tablespoons (30 mL) of sugar, 3 tablespoons (45 mL) of soy sauce, and 1/4 cup (60 mL) of balsamic vinegar.
7aac1cbf-04dd-4cce-8cb2-1d8ab215bda1 Add to mushrooms and boil for 3 minutes or until the liquid is slightly reduced.
7aac1cbf-04dd-4cce-8cb2-1d8ab215bda1 Then add the scallions.
7aac1cbf-04dd-4cce-8cb2-1d8ab215bda1 Preheat grill.
7aac1cbf-04dd-4cce-8cb2-1d8ab215bda1 Remove steaks from bag and dispose of the marinade.
7aac1cbf-04dd-4cce-8cb2-1d8ab215bda1 Grill steaks until done, about 8 to 10 minutes per side.
7aac1cbf-04dd-4cce-8cb2-1d8ab215bda1 Remove from grill and cut into strips cross grain. Serve with mushrooms.
7cdcd293-4872-4b55-8e81-c4bd446da9fc Combine margarita mix, cilantro, vegetable oil, garlic, cumin, salt and pepper.
7cdcd293-4872-4b55-8e81-c4bd446da9fc Reserve 2 tablespoons of mixture and pour remaining into a resealable plastic bag.
7cdcd293-4872-4b55-8e81-c4bd446da9fc Add steaks to ​the mixture, turning to coat. Seal bag and refrigerate for 2 to 8 hours.
7cdcd293-4872-4b55-8e81-c4bd446da9fc Preheat grill for medium-high heat.
7cdcd293-4872-4b55-8e81-c4bd446da9fc Remove steaks from ​the bag and discard the marinade.
7cdcd293-4872-4b55-8e81-c4bd446da9fc Place steaks on grill and cook until done, about 6 to 8 minutes per side.
7cdcd293-4872-4b55-8e81-c4bd446da9fc Meanwhile, ​combine 2 tablespoons of the marinade with avocado and onion.
7cdcd293-4872-4b55-8e81-c4bd446da9fc Toss until evenly mixed.
7cdcd293-4872-4b55-8e81-c4bd446da9fc Remove steaks from grill, let meat rest for 5 minutes and carve into thin slices. Serve with avocado salsa.
a9fa11ed-65b2-4b01-959a-cc36ba7ea30b Gather the ingredients.
a9fa11ed-65b2-4b01-959a-cc36ba7ea30b Combine all of the ingredients and store the seasoning in an airtight container. Note the date you prepared it to label the container.
a9fa11ed-65b2-4b01-959a-cc36ba7ea30b Keep in a cool, dark place for up to six months. Enjoy!
9dc611ee-80b6-49e1-9dec-44be4eca1c3f Combine garlic, chili powder, salt, oil and pepper in a small bowl.
9dc611ee-80b6-49e1-9dec-44be4eca1c3f Mix until it forms a thick paste. Rub paste over the entire surface of the steak.
9dc611ee-80b6-49e1-9dec-44be4eca1c3f Wrap steak in plastic wrap and refrigerate for several hours.
9dc611ee-80b6-49e1-9dec-44be4eca1c3f Preheat grill.
9dc611ee-80b6-49e1-9dec-44be4eca1c3f Grill steak over as high a heat as you can for 2 minutes. Flip and continue grilling for 2 more minutes.
9dc611ee-80b6-49e1-9dec-44be4eca1c3f Move to a cooler part of the grill or reduce heat to medium and continue grilling until done. About 4 minutes per side.
b4e8389f-c783-4e63-b686-a97efcf635a2 Place the tri-tip pieces into a resealable plastic bag. Combine the marinade ingredients and pour it over the meat. Massage the marinade into the meat. Seal the bag and place it into the refrigerator for 4 to 8 hours.
b4e8389f-c783-4e63-b686-a97efcf635a2 Preheat the grill for medium-high meat. Remove the meat from the bag and place it onto the grill. Discard the marinade as it is not safe to reuse it.
b4e8389f-c783-4e63-b686-a97efcf635a2 Cook the tri-tip for 20 minutes, turning occasionally.
b4e8389f-c783-4e63-b686-a97efcf635a2 During the last half of cooking, wrap the tortillas in aluminum foil and add them to the grill. Turn them over a few times while tri-tip is finishing up. Once the beef has reached your desired doneness, remove it and the tortillas from the grill. Allow the meat to rest for 5 minutes before carving.
b4e8389f-c783-4e63-b686-a97efcf635a2 After resting, remove the roast pieces to a cutting board. Thinly slice the steak on the bias (against the grain) for the most tenderness.
b4e8389f-c783-4e63-b686-a97efcf635a2 To assemble the tacos, simply add a few slices of grilled tri-tip to a tortilla. Top each taco with guacamole, pico de gallo, and a sprinkle of cilantro. Fold the tortillas and enjoy. Serve with your favorite sides.
ab9cab8e-4e36-4d01-87df-ee9fc652294e Remove 3 tablespoons of crushed pineapple from can and place into a bowl. Carefully dip out 3 tablespoons of pineapple juice from the can. If this proves difficult to do, place the remaining crushed pineapple in a strainer over a bowl. Press down with a spatula to release as much liquid as you can. This should give you the necessary amount for the recipe. Add remaining the marinade ingredients (soy sauce, minced shallots, olive oil, cider vinegar, honey, minced garlic, minced ginger, black pepper, salt) to the bowl and combine.
ab9cab8e-4e36-4d01-87df-ee9fc652294e Place the flank steak into a glass baking dish or plastic container and coat it on both sides with the marinade mixture. Cover dish tightly with plastic wrap and place into refrigerator for 2 to 12 hours. Turn the steak a few times during the marinating process and replace the plastic wrap over the dish each time.
ab9cab8e-4e36-4d01-87df-ee9fc652294e Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
ab9cab8e-4e36-4d01-87df-ee9fc652294e Remove the steak from the glass dish. Place the steak on the heated grill. Cook about 5 to 7 minutes per side, depending on the thickness of the cut, until done. Remove the steaks from grill once they've reached the desired doneness and let them rest for 5 to 7 minutes.
ab9cab8e-4e36-4d01-87df-ee9fc652294e Slice the flank steaks into strips across the grain.
249170cf-e437-4db8-9786-c045101eca98 Gather the ingredients.
249170cf-e437-4db8-9786-c045101eca98 Combine espresso beans, brown sugar, garlic powder, black pepper, and chili powder. Rub mixture onto steaks and place into a resealable container. Cover and allow to refrigerate for an hour.
249170cf-e437-4db8-9786-c045101eca98 Preheat grill for medium heat. Remove steaks from fridge and place on grill. Cook for about 1 to 1 1/2 hours, depending on the thickness of roast and desired doneness.
249170cf-e437-4db8-9786-c045101eca98 Once cooked, remove from heat allow to sit for 5 minutes before slicing.
249170cf-e437-4db8-9786-c045101eca98 Serve and enjoy!
7e89e229-cabe-482c-963c-97be0f4f199b Combine rub ingredients in a small bowl. Allow steaks to come to room temperature before grilling.
7e89e229-cabe-482c-963c-97be0f4f199b Preheat grill for high heat. Apply spice mixture to both sides of steak. Place steaks on ​the grill and cook for 7 to 10 minutes, turning once.
7e89e229-cabe-482c-963c-97be0f4f199b Once steaks have reached the desired doneness, remove from heat and let rest for at least 5 minutes before serving.
01e61e52-41e6-4b86-a01d-accefc376c9b Gather the ingredients.
01e61e52-41e6-4b86-a01d-accefc376c9b In a covered microwave-safe bowl, heat the olive oil and garlic in the microwave for 50 to 60 seconds. Remove and allow to cool.
01e61e52-41e6-4b86-a01d-accefc376c9b Add the rosemary, thyme, and marjoram, and stir. Let sit for 5 minutes.
01e61e52-41e6-4b86-a01d-accefc376c9b Place the filet mignon into a shallow glass dish.
01e61e52-41e6-4b86-a01d-accefc376c9b Pour the herb mixture over the steaks, turning them over to coat evenly. Cover and let marinate for 2 to 4 hours in the refrigerator.
01e61e52-41e6-4b86-a01d-accefc376c9b Preheat the grill for high heat. Right before placing steaks on the grill, oil the grate with a long pair of tongs, folded paper towels, and oil. Make 3 to 4 passes on the grate.
01e61e52-41e6-4b86-a01d-accefc376c9b Remove the steaks from the fridge, and season both sides with salt and pepper.
01e61e52-41e6-4b86-a01d-accefc376c9b Place the steaks on the grill and cook for 5 to 6 minutes per side, or to the desired doneness.
01e61e52-41e6-4b86-a01d-accefc376c9b Remove steaks from the heat and let rest for at least 5 minutes.
01e61e52-41e6-4b86-a01d-accefc376c9b Serve and enjoy!
0faf3a29-65f4-494b-8b85-08b2685b822a Place flat-iron steaks into a resealable plastic bag. Combine marinade ingredients and pour over steaks, making sure every inch of meat is coated well. Gently, release air from bag, seal, and place into the refrigerator for 2 to 8 hours.
0faf3a29-65f4-494b-8b85-08b2685b822a Preheat grill for high heat.
0faf3a29-65f4-494b-8b85-08b2685b822a Remove steaks from bag and discard any leftover marinade. Place steaks onto the grill and cook for 2 to 3 minutes per side. Reduce heat to medium and cook for another 12 to 15 minutes, depending on the thickness of the meat and desired doneness.
0faf3a29-65f4-494b-8b85-08b2685b822a Once cooked, remove steaks from heat and place onto a large cutting board. Let meat rest for a few minutes before carving. Slice meat into thin pieces and place onto a serving platter. Cover platter with foil to keep warm while you get the other ingredients ready.
0faf3a29-65f4-494b-8b85-08b2685b822a To assemble: Simply place 3 to 4 strips of meat into warmed corn tortillas and top with guacamole, pico de gallo, and any other condiments of choice. Serve with seasoned rice, refried beans, and lime wedges.
f2bdbe6f-9bfa-4cc3-a637-ada91c28daa6 Gather the ingredients.
f2bdbe6f-9bfa-4cc3-a637-ada91c28daa6 Make the marinade by combining the lime juice, salt, garlic powder, cumin, pepper, and coriander.
f2bdbe6f-9bfa-4cc3-a637-ada91c28daa6 Trim off visible fat from steaks. Use a fork to prick the steaks deeply all over and on both sides.
f2bdbe6f-9bfa-4cc3-a637-ada91c28daa6 Place trimmed steaks in a resealable plastic bag and pour the marinade over the steaks, making sure to coat well and refrigerate for 30 minutes, turning once.
f2bdbe6f-9bfa-4cc3-a637-ada91c28daa6 Heat an outdoor grill, indoor grill, broiler, or grill pan on the stovetop and remove steaks from the marinade.
f2bdbe6f-9bfa-4cc3-a637-ada91c28daa6 Place steaks on a hot grill or another surface that has been very lightly coated with cooking spray and cook each side for 4 to 5 minutes or until done to your liking.
f2bdbe6f-9bfa-4cc3-a637-ada91c28daa6 Enjoy as a steak with your choice of sides or slice (after the meat has rested for 10 minutes) against the grain and serve with your favorite lettuce for a main-course salad.
093847cd-f733-43a3-8480-999688376e1d Combine all marinade ingredients in a medium bowl. Place the tri-tip roast in a large resealable plastic bag. Pour marinade over meat, seal bag and allow to marinate for 4 to 6 hours in the refrigerator.
093847cd-f733-43a3-8480-999688376e1d Preheat grill on medium heat and prepare for indirect cooking. Remove roast from the pan making sure to reserve marinade. Place roast onto a lightly oiled grill grate and allow to cook until internal temperature reaches 150 to 165 F or about 25 to 35 minutes.
093847cd-f733-43a3-8480-999688376e1d While the tri-tip is cooking, it is time to prepare the sauce. Using side burner and a medium saucepan, bring reserved marinade to boil. Combine 1 tablespoon of cornstarch with 3 tablespoons of water. Add mixture to marinade. Stir until the sauce has thickened. Reduce heat to low and allow to simmer for an additional 3 to 5 minutes.
093847cd-f733-43a3-8480-999688376e1d Once tri-tip has reached the desired doneness, remove from grill and tent with aluminum foil, and allow meat to rest for 10 minutes. Carve roast, top with sauce, and serve with you favorite sides.
093847cd-f733-43a3-8480-999688376e1d Enjoy!
2b45817d-a305-408f-a4f0-a6f18d15e26d Combine minced garlic, olive oil, and dried oregano in a bowl. Place steaks on a large plate and coat well on both sides with mixture. Cover lightly with plastic and place in refrigerator for 2 hours. Remove from fridge 30 minutes before going onto the grill. This will help the meat come up to temperature before coming into contact with heat.
2b45817d-a305-408f-a4f0-a6f18d15e26d Preheat grill for medium-high heat.
2b45817d-a305-408f-a4f0-a6f18d15e26d Remove plastic wrap from steaks and season both sides of meat with salt and black pepper.
2b45817d-a305-408f-a4f0-a6f18d15e26d Place steaks on the grill and cook for 5 to 6 minutes per side, depending on thickness and desired doneness. Once cooked to preference, remove from heat and set onto a cutting board. Lightly tent with aluminum foil. Do not wrap tightly. Let steaks rest for 7 to 10 minutes. Slice and serve or serve steaks whole with your favorite side dishes.
4ff4ce77-1f0a-4164-b210-37d6405383e5 Gather the ingredients.
4ff4ce77-1f0a-4164-b210-37d6405383e5 In a large nonreactive baking dish or container, whisk together the soy sauce, garlic, dry mustard, and the coarsely ground black pepper.
4ff4ce77-1f0a-4164-b210-37d6405383e5 Do not rinse the steaks, but pat them dry with a paper towel. Add them to the marinade and turn them to coat thoroughly. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 2 to 5 hours.
4ff4ce77-1f0a-4164-b210-37d6405383e5 When ready to cook, oil the grill and prepare it for high direct heat, or about 450 F. If broiling, turn the oven to BROIL.
4ff4ce77-1f0a-4164-b210-37d6405383e5 When the grill or broiler has come up to temperature, remove the steaks from the marinade, discard the marinade, and place the steaks on your chosen cooking surface.
4ff4ce77-1f0a-4164-b210-37d6405383e5 Grill the steaks until the desired temperature and doneness has been reached, using tongs to turn the steaks only once. To obtain grill marks, halfway through cooking the first side, turn it perpendicular on the grates to create the crosshatch pattern. After turning the steak over (remember: only once), repeat halfway through on the second side.
4ff4ce77-1f0a-4164-b210-37d6405383e5 Remove from the grill and serve with your favorite side dishes like a baked potato or French fries and a leafy green salad.
4ff4ce77-1f0a-4164-b210-37d6405383e5 Enjoy!
baf7fa00-9c77-4684-bbce-edaf1e3e93ea Preheat the grill for medium-high heat.
baf7fa00-9c77-4684-bbce-edaf1e3e93ea In a medium skillet, heat the oil and add the chopped onions. Cook for 1 minute.
baf7fa00-9c77-4684-bbce-edaf1e3e93ea Add mushrooms to the skillet and saute for 3 to 4 minutes.
baf7fa00-9c77-4684-bbce-edaf1e3e93ea Add the garlic to the skillet and cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat.
baf7fa00-9c77-4684-bbce-edaf1e3e93ea In a medium saucepan combine the cream cheese, half-and-half, and pepper. Blend well. Cook over medium heat until the mixture is smooth.
baf7fa00-9c77-4684-bbce-edaf1e3e93ea Add the cooked mushroom, onion, and garlic to the saucepan mixture. Keep warm.
baf7fa00-9c77-4684-bbce-edaf1e3e93ea Place the steaks on the grill and cook them until done to your liking, about 5 minutes per side.
baf7fa00-9c77-4684-bbce-edaf1e3e93ea Remove the steaks from the grill and let them rest for 5 minutes.
baf7fa00-9c77-4684-bbce-edaf1e3e93ea Place the steaks on individual serving plates. Pour the cream cheese and mushroom sauce over the steaks, top with chopped parsley, and serve.
f2b6cb97-ce31-4921-b274-c16d851f7bef Place steaks in a resealable plastic bag. Combine marinade ingredients, and pour over steaks. Make sure to work marinade well into the meat. Seal bag, and place into the refrigerator for 2 hours.
f2b6cb97-ce31-4921-b274-c16d851f7bef Preheat grill for medium-high heat. While the grill is heating up, slice onion, and heat olive oil in large skillet on the stove. Add onion, salt, and black pepper. Allow the onion to cook on high for 2 minutes, reduce heat to medium-low, and cook for 5 minutes, turning often. Add wine and Worcestershire sauce, let cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Add stock, reduce heat to low, and cook for 15 minutes.
f2b6cb97-ce31-4921-b274-c16d851f7bef Place steaks on the grill, and cook for 10 minutes turning often. Steaks should cook quickly since they are relatively small and thin. If they are thicker, leave on for an additional 2-3 minutes. Remove from heat, and place onto the cutting board. Allow meat to rest for a few minutes before slicing.
f2b6cb97-ce31-4921-b274-c16d851f7bef Prepare aioli by combining mayonnaise, mustard, and chili powder. If making ahead of time, place into an airtight container, and store in the fridge for up to 2 days after preparation.
f2b6cb97-ce31-4921-b274-c16d851f7bef To assemble, place Swiss on the lower bun, add 6 to 8 slices of meat, 1/4 cup/60 mL of caramelized onion, and spread a generous amount of aioli on remaining inside half of the bun before topping sandwich.
a2693860-5a44-4c2e-9707-bbceda75671a Gather the ingredients.
a2693860-5a44-4c2e-9707-bbceda75671a Place the steak in a shallow dish. Use a fork to prick the steak deeply, all over its surface, on both sides.
a2693860-5a44-4c2e-9707-bbceda75671a In a small bowl, combine remaining ingredients and mix well.
a2693860-5a44-4c2e-9707-bbceda75671a Pour over steak; cover and refrigerate for 1 to 24 hours.
a2693860-5a44-4c2e-9707-bbceda75671a When ready to grill, prepare and preheat grill.
a2693860-5a44-4c2e-9707-bbceda75671a Cook steak over medium coals for 3 to 4 minutes on each side, turning once, until medium doneness. This steak should not be cooked to medium-well or well-done, or it will be very tough.
a2693860-5a44-4c2e-9707-bbceda75671a Place on cutting board, cover with foil and let stand 5 minutes.
a2693860-5a44-4c2e-9707-bbceda75671a To serve, position the steak, so the grain is running from left to right. Hold the steak using tongs with your non-dominant hand. Using a very sharp knife, place the knife on the steak, then tilt it to the left. Slice the steak thinly.
a2693860-5a44-4c2e-9707-bbceda75671a Serve immediately and enjoy!
0c245dd7-756d-49be-bfe6-406560152cbd Gather the ingredients.
0c245dd7-756d-49be-bfe6-406560152cbd Place steaks in a resealable plastic bag. Place remaining ingredients in blender or food processor. Blend mixture until smooth.
0c245dd7-756d-49be-bfe6-406560152cbd Pour half of mixture into bag with steaks. Make sure meat is well coated.
0c245dd7-756d-49be-bfe6-406560152cbd Release air from the bag, seal, and place steaks into a refrigerator for 6-24 hours. Store remaining half of marinade in an airtight plastic container in a refrigerator.
0c245dd7-756d-49be-bfe6-406560152cbd Preheat grill. Remove steaks from bag and discard marinade. Grill steaks on medium- heat until they reach the desired doneness. Once cooked, remove heat and let rest.
0c245dd7-756d-49be-bfe6-406560152cbd Meanwhile, place reserved marinade in a small saucepan. Bring mixture to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low and let simmer for 5-6 minutes, stirring often.
0c245dd7-756d-49be-bfe6-406560152cbd Remove from heat and serve sauce with steaks.
b525dd21-8939-4e7d-bafd-472ce1abd04d Gather the ingredients.
b525dd21-8939-4e7d-bafd-472ce1abd04d Place coriander seeds, cumin seeds, fennel seeds, and cardamom pods in a pan over medium heat. Toast until seeds start to brown slightly - about 3 to 4 minutes.
b525dd21-8939-4e7d-bafd-472ce1abd04d Remove spices from heat and place into a spice grinder (or coffee grinder) and pulverize into a powder.
b525dd21-8939-4e7d-bafd-472ce1abd04d Place contents into a bowl and add remaining ingredients. Mix together and use.
b525dd21-8939-4e7d-bafd-472ce1abd04d Store rub in an airtight container in a cool, dry place for up to 6 months after initial preparation.
6e310e69-abfb-41e7-a23c-8d83c6055d0f Gather the ingredients.
6e310e69-abfb-41e7-a23c-8d83c6055d0f Trim beef tenderloin of unnecessary fat. The tenderloin should be about 1 inch thick, so if it's too thick, pound to flatten.
6e310e69-abfb-41e7-a23c-8d83c6055d0f Melt 2 tablespoons/30 mL of butter and coat over the surface of the meat. Season with black pepper. Preheat grill.
6e310e69-abfb-41e7-a23c-8d83c6055d0f Meanwhile, melt remaining 1/2 cup/120 mL of butter in a saucepan. Add parsley, lemon juice and season with salt and pepper. Pour into a small container and refrigerate.
6e310e69-abfb-41e7-a23c-8d83c6055d0f Place the tenderloin on hot grill and sear on all four sides for about 3 minutes. Reduce heat and continue grilling for 5 to 10 minutes, or until it reaches the desired doneness. Remove from grill and slice into 1/2 inch thick slices. Serve garnished with watercress and butter mixture (called Maitre d'hotel butter).
6e310e69-abfb-41e7-a23c-8d83c6055d0f Chateaubriand is traditionally served with Béarnaise sauce and Chateau potatoes.
a6420afe-2d06-47cf-9dd1-b9b9c0076851 Gather the ingredients.
a6420afe-2d06-47cf-9dd1-b9b9c0076851 Trim beef tri-tip of excess fat. Combine other ingredients, except sesame seeds and mix well.
a6420afe-2d06-47cf-9dd1-b9b9c0076851 Place beef tri-tip in a resealable plastic bag and coat well with marinade. Refrigerate for several hours (6 to 12 hours).
a6420afe-2d06-47cf-9dd1-b9b9c0076851 Preheat grill.
a6420afe-2d06-47cf-9dd1-b9b9c0076851 Remove beef tri-tip from marinade and discard any remaining marinade in bag.
a6420afe-2d06-47cf-9dd1-b9b9c0076851 Grill beef tri-tip over medium heat, turning occasionally for about 25 to 30 minutes depending on the thickness of the cut and your preferred doneness.
a6420afe-2d06-47cf-9dd1-b9b9c0076851 Once done, remove from grill and let rest for 5 to 10 minutes.
a6420afe-2d06-47cf-9dd1-b9b9c0076851 Carve across the grain, sprinkle with sesame seeds, and serve.
110a492f-8ad9-4154-a888-74c01d002ec4 Cut 1-inch diamonds about 1/8 inch deep in both sides of the flank steak.
110a492f-8ad9-4154-a888-74c01d002ec4 Combine crushed garlic, olive oil, red wine vinegar salt, and black pepper in a small non-metallic bowl.
110a492f-8ad9-4154-a888-74c01d002ec4 Place steak in a resealable plastic bag.
110a492f-8ad9-4154-a888-74c01d002ec4 Pour marinade over steak, making sure all surfaces are covered.
110a492f-8ad9-4154-a888-74c01d002ec4 Seal bag, letting out any excess air and place into the refrigerator for 6 to 12 hours.
e6a60d78-cc21-4c3a-a068-3f8cd68a109e Combine all ingredients except the tri-tip steaks and stir. Place steaks in a large baking dish or a resealable bag.
e6a60d78-cc21-4c3a-a068-3f8cd68a109e Pour marinade over steaks. Let sit for several hours (up to 6). Preheat grill. Place steaks on grill over a medium high heat.
e6a60d78-cc21-4c3a-a068-3f8cd68a109e Grill for 10 to 12 minutes or until they reach desired doneness.
e6a60d78-cc21-4c3a-a068-3f8cd68a109e Let steaks rest for about 5 minutes before you serve them.
e6a60d78-cc21-4c3a-a068-3f8cd68a109e If you want to add some extra heat to the marinade chop up a seeded jalapeño pepper and toss it in.
4d3aeefe-2cee-40a2-93df-bfcaabf5d193 Combine the seasonings and sprinkle over the surface of the beef tri-tip. Set aside for about 30 minutes.
4d3aeefe-2cee-40a2-93df-bfcaabf5d193 Preheat grill to a high temperature. Place tri-tip on the hot grill and sear the surface for about two minutes per side.
4d3aeefe-2cee-40a2-93df-bfcaabf5d193 Move away from the high temperature or reduce to low fire and continue cooking. This is preferably done with the lid up to prevent burning or overcooking but this is up to your discretion based on your equipment. What you want is a grilling temperature of around 300 F/150 C.
4d3aeefe-2cee-40a2-93df-bfcaabf5d193 Continue cooking until the meat reaches the desired doneness and remove from grill. Plan on about 45 minutes total cooking time but keep an eye on the meat. Preferably this meat should be served medium-rare.
4d3aeefe-2cee-40a2-93df-bfcaabf5d193 Serve with your cookout sides of choice and enjoy!
939a86ab-2eef-4215-aa5b-290a5db64af5 Trim skirt steaks of excess fat.
939a86ab-2eef-4215-aa5b-290a5db64af5 Place into resealable plastic bag.
939a86ab-2eef-4215-aa5b-290a5db64af5 Combine marinade ingredients and pour over skirt steaks.
939a86ab-2eef-4215-aa5b-290a5db64af5 Work marinade around, making sure to coat every bit of meat, carefully release excess air from bag, seal and place into refrigerator.
939a86ab-2eef-4215-aa5b-290a5db64af5 Allow to marinate for 2 to 4 hours.
939a86ab-2eef-4215-aa5b-290a5db64af5 Preheat grill for medium heat.
939a86ab-2eef-4215-aa5b-290a5db64af5 Remove steaks from bag and place onto grill grates.
939a86ab-2eef-4215-aa5b-290a5db64af5 Cook for 3 to 5 minutes per side depending on thickness and desired doneness.
939a86ab-2eef-4215-aa5b-290a5db64af5 Once steaks are cooked, remove from heat and place onto cutting board and lightly cover with aluminum foil.
939a86ab-2eef-4215-aa5b-290a5db64af5 While steaks are resting, prepare garnish.
939a86ab-2eef-4215-aa5b-290a5db64af5 Slice steaks, garnish and serve.
79ee7241-4557-4d47-ba11-ce05ff1ce966 Gather the ingredients.
79ee7241-4557-4d47-ba11-ce05ff1ce966 Preheat your grill and place your griddle on the cooking grate.
79ee7241-4557-4d47-ba11-ce05ff1ce966 If you still have some room for direct grilling, lightly brush onions and peppers and place over direct heat for about one minute before moving to the griddle. Otherwise, pour 1 tablespoon/15 mL of the oil on the griddle.
79ee7241-4557-4d47-ba11-ce05ff1ce966 Add onions and peppers. Cook until browned and soft.
79ee7241-4557-4d47-ba11-ce05ff1ce966 Move aside and pour on another tablespoon of oil.
79ee7241-4557-4d47-ba11-ce05ff1ce966 Add beef. Toss shredded beef on the hot griddle until it is cooked through and completely browned.
79ee7241-4557-4d47-ba11-ce05ff1ce966 Pile into four mounds. Top with onions and peppers.
79ee7241-4557-4d47-ba11-ce05ff1ce966 Season with salt and pepper and top with cheese slices.
79ee7241-4557-4d47-ba11-ce05ff1ce966 When the cheese starts to melt scoop up the mound with a large spatula and slide it into a roll.
79ee7241-4557-4d47-ba11-ce05ff1ce966 Serve with sweet peppers and lots of napkins.
79ee7241-4557-4d47-ba11-ce05ff1ce966 Enjoy!
27949431-4d54-481b-96d1-435efe0bba68 Place skirt steak in resealable plastic bag. Combine marinade ingredients in a bowl. Pour over skirt steaks, making sure to evenly distribute marinade all over the meat. Seal bag and place into refrigerator for 2 to 5 hours.
27949431-4d54-481b-96d1-435efe0bba68 If using a charcoal grill, you want a two layer fire, with the coals nice and hot. Place marinated steaks onto grill grate and cook for 3 to 5 minutes per side, with the lid off. Make sure to watch it closely as these steaks cook quickly.
27949431-4d54-481b-96d1-435efe0bba68 Once cooked through remove from fire and allow to rest for 5 minutes. Slice against the grain into thin strips, serve onto warmed tortillas, and top with corn salsa, sliced green onion, guacamole, and chopped cilantro.
27949431-4d54-481b-96d1-435efe0bba68 Enjoy!
71faf600-813c-4b19-ba07-260300876d9e Combine vinegar, mustard, salt, black pepper, allspice, rosemary and oil in large, shallow glass dish.
71faf600-813c-4b19-ba07-260300876d9e Add steak and onions; turn to coat. Let stand 15 minutes.
71faf600-813c-4b19-ba07-260300876d9e Grill steak and onions 12 to 16 minutes (depending on thickness and desired doneness), turning a few time​ and brushing with marinade during the first half of cooking.
71faf600-813c-4b19-ba07-260300876d9e Once cooked, remove from heat, let meat rest for 5 minutes and then slice steak across the grain.
71faf600-813c-4b19-ba07-260300876d9e Serve with onions.
f7dbbc3f-4057-4232-9b49-303547646c21 Finely chop garlic, shallot and onion and place in a small bowl.
f7dbbc3f-4057-4232-9b49-303547646c21 Finely chop parsley and tarragon and add to the bowl.
f7dbbc3f-4057-4232-9b49-303547646c21 Add the Worcestershire sauce, Dijon mustard, Guinness beer, soy sauce and seasonings then mix well to combine.
f7dbbc3f-4057-4232-9b49-303547646c21 Let stand for 30 minutes to blend flavors. Place the rib eye in a resealable plastic bag and add marinade.
f7dbbc3f-4057-4232-9b49-303547646c21 Make sure steaks are well coated. Seal bag and place into refrigerator for 2 to 8 hours.
f7dbbc3f-4057-4232-9b49-303547646c21 Preheat the grill. Remove steak from bag making sure to reserve marinade. Place steak onto the grill and cook for 6 to 8 minutes per side, or until it has reached the desired doneness.
f7dbbc3f-4057-4232-9b49-303547646c21 Add remaining marinade in a small saucepan and simmer sauce over medium-high heat for 5 minutes or until slightly thickened. Make sure to stir often.
f7dbbc3f-4057-4232-9b49-303547646c21 Reduce heat to medium or medium-low if necessary. Add more beer to the marinade at this stage if desired.
f7dbbc3f-4057-4232-9b49-303547646c21 Once cooked through, remove sauce from heat and let stand until steaks are ready.
f7dbbc3f-4057-4232-9b49-303547646c21 Serve steaks with sauce on top.
c1d86ed5-dd97-46c1-a75b-b838432621c6 Preheat grill for medium-high heat. (You can use a grill pan for indoor grilling as well.)
c1d86ed5-dd97-46c1-a75b-b838432621c6 In a large bowl, combine ground lamb, chopped onion, bread crumbs, chopped mint, egg, garlic, cumin, black pepper, and Aleppo pepper (or pepper flakes).
c1d86ed5-dd97-46c1-a75b-b838432621c6 Do not add salt at this point. Gently mix with hands until all ingredients are well combined. Form into 4 equal-sized patties and place onto a parchment-lined baking sheet.
c1d86ed5-dd97-46c1-a75b-b838432621c6 Using your thumb, make indentations halfway through the center of each patty. This will help the burgers to cook more evenly and not bubble up in the center.
