c1d86ed5-dd97-46c1-a75b-b838432621c6 Using folded paper towels and a pair of large grilling tongs (if you are grilling outdoors), oil the grill grates well. Make at least three passes, making sure that the surface is nice and coated.
c1d86ed5-dd97-46c1-a75b-b838432621c6 Place lamb burger patties onto grill and cook for 4-5 minutes per side, or until meat has reached the desired doneness. Use a large outdoor cooking spatula to flip these burgers. They will be a bit softer than beef burgers, not only because of the texture of ground lamb but because these patties also contain some wet ingredients. If you are grilling indoors, oil up the grilling pan, using the same method as you would outdoors, and use a regular-sized spatula to flip the burgers.
c1d86ed5-dd97-46c1-a75b-b838432621c6 Once cooked to your liking, remove from grill, place onto a plate and tent with aluminum foil. Brush burger buns with olive oil (vegetable oil work well too), and place oiled side down onto grill grates. Close the lid and let buns toast for 1 to 2 minutes. (If you are not grilling outdoors, toast your buns in a toaster oven for the same amount of time on the medium-low setting.) Remove. If using pita, place into a large piece of aluminum foil, seal edges and place onto the grill for 3 minutes, turn, and warm for another 3-4 minutes.
c1d86ed5-dd97-46c1-a75b-b838432621c6 We recommend either a red pepper aioli or yogurt sauce for these burgers. For red pepper aioli, simply add the roasted red peppers to the mayonnaise in a food processor. Add the lemon juice, salt, and olive oil and blend to desired consistency.
c1d86ed5-dd97-46c1-a75b-b838432621c6 For yogurt sauce, in a bowl add the cucumber, plain yogurt, minced garlic, cilantro, and salt, and stir together, until completely combined.
c1d86ed5-dd97-46c1-a75b-b838432621c6 Assemble burgers to your liking and add extra items such as red onion and lettuce.
dbf9c11f-40d5-4141-aa19-37530860068e Combine garlic, oregano, lemon juice and olive oil in a small bowl.
dbf9c11f-40d5-4141-aa19-37530860068e Season marinade with kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper.
dbf9c11f-40d5-4141-aa19-37530860068e Add lamb cubes; toss to coat.
dbf9c11f-40d5-4141-aa19-37530860068e Cover and marinate in refrigerator 4 to 6 hours.
dbf9c11f-40d5-4141-aa19-37530860068e Drain meat cubes; discard marinade.
dbf9c11f-40d5-4141-aa19-37530860068e Thread lamb, tomatoes, and onion onto skewers.
dbf9c11f-40d5-4141-aa19-37530860068e Grill on medium heat for 12 to 15 minutes or to the desired degree of doneness; a reliable thermometer should register 145 F/65 C for medium-rare, 160 F/70 C for medium or 170 F/75 C for well.
dbf9c11f-40d5-4141-aa19-37530860068e Turn kabobs several times, brushing with marinade.
dbf9c11f-40d5-4141-aa19-37530860068e Serve with warm pita bread and Tzatziki sauce.
115ec127-5758-4ccf-88b7-a6f2b2fc2791 Trim racks of all visible fat. Combine remaining ingredients and mix well.
115ec127-5758-4ccf-88b7-a6f2b2fc2791 Place lamb in a large glass baking dish.
115ec127-5758-4ccf-88b7-a6f2b2fc2791 Spread mixture over lamb, carefully cover with plastic wrap and place into refrigerator for 6 to 24 hours.
115ec127-5758-4ccf-88b7-a6f2b2fc2791 Preheat grill.
115ec127-5758-4ccf-88b7-a6f2b2fc2791 Place lamb on grill over medium-high heat and sear for a couple of minutes per side, reduce heat or move off of direct heat and continue grilling until the internal temperature reaches 140 to 150 F. (60 to 65 C.) or about 15 minutes per side.
115ec127-5758-4ccf-88b7-a6f2b2fc2791 Once cooked, remove from heat and let rest for about 5 minutes before carving.
9b6a9272-8207-4a9a-bf65-44ea9e692e6d Gather the ingredients.
9b6a9272-8207-4a9a-bf65-44ea9e692e6d Combine the extra-virgin olive oil and white wine in a large mixing bowl.
9b6a9272-8207-4a9a-bf65-44ea9e692e6d Crush the juniper berries, peppercorns, garlic, and 1 teaspoon fine sea salt together in a mortar and pestle until you obtain a rough paste.
9b6a9272-8207-4a9a-bf65-44ea9e692e6d Transfer this paste to the olive oil-and-wine mixture and stir to mix well.
9b6a9272-8207-4a9a-bf65-44ea9e692e6d Tear the bay leaves roughly and stir them in as well. Add the lemon slices (squeezing them just a bit before adding them to the marinade), and marinate the lamb in this marinade for at least 12 hours in the refrigerator, turning the pieces occasionally.
9b6a9272-8207-4a9a-bf65-44ea9e692e6d Shake off any excess liquid before cooking the lamb chops. You can either cook the marinated lamb chops in a skillet over a brisk flame or grill them on charcoal (preferable) or gas grill.
9b6a9272-8207-4a9a-bf65-44ea9e692e6d In any case, lay lemon slices from the marinade over the chops as they cook, turn the chops occasionally, and season them well with sea salt and freshly ground black pepper when they're almost done. It should take about 8 to 10 minutes for them to be done.
9b6a9272-8207-4a9a-bf65-44ea9e692e6d Serve with lemon wedges that can be squeezed over the lamb before eating.
01f743e4-cfd1-4632-817c-b665186d0169 Gather the ingredients.
01f743e4-cfd1-4632-817c-b665186d0169 Empty the can of beer into a container.
01f743e4-cfd1-4632-817c-b665186d0169 Cut off the top of the can and pour in 12 ounces of beer.
01f743e4-cfd1-4632-817c-b665186d0169 Add the bay leaves and thyme. Set aside.
01f743e4-cfd1-4632-817c-b665186d0169 Make the rub by combining 2 tablespoons brown sugar with the paprika, salt, and pepper.
01f743e4-cfd1-4632-817c-b665186d0169 Make the turkey baste. In a separate bowl, combine the remaining 2 tablespoons brown sugar, the ketchup, vinegar, 2 tablespoons of beer, hot sauce, and cayenne.
01f743e4-cfd1-4632-817c-b665186d0169 Prepare smoker for a 6-hour smoke at 250 F.
01f743e4-cfd1-4632-817c-b665186d0169 Rub surface of the turkey with the spice rub. Try to get as much as you can under the skin, particularly over the breast meat.
01f743e4-cfd1-4632-817c-b665186d0169 Stand beer can up on the smoker grate and gently set the turkey over the can so that the can is completely inside the cavity of the turkey. Make sure that the turkey stands easily and doesn't sway. The turkey needs to be stable.
01f743e4-cfd1-4632-817c-b665186d0169 Once you have the turkey in the smoker, let it cook for about 6 hours at a temperature around 250 F. Baste the turkey with the basting mixture every 2 hours during ​the cooking process. Check for an internal temperature in the thigh of about 165 F/74 C. This is when the bird is done.
01f743e4-cfd1-4632-817c-b665186d0169 When cooked, remove from heat and let sit for a few minutes before carving.
01f743e4-cfd1-4632-817c-b665186d0169 Serve and enjoy.
c851fb2a-d41f-4748-a63f-bcbc2304f26d Gather the ingredients and preheat the grill.
c851fb2a-d41f-4748-a63f-bcbc2304f26d Cut butter into 8 quarter-inch wide slivers measuring an inch long. Push any extra butter into the folds created when the breast is wrapped. Salt and pepper all over.
c851fb2a-d41f-4748-a63f-bcbc2304f26d Make 8 half-inch slits in the top skin of the turkey breasts and slip butter into slits.
c851fb2a-d41f-4748-a63f-bcbc2304f26d Cook for 5 minutes at high heat, then adjust grill to medium heat. Grill until the internal temperature reaches 175 F/80 C, about 25 minutes.
c851fb2a-d41f-4748-a63f-bcbc2304f26d Remove and let cool 20 minutes before carving. If you need drippings for gravy, set a drip pan on bars or bricks under the rack, and remove it after the first 30 minutes or else it will burn off.
c851fb2a-d41f-4748-a63f-bcbc2304f26d Serve and enjoy!
a15f20ef-962f-4445-ab89-057097a616bc Gather the ingredients.
a15f20ef-962f-4445-ab89-057097a616bc Cook the onion and celery in butter over medium heat until soft, about 7 to 10 minutes. The object is to sweat the vegetables, not sauté them. They should have a glossier appearance rather than browning.
a15f20ef-962f-4445-ab89-057097a616bc Add the remaining sauce ingredients to the pot. Simmer over medium-low heat for 5 minutes, stirring often. Add more brown sugar to make the sauce sweeter. Remove from heat and allow sauce to cool to room temperature.
a15f20ef-962f-4445-ab89-057097a616bc Preheat the grill. Combine salt and black pepper and season the turkey legs.
a15f20ef-962f-4445-ab89-057097a616bc Place turkey legs on the grill and cook over medium heat. Grill, covered for about 30 to 45 minutes or until nearly done. Turn occasionally.
a15f20ef-962f-4445-ab89-057097a616bc Begin basting with sauce during the last 15 to 20 minutes of cook time. Watch out for burning. Reduce heat or move turkey legs to indirect portion of the grill to finish cooking. Once legs reach an internal temperature of 180 to 185 F, they're done.
a15f20ef-962f-4445-ab89-057097a616bc Remove from heat and loosely tent with aluminum foil. Let legs rest for 10 minutes before serving.
a15f20ef-962f-4445-ab89-057097a616bc If you want to serve some of the sauce on the side, simply divide the sauce using one portion for basting and warming the reserved portion for serving. You can also double the sauce recipe if you really want to have quite a bit. The choice is all yours.
eb0aa76d-7159-4f88-bb02-cf6d0358bea8 Gather the ingredients.
eb0aa76d-7159-4f88-bb02-cf6d0358bea8 Pat the turkey legs dry.
eb0aa76d-7159-4f88-bb02-cf6d0358bea8 In a large pot, combine the soda, sugar, hot sauce, red pepper flakes, and black pepper. Bring to a low boil and add the turkey legs.
eb0aa76d-7159-4f88-bb02-cf6d0358bea8 Boil over medium heat for about 30 minutes or until the turkey legs register an internal temperature of 165 F/74 C. Preheat the grill to medium heat.
eb0aa76d-7159-4f88-bb02-cf6d0358bea8 Place the onion slices on the heated grill and put the turkey legs on top of the onion slices.
eb0aa76d-7159-4f88-bb02-cf6d0358bea8 Brush with the turkey legs honey and sprinkle them with the steak seasoning.
eb0aa76d-7159-4f88-bb02-cf6d0358bea8 Grill over a medium heat for about 15 minutes watching carefully to avoid burning. Turn the turkey legs as needed. The skin should be crispy brown and the legs should reach an internal temperature of between 165 to 175 F when done.
eb0aa76d-7159-4f88-bb02-cf6d0358bea8 Once cooked, remove the turkey legs from the grill.
eb0aa76d-7159-4f88-bb02-cf6d0358bea8 Serve with your choice of sides and enjoy!
c9cc21ad-5af1-47c2-baef-78127c2a9f28 Gather the ingredients.
c9cc21ad-5af1-47c2-baef-78127c2a9f28 Trim the lamb of all excess fat and cut it into 1-inch cubes. Cut the bell peppers and onions into 1-inch pieces.
c9cc21ad-5af1-47c2-baef-78127c2a9f28 In a small plastic or glass bowl, combine the marinade ingredients (olive oil, lemon juice, sea salt, cumin, grated ginger, and black pepper).
c9cc21ad-5af1-47c2-baef-78127c2a9f28 In a resealable container (a large zip-top bag works best), place the lamb pieces with the marinade. Massage them to mix and seal bag. Refrigerate the meat in the marinade for 2 to 24 hours.
c9cc21ad-5af1-47c2-baef-78127c2a9f28 Preheat the grill to high heat. Thread lamb, onion, and pepper pieces onto skewers, intermixing the pieces or making skewers of just meat and just vegetables (see Recipe Tip below).
c9cc21ad-5af1-47c2-baef-78127c2a9f28 Place the kebabs on the hot grill and cook for about 8 to 10 minutes, uncovered. Starting at the 2-minute mark, turn the skewers to cook another side of the cubes. Do this every 2 minutes until all four sides of the cubes have been grilled. Cook longer if lamb chunks are larger than 1-inch.
c9cc21ad-5af1-47c2-baef-78127c2a9f28 Once cooked to your desired doneness, remove the kebabs from the grill.
c9cc21ad-5af1-47c2-baef-78127c2a9f28 Serve on or off of the skewers, with lemon and lime slices.
b3c754ce-8e2c-47db-8265-c1544dc63856 Gather the ingredients.
b3c754ce-8e2c-47db-8265-c1544dc63856 Combine the salt, sugar, pepper, cinnamon, and ginger along with 1 cup of water in a large saucepan. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and add in 3 cups of cold water to make turkey brine.
b3c754ce-8e2c-47db-8265-c1544dc63856 Place turkey in a resealable container or plastic bag, add minced garlic and brine, seal and allow to rest in refrigerator for up to 24 hours.
b3c754ce-8e2c-47db-8265-c1544dc63856 Preheat grill to medium heat.
b3c754ce-8e2c-47db-8265-c1544dc63856 Combine the honey, chipotle, mustard, and vinegar in a bowl.
b3c754ce-8e2c-47db-8265-c1544dc63856 Remove turkey from refrigerator and discard brine mixture. Place turkey on grill rack and cook for 25 to 30 minutes, turning once.
b3c754ce-8e2c-47db-8265-c1544dc63856 Baste with honey-Dijon glaze during cooking process.
b3c754ce-8e2c-47db-8265-c1544dc63856 Turkey should be between 165 to 175 F when done. Remove from heat and let rest for 5 to 10 minutes before slicing.
b3c754ce-8e2c-47db-8265-c1544dc63856 Serve and enjoy!
268d0395-59a5-4316-8beb-e857ed7c90e3 Gather the ingredients.
268d0395-59a5-4316-8beb-e857ed7c90e3 Combine maple syrup, chipotle chilies, vegetable oil, and soy sauce in a blender. Blend until smooth.
268d0395-59a5-4316-8beb-e857ed7c90e3 Work garlic clove halves under the skin of the turkey breast.
268d0395-59a5-4316-8beb-e857ed7c90e3 Preheat grill and prepare for indirect grilling. Place turkey breasts on unheated portion of the grill. Grill for 1 to 1 1/2 hours, brushing with the chipotle sauce every 15 minutes.
268d0395-59a5-4316-8beb-e857ed7c90e3 Remove from grill when done and serve.
f2a191c2-7350-411a-affd-8135c91cb5c0 Gather the ingredients.
f2a191c2-7350-411a-affd-8135c91cb5c0 Prepare smoker for a 6- to 8-hour smoke at about 230 F/110 C.
f2a191c2-7350-411a-affd-8135c91cb5c0 In a saucepan, melt the butter.
f2a191c2-7350-411a-affd-8135c91cb5c0 Add the wine, honey, salt, and cinnamon. Heat on low temperature until mixture is smooth and thin.
f2a191c2-7350-411a-affd-8135c91cb5c0 Using a turkey injector, inject half the mixture into the bird in all meaty areas.
f2a191c2-7350-411a-affd-8135c91cb5c0 Brush remaining mixture over turkey. You can reserve some of the baste to apply later, during the cooking process.
f2a191c2-7350-411a-affd-8135c91cb5c0 Place turkey in the smoker. When the internal temperature of the turkey reaches 165 F/75 C, the bird is done.
f2a191c2-7350-411a-affd-8135c91cb5c0 Remove from smoker and let rest for 10 to 15 minutes.
f2a191c2-7350-411a-affd-8135c91cb5c0 Carve and serve!
38b2ee4f-8196-4881-89d5-fc8efd83a7f9 Gather the ingredients.
38b2ee4f-8196-4881-89d5-fc8efd83a7f9 Combine everything in a large plastic storage bag or in a tightly covered plastic container.
38b2ee4f-8196-4881-89d5-fc8efd83a7f9 Shake or stir to coat turkey chops well. Refrigerate for 30 minutes to an hour before grilling.
38b2ee4f-8196-4881-89d5-fc8efd83a7f9 Remove turkey from marinade. Pour marinade into a small saucepan over medium heat and bring to a boil. Keep warm while the turkey is on the grill.
38b2ee4f-8196-4881-89d5-fc8efd83a7f9 Grill turkey chops over hot coals for about 4 minutes on each side, or until no longer pink in the center.
38b2ee4f-8196-4881-89d5-fc8efd83a7f9 Put turkey on a platter and top with hot pineapple chunks and a little of the hot marinade.
38b2ee4f-8196-4881-89d5-fc8efd83a7f9 Serve and enjoy!
6792dfed-c58a-4b46-ae27-a25fa2cdca43 Gather the ingredients.
6792dfed-c58a-4b46-ae27-a25fa2cdca43 Rinse the lemons clean. If you have any plans to use or otherwise eat the peel, you may even want to go so far as to scrub them with soap before rinsing them. Pat them dry. To release extra juice, roll them on a hard surface.
6792dfed-c58a-4b46-ae27-a25fa2cdca43 Cut the lemons in half crosswise.
6792dfed-c58a-4b46-ae27-a25fa2cdca43 Optional: Pop out and discard any visible seeds. Use the tip of a paring knife to urge any deeper-set seeds to the surface. This is a kind service to your fellow diners since it minimizes the chance that they'll bite into a bitter seed while enjoying their lovely grilled lemons.
6792dfed-c58a-4b46-ae27-a25fa2cdca43 Use a pastry brush, silicone grilling brush, or a paper towel to brush the cut sides with a bit of oil. You can sprinkle the cut sides with fine sea salt, too, if you want to add a more intense savory effect to the grilled lemons.
6792dfed-c58a-4b46-ae27-a25fa2cdca43 Set the lemons cut-side-down on the hot grill or in the frying pan. Cook until the lemons are heated through and charred on the cut side, about 3 minutes. Ideally, you'll cook them without moving them so they char nicely, but adjust them if the heat seems uneven so they char evenly.
6792dfed-c58a-4b46-ae27-a25fa2cdca43 Enjoy!
5f42b0f8-0c07-4245-ace8-d5a7b49ba61c Gather the ingredients.
5f42b0f8-0c07-4245-ace8-d5a7b49ba61c Cut salmon into serving pieces.
5f42b0f8-0c07-4245-ace8-d5a7b49ba61c Salt the salmon lightly and set it out at room temperature for 15 to 20 minutes before cooking.
5f42b0f8-0c07-4245-ace8-d5a7b49ba61c Fire up the grill. Make sure the surface is clean. Get some vegetable oil ready to wipe on the grill later.
5f42b0f8-0c07-4245-ace8-d5a7b49ba61c After 15 to 20 minutes of setting out, pat the salmon dry and then use a butter knife to scrape the skin side to get any moisture or scales off. This makes the skin side drier so it will not stick to the grill.
5f42b0f8-0c07-4245-ace8-d5a7b49ba61c Coat the salmon with oil.
5f42b0f8-0c07-4245-ace8-d5a7b49ba61c When the fire is good and hot, wipe down the grate with a paper towel that has been dipped in the oil.
5f42b0f8-0c07-4245-ace8-d5a7b49ba61c Put the salmon on the grill skin side up. It seems counterintuitive, but do it anyway because you want a good sear on the fish, and you cannot do this well if you start skin-side down; the fish will cook too much and will fall apart when you try to flip it. The uncooked skin helps hold things together.
5f42b0f8-0c07-4245-ace8-d5a7b49ba61c Leave the salmon on the grill for a solid 4 to 6 minutes, depending on thickness. A thin sockeye fillet might need closer to 3 minutes on one side. You will know it is ready when you can slide a spatula underneath the salmon. It might stick in one or two spots, but it should be mostly crusted over.
5f42b0f8-0c07-4245-ace8-d5a7b49ba61c Gently flip the salmon onto the skin side and leave it again for at least 3 minutes, a bit longer if it is on the thick side. Exactly how long depends on thickness, but it'll never be less than 2 minutes on high heat. Watch the fish, and if the flakes begin to separate, you're done.
5f42b0f8-0c07-4245-ace8-d5a7b49ba61c Take the salmon off the heat, sprinkle lemon juice on it, then let it rest for 2 to 3 minutes.
5f42b0f8-0c07-4245-ace8-d5a7b49ba61c Serve with your favorite sauce.
1110b087-5d6d-48aa-b634-0b2e549e7759 Gather the ingredients.
1110b087-5d6d-48aa-b634-0b2e549e7759 To prepare the butter sauce, combine butter, lemon juice, garlic, and parsley in a small saucepan. Remove the pan from the heat once butter has melted.
1110b087-5d6d-48aa-b634-0b2e549e7759 Preheat your grill for medium-high heat.
1110b087-5d6d-48aa-b634-0b2e549e7759 Right before placing the fish onto the grill, make sure to oil the grill grates. This can be achieved by using a large pair of tongs, folded paper towels, and a high smoke point oil (canola oil, peanut oil, sunflower oil). Olive oil will work in a pinch. Dip the paper towel into oil and run across the grates at least three times to create a non-stick surface. This will keep the fish from breaking during the cooking process.
1110b087-5d6d-48aa-b634-0b2e549e7759 Combine the onion powder, garlic, paprika, pepper, and salt in a small bowl.
1110b087-5d6d-48aa-b634-0b2e549e7759 Sprinkle the seasoning mixture on both sides of the fish.
1110b087-5d6d-48aa-b634-0b2e549e7759 Place the fish on the grill and cook for 7 minutes. Turn the fish and coat it with the butter sauce. Cook for about 7 more minutes.
1110b087-5d6d-48aa-b634-0b2e549e7759 Once the fish reaches an internal temperature of at least 145 F, remove it from the heat, drizzle it with olive oil.
d9dc5a4b-6dba-47c5-92e8-b580bd6f4d65 Gather the ingredients.
d9dc5a4b-6dba-47c5-92e8-b580bd6f4d65 To split the lobster tails in half, place them on a cutting board, backside down. Use a large, sharp knife to cut down through the center to the shell the whole length.
d9dc5a4b-6dba-47c5-92e8-b580bd6f4d65 Fold the shell back (like you are opening a book), breaking through the shell. If the shell doesn't break, you can use kitchen shears to cut through it. The flesh should now be exposed.
d9dc5a4b-6dba-47c5-92e8-b580bd6f4d65 Pat the lobster tails dry with paper towels.
d9dc5a4b-6dba-47c5-92e8-b580bd6f4d65 Preheat the grill for medium-high heat.
d9dc5a4b-6dba-47c5-92e8-b580bd6f4d65 Combine the olive oil (or butter), lemon juice, dill, and salt in small mixing bowl until the salt has dissolved.
d9dc5a4b-6dba-47c5-92e8-b580bd6f4d65 Brush the mixture onto the flesh side of lobster tails.
d9dc5a4b-6dba-47c5-92e8-b580bd6f4d65 Place the lobster tails onto the grill and cook for 5 to 7 minutes, turning them once during the cooking process. Depending on the size of the lobster tail, it may need to cook longer.
d9dc5a4b-6dba-47c5-92e8-b580bd6f4d65 Lobster tails will be done once meat reaches an internal temperature 140 F. The shells should turn a bright pink and the flesh should be opaque all the way through the center.
d9dc5a4b-6dba-47c5-92e8-b580bd6f4d65 Remove the lobster tails from the heat. Serve and enjoy!
7574ab9b-aa2d-488d-991b-b2e171ce0467 Gather the ingredients.
7574ab9b-aa2d-488d-991b-b2e171ce0467 Make sure your grill is clean. Rub the cooking grate with a thin layer of oil—1 or 2 teaspoons should be enough. Heat the grill (whether charcoal, gas, or electric) to medium-high. You should be able to hold your hand about 1 inch above the cooking grate for 3 to 4 seconds before pulling it away from the heat. A properly heated grill will help keep the fish from sticking excessively while also cooking it gently and thoroughly without setting it aflame.
7574ab9b-aa2d-488d-991b-b2e171ce0467 While the grill heats, prepare the salmon fillets. Rinse them and pat them dry.
7574ab9b-aa2d-488d-991b-b2e171ce0467 Use tweezers to pull out any pin bones. Pull them out in the direction at which they're coming out for the smoothest results. Don't see any pin bones? Run your finger down the "seam" of the fillet—you'll feel them.
7574ab9b-aa2d-488d-991b-b2e171ce0467 Brush the cooking grate with another 1 to 2 teaspoons of oil. Brush the 4 fillets with the remaining oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
7574ab9b-aa2d-488d-991b-b2e171ce0467 Place the salmon, skin-side-down, on the hot grill and cover. Cook, undisturbed, until the salmon just starts to release its fat (opaque mayonnaise-like stuff), or until it reaches 145 F, which takes about 15 to 20 minutes for most 1-inch thick fillets. Allow another 5 to 10 minutes for each extra inch of thickness. Use a spatula to remove the fish from the grill.
7574ab9b-aa2d-488d-991b-b2e171ce0467 Serve grilled salmon immediately. Offer lemon wedges so people can spritz their salmon with fresh lemon juice, or serve with the garnish of your choice.
be458756-ea6b-43e6-9c26-5285e1d9c450 Gather the ingredients.
be458756-ea6b-43e6-9c26-5285e1d9c450 Preheat grill with heavy cast-iron skillet or griddle in the grill. Get it good and hot, 15 to 30 minutes.
be458756-ea6b-43e6-9c26-5285e1d9c450 Reserve 12 tablespoons of melted butter for serving and pour the rest into a shallow dish.
be458756-ea6b-43e6-9c26-5285e1d9c450 Dip each fillet into butter.
be458756-ea6b-43e6-9c26-5285e1d9c450 Sprinkle Cajun blackening spices on both sides.
be458756-ea6b-43e6-9c26-5285e1d9c450 Place into the skillet and cook for 2 to 3 minutes or until the bottom is almost black but not burned.
be458756-ea6b-43e6-9c26-5285e1d9c450 Carefully flip so fillets do not break.
be458756-ea6b-43e6-9c26-5285e1d9c450 Pour about a teaspoon of ​butter on the cooked side and continue cooking about 2 to 3 minutes or until the fillet is finished (internal temperature of 150 F).
be458756-ea6b-43e6-9c26-5285e1d9c450 Remove fish from pan and place onto a large platter or individual plates.
be458756-ea6b-43e6-9c26-5285e1d9c450 Serve immediately with 2 tablespoons of butter for dipping. Enjoy!
a1d4e36f-8a54-42c8-938b-0181668bb47e Gather the ingredients.
a1d4e36f-8a54-42c8-938b-0181668bb47e Preheat grill to high heat.
a1d4e36f-8a54-42c8-938b-0181668bb47e Make a tray out of a doubled-length of heavy-duty foil large enough for the salmon filet, by folding a long piece in half and folding up all four sides.
a1d4e36f-8a54-42c8-938b-0181668bb47e Spray the entire inside of the foil tray liberally with cooking spray.
a1d4e36f-8a54-42c8-938b-0181668bb47e Place the foil tray on a platter or metal tray to transport to the grill.
a1d4e36f-8a54-42c8-938b-0181668bb47e Place the salmon filet in the foil tray skin-side down (or boned-side up if it is skinned). Squeeze juice over salmon and sprinkle with white wine. Spread top of salmon with the mayonnaise.
a1d4e36f-8a54-42c8-938b-0181668bb47e In a small bowl, mix together kosher salt, onion powder, garlic powder, lemon pepper, oregano, basil, and dill weed.
a1d4e36f-8a54-42c8-938b-0181668bb47e Sprinkle the mixture evenly over the top of the salmon, then top with the sweet paprika.
a1d4e36f-8a54-42c8-938b-0181668bb47e Place baking pan with foil tray on a hot grill.
a1d4e36f-8a54-42c8-938b-0181668bb47e Transfer the foil tray to the hot grill.
a1d4e36f-8a54-42c8-938b-0181668bb47e Cook in a hot covered grill for 10 minutes per inch of thickness of the fish filet.
a1d4e36f-8a54-42c8-938b-0181668bb47e Serve and enjoy!
5f6221bd-73f4-4754-813c-d6e102cc7239 Gather the ingredients.
5f6221bd-73f4-4754-813c-d6e102cc7239 Soak the cedar plank in water for at least 30 minutes and up to four hours before you start the grill.
5f6221bd-73f4-4754-813c-d6e102cc7239 Preheat the grill ​for medium-high heat.
5f6221bd-73f4-4754-813c-d6e102cc7239 Remove the cedar plank from the water and place the salmon fillet in the middle of it, skin-side down. Brush the top of the salmon fillet with olive oil; squeeze the lemon juice over the salmon. Scatter the lemon zest and the dill on top, then season the fillet to taste with the salt and pepper.
5f6221bd-73f4-4754-813c-d6e102cc7239 Place the plank on the grill in the center. Cover the grill and allow the salmon to cook, undisturbed, for about 20 minutes.
5f6221bd-73f4-4754-813c-d6e102cc7239 Test the internal temperature at the thickest part of the fillet with an instant-read or meat thermometer. Pull it off to rest at about 138 to 140 F; the USDA recommends cooking salmon to an internal temperature of 145 F, but the temperature will continue to rise another 5 to 10 degrees after you pull it off the grill. Let it rest for 5 to 10 minutes before you serve it.
5f6221bd-73f4-4754-813c-d6e102cc7239 Serve with your favorite sides and enjoy!
f68b7ea9-f8c8-40ba-aa38-5c04ec6b61a8 Rinse and drain shrimp well.
f68b7ea9-f8c8-40ba-aa38-5c04ec6b61a8 Combine all ingredients in a mixing bowl, and toss until the sugar is dissolved and the shrimp are coated. Cover and let sit for 15 minutes in the fridge.
f68b7ea9-f8c8-40ba-aa38-5c04ec6b61a8 Preheat a skillet over a medium-high flame until hot.
f68b7ea9-f8c8-40ba-aa38-5c04ec6b61a8 Add the shrimp and sear for about 3 minutes, until cooked. The shells will get charred and browned, but the meat inside will not, so don't worry about the outside getting too dark - they should look like they were grilled over coals.
f68b7ea9-f8c8-40ba-aa38-5c04ec6b61a8 Remove to a plate, and when cool enough to handle, serve warm with lemon.
185f090c-1016-46f9-af66-f6e6cf81bb4d Preheat grill for medium-high heat. Season fish with salt and black pepper and place onto grill. Cook for 5 minutes per side.
185f090c-1016-46f9-af66-f6e6cf81bb4d Combine remaining ingredients in a small bowl. Let vinaigrette sit while fish is cooking. When halibut is cooked, remove from heat and drizzle with vinaigrette. Serve with your favorite grilled vegetables.
185f090c-1016-46f9-af66-f6e6cf81bb4d Enjoy!
80e3ecfc-eb76-46a4-ab7f-dfca1047a7f0 Gather the ingredients.
80e3ecfc-eb76-46a4-ab7f-dfca1047a7f0 Combine crab with remaining ingredients in a medium mixing bowl.
80e3ecfc-eb76-46a4-ab7f-dfca1047a7f0 Form crab mixture into 4 to 5 patties.
80e3ecfc-eb76-46a4-ab7f-dfca1047a7f0 Place in a shallow dish, cover, and refrigerate for at least an hour before grilling. This will help the patties to retain their shape and not fall apart on the grill as they tend to be too soft immediately after initial handling.
80e3ecfc-eb76-46a4-ab7f-dfca1047a7f0 Preheat grill for medium-high heat. Place patties on a lightly oiled grill grate.
80e3ecfc-eb76-46a4-ab7f-dfca1047a7f0 Cook for 10 minutes, turning once. Remove from heat and serve immediately with your favorite condiments. Enjoy!
c0fb0f74-dc1b-43f9-b294-61f30b524164 Gather the ingredients.
c0fb0f74-dc1b-43f9-b294-61f30b524164 Combine all ingredients, except shrimp, in a medium mixing bowl.
c0fb0f74-dc1b-43f9-b294-61f30b524164 Add shrimp, cover and let marinate in ​the refrigerator for 2 to 3 hours.
c0fb0f74-dc1b-43f9-b294-61f30b524164 Remove shrimp and save marinade. In a small saucepan, bring marinade to boil, reduce heat to low and let simmer for 10 minutes.
c0fb0f74-dc1b-43f9-b294-61f30b524164 Thread shrimp onto skewers and grill for 5 to 6 minutes, turning occasionally.
c0fb0f74-dc1b-43f9-b294-61f30b524164 Remove from grill and serve immediately with cooked sauce or simply take shrimp off of skewers, place into a dish and pour sauce over top. Garnish with chopped cilantro leaves.
de4b02fb-a651-438f-bf54-51dbf174eeae Gather the ingredients.
de4b02fb-a651-438f-bf54-51dbf174eeae Submerge the cedar plank in water for 1 hour.
de4b02fb-a651-438f-bf54-51dbf174eeae Preheat grill.
de4b02fb-a651-438f-bf54-51dbf174eeae Lightly coat inside and outside of each trout with olive oil. Season inside with salt and pepper and stuff with lemon slices and dill.
de4b02fb-a651-438f-bf54-51dbf174eeae Place soaked cedar plank on grill over direct medium heat.
de4b02fb-a651-438f-bf54-51dbf174eeae When cedar plank starts to smoke, place fish on the plank.
de4b02fb-a651-438f-bf54-51dbf174eeae Grill for about 15 minutes or until the fish is done (reaching an internal temperature of 145 F). The flesh should be opaque and flake easily.
de4b02fb-a651-438f-bf54-51dbf174eeae Once cooked, remove from grill and serve.
a61fef88-cc00-4e6f-bc4a-1fc277511b90 Gather the ingredients.
a61fef88-cc00-4e6f-bc4a-1fc277511b90 To prepare the baste, mix vinegar, sugar, oil, ginger, jalapeño, garlic, and cilantro in a bowl. Cover and set aside.
a61fef88-cc00-4e6f-bc4a-1fc277511b90 Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Drop the crabs, one at a time, headfirst into boiling water. Boil, then reduce heat and let simmer for 5 minutes.
a61fef88-cc00-4e6f-bc4a-1fc277511b90 Remove crabs from the water and pull off the triangular tab from the belly.
a61fef88-cc00-4e6f-bc4a-1fc277511b90 Lift off the shell.
a61fef88-cc00-4e6f-bc4a-1fc277511b90 Clean innards and gills from the crab. Wash, drain, and pat dry with paper towels.
a61fef88-cc00-4e6f-bc4a-1fc277511b90 Preheat grill for medium-high heat.
a61fef88-cc00-4e6f-bc4a-1fc277511b90 Place the crabs on the grill. Cook with the lid closed, brushing with basting mixture after first 2 to 3 minutes of cooking.
a61fef88-cc00-4e6f-bc4a-1fc277511b90 Turn crabs over halfway through grilling, at the 6-minute mark, and baste again.
a61fef88-cc00-4e6f-bc4a-1fc277511b90 The crabs are done when the meat in the leg is opaque, which in total will take about 10 to 12 minutes.
a61fef88-cc00-4e6f-bc4a-1fc277511b90 Place the crab on a serving dish and spoon remaining basting mixture over the crabs. You can replace the shells before serving if you wish. Serve with lemon wedges and drawn butter, as desired.
cc163647-9842-4527-896f-dd661732da9a Soak mesquite chips in water for 30 minutes.
cc163647-9842-4527-896f-dd661732da9a Place mesquite chips in a smoker box or wrap in aluminum foil and punch holes through the foil.
cc163647-9842-4527-896f-dd661732da9a Place on preheated grill.
cc163647-9842-4527-896f-dd661732da9a Gently wash the halibut steaks and pat dry.
cc163647-9842-4527-896f-dd661732da9a Brush the halibut steaks with butter or olive oil (your choice). Sprinkle with pepper.
cc163647-9842-4527-896f-dd661732da9a Cut the orange into slices.
cc163647-9842-4527-896f-dd661732da9a When the grill is good and hot, put on the steaks, placing orange slices on top to cover.
cc163647-9842-4527-896f-dd661732da9a Reduce heat to medium.
cc163647-9842-4527-896f-dd661732da9a Turn after about 4 to 5 minutes (use your discretion, thicker steaks will take longer) cook until the middle is around 160 F (72 C), or until a skewer passes through the steak with uniform resistance (or as we always tell people, cook until done).
cc163647-9842-4527-896f-dd661732da9a Once cooked, remove from heat, top with chopped parsley and serve with your favorite side.
767dc533-0ce0-4e45-85d8-bd35713df74d Gather the ingredients.
767dc533-0ce0-4e45-85d8-bd35713df74d Prepare a smoker for a 2-hour smoke. Wash the fish and remove all the bones, if any.
767dc533-0ce0-4e45-85d8-bd35713df74d In a small bowl, combine the oil, lemon juice, garlic powder, salt, and lemon pepper.
767dc533-0ce0-4e45-85d8-bd35713df74d Brush the liquid mixture onto both sides of the tilapia fillets.
767dc533-0ce0-4e45-85d8-bd35713df74d Place the fish in the smoker for 1 1/2 to 2 hours.
767dc533-0ce0-4e45-85d8-bd35713df74d Remove from heat and serve.
767dc533-0ce0-4e45-85d8-bd35713df74d Enjoy!
86ef4e45-fad1-4b97-a603-899fd73d7457 Combine all ingredients except the salmon.
86ef4e45-fad1-4b97-a603-899fd73d7457 Lay salmon fillets out on a tray or baking sheet. Top with the butter-rum mixture, spreading it evenly over salmon. Let sit for about 15 to 30 minutes.
86ef4e45-fad1-4b97-a603-899fd73d7457 Preheat grill and prepare for indirect grilling. This recipe works particularly well with a charcoal grill.
86ef4e45-fad1-4b97-a603-899fd73d7457 When grill is ready, gently place salmon fillets over the unheated part (indirect) of the grill. Keep the grill on low heat. You can add soaked mesquite chips for an extra smoky flavor. Close ​the lid and let salmon grill for 30 to 45 minutes depending on thickness.
86ef4e45-fad1-4b97-a603-899fd73d7457 Check for doneness by flaking apart the fish at the thickest part. Cooked salmon flakes easily and evenly. The color should be light pink without any shine.
70835e80-c984-41ae-ac5d-b6b8d6029052 Gather the ingredients.
70835e80-c984-41ae-ac5d-b6b8d6029052 Rinse and pat dry the fish fillets with paper towels. Place them in a shallow baking dish.
70835e80-c984-41ae-ac5d-b6b8d6029052 In a small bowl, combine the balsamic vinegar, lemon juice, mustard, onion, and chopped parsley. Mix and pour over the fish. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 20 to 30 minutes.
70835e80-c984-41ae-ac5d-b6b8d6029052 Preheat grill and oil the grates well. Remove fish from marinade and place on grill. Grill on high heat for about 4 to 6 minutes or until fish reaches an internal temperature of at least 145 F. You want this sole to be moist and tender so be sure not to overcook the fish; not only will it be dried out and inedible but it will also smell and taste fishy.
70835e80-c984-41ae-ac5d-b6b8d6029052 Once cooked through, remove from grill, sprinkle salt and pepper, garnish with lemon slices, and serve immediately.
70835e80-c984-41ae-ac5d-b6b8d6029052 Enjoy!
7c5e91f8-886e-4e2e-a08c-c0e862b6b244 Place catfish in a shallow dish. Mix together sauce ingredients and pour over catfish fillets. Cover and allow to marinate for 30 to 45 minutes in the refrigerator.
7c5e91f8-886e-4e2e-a08c-c0e862b6b244 Remove fillets from the dish, discard marinade.
7c5e91f8-886e-4e2e-a08c-c0e862b6b244 Preheat grill for medium-high heat. Place fillets on grill and cook for 12 to 15 minutes (or until internal temperature reaches 145 to 150 F), turning once.
7c5e91f8-886e-4e2e-a08c-c0e862b6b244 Once cooked, remove fish from heat and serve with your favorite side dishes.
97d0b43f-6b4f-4584-865b-cf7e507909a9 Gather the ingredients.
97d0b43f-6b4f-4584-865b-cf7e507909a9 Combine lime juice with honey, oil, garlic, white pepper, and salt. Pour half of the mixture into a separate bowl for basting.
97d0b43f-6b4f-4584-865b-cf7e507909a9 Place peeled and deveined shrimp into a resealable plastic bag (use two if necessary). Pour remaining half of citrus-honey mixture into bag. Make sure all of the shrimp is coated. Seal bag and place in the refrigerator for 15 to 30 minutes (no longer than this).
97d0b43f-6b4f-4584-865b-cf7e507909a9 Preheat grill to high heat.
97d0b43f-6b4f-4584-865b-cf7e507909a9 Remove shrimp from refrigerator and thread 3 to 4 shrimp onto each wooden skewers.
97d0b43f-6b4f-4584-865b-cf7e507909a9 Place shrimp on grill and cook for 2 to 3 minutes.
97d0b43f-6b4f-4584-865b-cf7e507909a9 Baste top sides with reserved citrus-honey mixture.
97d0b43f-6b4f-4584-865b-cf7e507909a9 Turn shrimp once, grill for another 2 to 3 minutes, or until opaque.
97d0b43f-6b4f-4584-865b-cf7e507909a9 Remove from grill and serve immediately.
97d0b43f-6b4f-4584-865b-cf7e507909a9 Enjoy!
0c091fe4-74a8-420f-ba8a-16173d1e964f Sauté green pepper, onion and garlic in olive oil until tender.
0c091fe4-74a8-420f-ba8a-16173d1e964f Add salsa, wine, lemon juice, oregano, cumin. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 8 minutes. Remove from heat.
0c091fe4-74a8-420f-ba8a-16173d1e964f Preheat grill. Take four 12 inch pieces of aluminum foil. Place 1/4 of the snapper on each piece. Top with 1/4 of the sauce. Fold up aluminum foil to form packets.
0c091fe4-74a8-420f-ba8a-16173d1e964f Place fish packets on grill and cook indirectly for about 30 minutes. Check that they are done (internal temperature of 145 to 150 F.) and serve with lemon wedges.
fb3944a6-c4cf-46fd-a3bd-01ab43d738f1 Gather the ingredients.
fb3944a6-c4cf-46fd-a3bd-01ab43d738f1 Combine all ingredients except for the tilapia. Mix well until the salt is dissolved.
fb3944a6-c4cf-46fd-a3bd-01ab43d738f1 Place tilapia in a glass dish and cover with marinade. Turn to coat and set aside for 20 minutes.
fb3944a6-c4cf-46fd-a3bd-01ab43d738f1 Preheat grill.
fb3944a6-c4cf-46fd-a3bd-01ab43d738f1 Pour marinade into a saucepan and bring to a boil, reduce heat and let simmer on low for about 3 to 4 minutes. Remove from heat and let sauce cool.
fb3944a6-c4cf-46fd-a3bd-01ab43d738f1 Grill tilapia fillets over a medium-high heat for about 4 to 5 minutes per side or until the internal temperature at the thickest part of fish reaches between 145 to 150 F.
fb3944a6-c4cf-46fd-a3bd-01ab43d738f1 Serve by pouring a small amount of the sauce over the tilapia fillets.
6015edc0-2b0e-40a7-96ed-a8a504eefefa Gather the ingredients.
6015edc0-2b0e-40a7-96ed-a8a504eefefa If the salmon is frozen, allow it to defrost in the refrigerator.
6015edc0-2b0e-40a7-96ed-a8a504eefefa Combine the lemon juice, lemon zest, oil, thyme, garlic, and salt in a large resealable bag. Add the salmon and turn the fillets or steaks to coat them evenly.
6015edc0-2b0e-40a7-96ed-a8a504eefefa Seal the bag and refrigerate it for 30 minutes to 1 hour. Do not allow it to marinate any longer as the salmon can become mushy.
6015edc0-2b0e-40a7-96ed-a8a504eefefa Preheat the grill for medium-high heat. Right before placing salmon on the grill, oil the grill grates well using large tongs, folded paper towels, and oil. Make several passes across the grates. This will help the fish from sticking and breaking apart.
6015edc0-2b0e-40a7-96ed-a8a504eefefa Remove the salmon from the bag and place on the hot grill. Brush salmon with marinade from the ziptop bag only once, at the start. Grill the salmon for about 4 to 6 minutes per side.
6015edc0-2b0e-40a7-96ed-a8a504eefefa Remove the salmon from the heat once the internal temperature of the fish reaches 145 F. The salmon should be light in color and flake easily through the thickest part.
6015edc0-2b0e-40a7-96ed-a8a504eefefa Optionally, squeeze fresh lemon over each fillet right before you take it off the grill.
6015edc0-2b0e-40a7-96ed-a8a504eefefa Serve and enjoy!
6b556c6a-13ce-4516-8d67-7e9d6b98b456 Gather the ingredients.
6b556c6a-13ce-4516-8d67-7e9d6b98b456 Mix oil, vinegar, and lime juice together in a saucepan and heat over medium heat. Add marmalade, Tabasco sauce, salt, and black pepper then mix well. Add jalapeno peppers, cilantro, and garlic and mix to combine.
6b556c6a-13ce-4516-8d67-7e9d6b98b456 Remove from heat and allow to cool. Place shrimp in a large zip-top bag. Pour marinade over top. Seal and refrigerate for 20 to 30 minutes.
6b556c6a-13ce-4516-8d67-7e9d6b98b456 Preheat grill. Remove shrimp from marinade and place on a hot grill. Grill about 5 to 10 minutes, turning occasionally until done. Cooked shrimp will be pink and firm to the touch.
6b556c6a-13ce-4516-8d67-7e9d6b98b456 Serve and enjoy!
ba30f32d-c2ef-4eda-bf6b-6838137bc84e Peel and devein shrimp.
ba30f32d-c2ef-4eda-bf6b-6838137bc84e Rinse and set aside on paper towels to dry.
ba30f32d-c2ef-4eda-bf6b-6838137bc84e Combine remaining ingredients. Mix well.
ba30f32d-c2ef-4eda-bf6b-6838137bc84e Place shrimp in resealable plastic bag and pour yogurt mixture into bag making sure all shrimp are well coated.
ba30f32d-c2ef-4eda-bf6b-6838137bc84e Seal bag and place in refrigerator for one hour.
ba30f32d-c2ef-4eda-bf6b-6838137bc84e Preheat grill for high heat.
ba30f32d-c2ef-4eda-bf6b-6838137bc84e Thread shrimp onto skewers.
ba30f32d-c2ef-4eda-bf6b-6838137bc84e Place shrimp on hot grill and immediately brush with marinade.
ba30f32d-c2ef-4eda-bf6b-6838137bc84e Grill for about 2 to 3 minutes per side or until done. Shrimp is done when the color has changed from a glossy gray color to a pink color. Shrimp should take on a pink hue.
ba30f32d-c2ef-4eda-bf6b-6838137bc84e Remove from grill and serve with sliced lemons or limes.
1594b6df-12b8-411d-83a7-b5a4d7eef905 Place sea bass pieces in a shallow glass dish.
1594b6df-12b8-411d-83a7-b5a4d7eef905 In a small bowl, combine all marinade ingredients.
1594b6df-12b8-411d-83a7-b5a4d7eef905 Pour mixture over fish, cover, and allow to marinate in the refrigerator for 3 to 12 hours.
1594b6df-12b8-411d-83a7-b5a4d7eef905 Preheat grill for medium-high heat.
1594b6df-12b8-411d-83a7-b5a4d7eef905 Remove fish from glass dish and discard marinade.
1594b6df-12b8-411d-83a7-b5a4d7eef905 Place fish on grill and cook for 10 to 12 minutes, turning once.
1594b6df-12b8-411d-83a7-b5a4d7eef905 When fish is opaque and flakes easily, remove from heat and serve.
2e00d007-4f85-4071-a69e-086940edadc8 Gather the ingredients.
2e00d007-4f85-4071-a69e-086940edadc8 Peel and devein shrimp. Blot dry with paper towels and place in a resealable plastic bag.
2e00d007-4f85-4071-a69e-086940edadc8 Combine marinade ingredients together in a bowl or large mixing cup.
2e00d007-4f85-4071-a69e-086940edadc8 Pour mixture over shrimp. Seal bag and place in refrigerator for 30 to 45 minutes, but no longer than that as the acid from the lemon juice will begin to soften the shrimp.
2e00d007-4f85-4071-a69e-086940edadc8 Preheat grill for medium-high heat. Right before placing shrimp on the grill, oil grill grates well-using tongs and paper towels dipped in oil. Make about four passes to create a non-stick surface.
2e00d007-4f85-4071-a69e-086940edadc8 Remove shrimp from bag and discard marinade. Place shrimp on grill and allow to cook for 2 to 3 minutes on each side or until they appear pink and firm all the way around.
2e00d007-4f85-4071-a69e-086940edadc8 Remove from heat and serve immediately with a little extra chopped cilantro or basil on top.
2e00d007-4f85-4071-a69e-086940edadc8 Enjoy!
f5befed3-0cea-4c5d-9c15-017bc1e8c850 Gather the ingredients.
f5befed3-0cea-4c5d-9c15-017bc1e8c850 Clean and remove any skin from salmon fillets.
f5befed3-0cea-4c5d-9c15-017bc1e8c850 Place in a shallow baking dish and pour maple syrup over top. Turn to coat evenly.
f5befed3-0cea-4c5d-9c15-017bc1e8c850 Sprinkle each side with salt and black pepper.
f5befed3-0cea-4c5d-9c15-017bc1e8c850 Cover and refrigerator for 24 hours.
f5befed3-0cea-4c5d-9c15-017bc1e8c850 Prepare smoker. Place fillets in a smoker at about 200F for about 1 1/2 hours.
f5befed3-0cea-4c5d-9c15-017bc1e8c850 When you are ready to remove the salmon from the smoker, heat the butter in a skillet.
f5befed3-0cea-4c5d-9c15-017bc1e8c850 Place fillets gently in skillet for about 2 minutes per side. This creates a nice glaze over the surface of the salmon.
f5befed3-0cea-4c5d-9c15-017bc1e8c850 Serve and enjoy.
665cbe3c-e5e0-48d0-8672-c94b8290f327 Preheat grill for medium heat.
665cbe3c-e5e0-48d0-8672-c94b8290f327 Combine all ingredients, besides catfish, in a large bowl.
665cbe3c-e5e0-48d0-8672-c94b8290f327 Add fish to the bowl, coat well, cover the bowl and allow to stand for 5 to 10 minutes at room temperature.
665cbe3c-e5e0-48d0-8672-c94b8290f327 Remove fillets from bowl making sure to reserve marinade.
665cbe3c-e5e0-48d0-8672-c94b8290f327 Place fish on a lightly oiled grill grate, brush with half the marinade and allow to cook for 5 minutes.
665cbe3c-e5e0-48d0-8672-c94b8290f327 Turn fish, brush with remaining marinade, and cook for additional 7 to 9 minutes.
665cbe3c-e5e0-48d0-8672-c94b8290f327 Remove from heat on the internal temperature of fish reaches at least 145 F and serve.
f3164aee-f359-465b-857d-7493a27af01d Gather the ingredients.
f3164aee-f359-465b-857d-7493a27af01d Preheat grill for medium-high heat.
f3164aee-f359-465b-857d-7493a27af01d Place fillets in 4 large pieces of aluminum foil (packets). Make sure all bones are out of the fillet.
f3164aee-f359-465b-857d-7493a27af01d Combine remaining ingredients in a bowl.
f3164aee-f359-465b-857d-7493a27af01d Cover each fillet with about 2-3 tablespoons of sauce. Fold over the edges of the packets, to secure them.
f3164aee-f359-465b-857d-7493a27af01d Place the packets on the grill allowing them to cook for 15 minutes.
f3164aee-f359-465b-857d-7493a27af01d Remove from heat and cut packets open to release steam before serving.
03fc4ceb-0a68-4d46-8465-88cbd17ff0de Rinse swordfish steaks well under cold water and pat dry with paper towels.
03fc4ceb-0a68-4d46-8465-88cbd17ff0de Combine olive oil, lemon juice, salt, pepper, Worcestershire sauce, and Tabasco sauce. Stir well.
03fc4ceb-0a68-4d46-8465-88cbd17ff0de Brush fish with the mixture then sprinkle with about half of the paprika. Set remaining lemon juice mixture and paprika aside.
03fc4ceb-0a68-4d46-8465-88cbd17ff0de Place the swordfish on a well-greased grill over medium coals or in a greased grilling basket.
03fc4ceb-0a68-4d46-8465-88cbd17ff0de Grill the fish over medium coals for about eight minutes on each side or until fish flakes easily with a fork or grill at about 350 F on a gas grill.
03fc4ceb-0a68-4d46-8465-88cbd17ff0de Baste with the lemon juice mixture several times and sprinkle the finished fish with the remaining paprika before serving.
968c5155-4696-43c1-8fd8-e683932cc5b4 Combine olive oil, lime juice, lime zest, fresh basil, bourbon, salt and black pepper in a small bowl. Place tilapia fillets in a resealable plastic bag and pour marinade over top. Make sure all surfaces are coated well with the marinade. Seal bag and refrigerator for 30 minutes.
968c5155-4696-43c1-8fd8-e683932cc5b4 Preheat grill for medium-high heat.
968c5155-4696-43c1-8fd8-e683932cc5b4 Remove fish from bag and pour marinade into a saucepan. Bring marinade to a boil, immediately reduce heat and let simmer on low for 5 minutes. Remove from heat, cover and keep warm.
968c5155-4696-43c1-8fd8-e683932cc5b4 Grill tilapia fillets for 3 to 5 minutes per side over high heat. When fish reaches an internal temperature of 145 F. and appears opaque in color, remove from grill and serve with a few spoonfuls of marinade drizzled over top.
968c5155-4696-43c1-8fd8-e683932cc5b4 If using the fish for tacos. Skip the last step and brush the tilapia with the cooked marinade as it cooks. Remove from heat once done and flake into bite-sized pieces.
2bfff1e5-b60f-4cb5-a42f-f47d2c1e8bb7 Gather the ingredients.
2bfff1e5-b60f-4cb5-a42f-f47d2c1e8bb7 Combine all ingredients, except fish, in a large mixing bowl. Add sea bass, making sure to coat very well.
2bfff1e5-b60f-4cb5-a42f-f47d2c1e8bb7 Preheat grill for high heat.
2bfff1e5-b60f-4cb5-a42f-f47d2c1e8bb7 After 30 minutes, remove fish from marinade.
2bfff1e5-b60f-4cb5-a42f-f47d2c1e8bb7 Place fish on the grill. Brush the marinade on top of the fish and cook for 5 to 7 minutes.
2bfff1e5-b60f-4cb5-a42f-f47d2c1e8bb7 Turn the fish over and apply the marinade and cook for 5 to 7 minutes, or until fish flakes easily with a fork.
2bfff1e5-b60f-4cb5-a42f-f47d2c1e8bb7 When done, remove from heat and serve.
6bc4931f-f2f8-4807-906d-8688ad6d1771 Gather the ingredients.
6bc4931f-f2f8-4807-906d-8688ad6d1771 Preheat grill for medium heat.
6bc4931f-f2f8-4807-906d-8688ad6d1771 Right before placing the fish onto the grill, oil the grill grates well, using tongs, folded paper towels and a high smoke point oil. Make 3 to 4 passes across grates to create a non-stick surface. (This is particularly important when grilling fish, as it tends to stick to the grates and break apart.)
6bc4931f-f2f8-4807-906d-8688ad6d1771 Place salmon fillets in a shallow pan.
6bc4931f-f2f8-4807-906d-8688ad6d1771 Combine 2 teaspoons lime juice, spices, sugar, and garlic.
6bc4931f-f2f8-4807-906d-8688ad6d1771 Spread mixture evenly over fillets.
6bc4931f-f2f8-4807-906d-8688ad6d1771 Let stand until the grill has heated up properly. (If you do this ahead of time, place seasoned fish in the refrigerator for a maximum of 30 minutes.)
6bc4931f-f2f8-4807-906d-8688ad6d1771 Place salmon skin side down onto grill and cook indirectly for about 18 to 20 minutes, or until internal temperature at the thickest part of fish reaches between 145 to 150 F.
6bc4931f-f2f8-4807-906d-8688ad6d1771 Remember not to turn the salmon when it is on the grill.
6bc4931f-f2f8-4807-906d-8688ad6d1771 Once cooked through (an internal temperature of 145 F.), remove from grill and squeeze fresh lime juice on each fillet before serving.
6bc4931f-f2f8-4807-906d-8688ad6d1771 Enjoy!
366a8fa1-9fe5-4f85-b57b-0120e1dc35e1 Gather the ingredients. Preheat grill to medium-high heat.
366a8fa1-9fe5-4f85-b57b-0120e1dc35e1 In small skillet, melt butter. Add onions and cook for 1 to 2 minutes.
366a8fa1-9fe5-4f85-b57b-0120e1dc35e1 Add white wine and let simmer for an additional 3 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool for 5 minutes.
366a8fa1-9fe5-4f85-b57b-0120e1dc35e1 Brush fish fillets with extra-virgin olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place fish on a well-oiled grill rack and cook for 8 minutes.
366a8fa1-9fe5-4f85-b57b-0120e1dc35e1 Baste cod with butter sauce and carefully flip over fish. Cook for an additional 6 to 7 minutes, basting fish a total of 2 to 3 times, or until fish is opaque, flakes easily with a fork, and reaches an internal temperature of 145 F.
366a8fa1-9fe5-4f85-b57b-0120e1dc35e1 Remove cod from the grill, top with lemon wedges, and serve.
5a7090f2-0c02-4e16-a4cf-6038bd301dfa Gather the ingredients.
5a7090f2-0c02-4e16-a4cf-6038bd301dfa Rinse salmon steaks, pat dry with paper towels, and place them into a shallow baking dish.
5a7090f2-0c02-4e16-a4cf-6038bd301dfa Combine marinade ingredients, pour over salmon, making sure both sides are coated.
5a7090f2-0c02-4e16-a4cf-6038bd301dfa Cover with plastic wrap and place into the refrigerator for 30 to 40 minutes.
5a7090f2-0c02-4e16-a4cf-6038bd301dfa Meanwhile, preheat the grill for medium heat.
5a7090f2-0c02-4e16-a4cf-6038bd301dfa Brush vegetables with olive oil and place onto grill.
5a7090f2-0c02-4e16-a4cf-6038bd301dfa Cook until there is a nice brown color (not too charred) and skin begins to lift on tomatoes.
5a7090f2-0c02-4e16-a4cf-6038bd301dfa Remove from heat, allow to cool for 5 to 10 minutes.
5a7090f2-0c02-4e16-a4cf-6038bd301dfa Slice tomatoes and peppers, making sure to de-seed them. Add these and all salsa ingredients, except cilantro and salt, to food processor. Pulse mixture to preferred consistency. Scoop salsa into bowl, add salt and chopped cilantro leaves. Set aside.
5a7090f2-0c02-4e16-a4cf-6038bd301dfa Remove salmon from baking dish and place onto the grill and cook for 6 minutes. To turn, using a spatula, gently coax fish away from grill grate, and flip over. Cook for addition 6 minutes. Remove from heat, top with 1/4 to 1/3 cup/60 to 80 mL of salsa (depending on size and preference) and serve.
5a7090f2-0c02-4e16-a4cf-6038bd301dfa Enjoy!
df6ec60d-fed6-47f6-8cfd-2a9c9b0356e7 Gather the ingredients.
df6ec60d-fed6-47f6-8cfd-2a9c9b0356e7 Mix together the paprika, cayenne, salt, garlic salt, onion salt, thyme, oregano, and pepper.
df6ec60d-fed6-47f6-8cfd-2a9c9b0356e7 Sprinkle over each side of the red snapper.
df6ec60d-fed6-47f6-8cfd-2a9c9b0356e7 Preheat the grill to high heat.
df6ec60d-fed6-47f6-8cfd-2a9c9b0356e7 Bring the lemon juice to a simmer in a small saucepan or heat to a simmer in the microwave in a safe dish.
df6ec60d-fed6-47f6-8cfd-2a9c9b0356e7 Remove from heat and add butter. Mix well.
df6ec60d-fed6-47f6-8cfd-2a9c9b0356e7 Right before placing fish on the grill, oil the grill grates well. Make several passes as this will create a nice non-stick surface.
df6ec60d-fed6-47f6-8cfd-2a9c9b0356e7 Grill the red snapper about 5 to 6 minutes on one side, until the seasonings are blackened.
df6ec60d-fed6-47f6-8cfd-2a9c9b0356e7 Turn the snapper over and grill for another 5 to 6 minutes until done or until the fish reaches an internal temperature of at least 145 F.
df6ec60d-fed6-47f6-8cfd-2a9c9b0356e7 Once cooked through, remove the fish from grill and plate.
df6ec60d-fed6-47f6-8cfd-2a9c9b0356e7 Add parsley to the lemon butter and spoon a quarter of the butter mixture over each piece of fish.
df6ec60d-fed6-47f6-8cfd-2a9c9b0356e7 Serve with grilled vegetables or your favorite sides.
df6ec60d-fed6-47f6-8cfd-2a9c9b0356e7 Enjoy!
fbdfa867-08db-4e96-821c-257ba765e9fb Gather the ingredients.
fbdfa867-08db-4e96-821c-257ba765e9fb Mix whiskey, soy sauce, orange juice, oil and garlic in a medium bowl.
fbdfa867-08db-4e96-821c-257ba765e9fb Place fish in a shallow dish and pour mixture over top. Cover with plastic wrap and place salmon sit in the refrigerator for 3 minutes to 1 hour.
fbdfa867-08db-4e96-821c-257ba765e9fb Preheat grill for medium-high heat.
fbdfa867-08db-4e96-821c-257ba765e9fb Once heated, oil grill grates to create a non-stick surface. Make at least 4 to 5 passes on the grates.
fbdfa867-08db-4e96-821c-257ba765e9fb Place fish on hot grill and cook for 5 minutes on each side.
fbdfa867-08db-4e96-821c-257ba765e9fb The salmon is done when it flakes easily, has faded in color, and reaches an internal temperature of at least 145 F. Carefully remove fish from the grill and serve.
fbdfa867-08db-4e96-821c-257ba765e9fb Plate the fish and serve with your favorite sides.
13d9e875-1e20-4167-b1a9-52638c70d286 Gather the ingredients.
13d9e875-1e20-4167-b1a9-52638c70d286 In a small bowl, whisk together the orange juice, soy sauce, ketchup, chopped parsley or cilantro, lemon juice, minced garlic, black pepper, salt, and red pepper flakes.
13d9e875-1e20-4167-b1a9-52638c70d286 Place the fish in a shallow baking dish and pour the marinade over the top. Using tongs, turn the shark steaks to coat well. Cover with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator for 1 to 2 hours.
13d9e875-1e20-4167-b1a9-52638c70d286 Heat a grill to medium-high heat. Right before placing fish on the grill, oil the grill grates using a pair of outdoor cooking tongs and folded paper towels soaked with oil. Make about 3 to 4 passes across the grates to ensure a nonstick cooking surface. This is important when grilling fish since it tends to fall apart if conditions are not quite right.
13d9e875-1e20-4167-b1a9-52638c70d286 Remove the fish from the marinade, reserving the marinade and pouring it into a saucepan. Bring to a high simmer for 2 minutes, stirring often. Reduce the heat to medium-low and let simmer for 10 to 12 minutes. Remove from the heat and cover to keep the sauce warm.
13d9e875-1e20-4167-b1a9-52638c70d286 Place the fish on the preheated grill and cook for 5 to 6 minutes per side, or until the fish reaches an internal temperature of 145 F and flakes easily when tested with a fork.
13d9e875-1e20-4167-b1a9-52638c70d286 Once cooked, remove the shark steaks from the grill and serve with sauce.
d5ecd2e9-a69b-418c-8e94-0102a4d30f47 Gather the ingredients.
d5ecd2e9-a69b-418c-8e94-0102a4d30f47 Combine marinade ingredients in a large bowl.
d5ecd2e9-a69b-418c-8e94-0102a4d30f47 Add peeled shrimp, coat well, cover and allow to marinade for 10 to 15 minutes in refrigerator.
d5ecd2e9-a69b-418c-8e94-0102a4d30f47 Preheat grill for medium-high heat.
d5ecd2e9-a69b-418c-8e94-0102a4d30f47 Remove shrimp from marinade and thread onto skewers alternating between pineapple and red onion chunks.
d5ecd2e9-a69b-418c-8e94-0102a4d30f47 Place reserved marinade in a pot over medium-high heat, bring to boil, a reduce heat to medium-low and cook for 5 to 6 minutes, stirring occasionally. Watch to make sure that it doesn't burn. You can cook the marinade on the side burner if your grill has one. Once cooked, remove from heat and cool.
d5ecd2e9-a69b-418c-8e94-0102a4d30f47 Place shrimp kebabs onto grill and cook for 3 to 4 minutes per side.
d5ecd2e9-a69b-418c-8e94-0102a4d30f47 Remove from heat and serve with sauce drizzled over top.
4b9cc51f-dcf5-4390-8d3c-3622e5b5f100 Gather the ingredients and preheat a grill to medium heat.
4b9cc51f-dcf5-4390-8d3c-3622e5b5f100 Roast the corn on medium heat until sweet and tender, about 15 minutes.
4b9cc51f-dcf5-4390-8d3c-3622e5b5f100 Husk the corn toward the end of cooking and char corn directly on the hot grill for extra flavor and color, about 3 minutes.
4b9cc51f-dcf5-4390-8d3c-3622e5b5f100 In a medium bowl, bring together the sour cream, mayonnaise, and lime juice.
4b9cc51f-dcf5-4390-8d3c-3622e5b5f100 Using a microplane or a garlic press, grate the garlic into the mixture. Add the salt and whisk to combine.
4b9cc51f-dcf5-4390-8d3c-3622e5b5f100 Spread the mayo mixture onto a flat plate. Combine the Parmesan cheese and queso fresco on a separate flat plate.
4b9cc51f-dcf5-4390-8d3c-3622e5b5f100 Roll the corn in the mayo mixture to completely coat each ear. You can use corn on the cob holders to help you roll them; tongs will also work. Do the same in the cheese mixture and set the corn aside on a platter.
4b9cc51f-dcf5-4390-8d3c-3622e5b5f100 Top the corn with chopped cilantro and a sprinkle of chili powder. Serve immediately.
d4e76be6-3179-4350-aea6-3d872e7cea92 Gather the ingredients.
d4e76be6-3179-4350-aea6-3d872e7cea92 Preheat a grill on low heat if you're using gas, or create an indirect heat section if you're using charcoal.
d4e76be6-3179-4350-aea6-3d872e7cea92 Bring a medium pot of water to boil. Add the potatoes and cook for 8 to 10 minutes, or until almost done, but not quite tender. Drain completely and spread out on a towel, baking sheet, or cooling rack to let cool a bit and dry off.
d4e76be6-3179-4350-aea6-3d872e7cea92 Meanwhile, make the dressing: in a small bowl, whisk together the lemon juice, garlic, soy sauce, honey, and dijon mustard until fully mixed. Set aside.
d4e76be6-3179-4350-aea6-3d872e7cea92 Once the grill is hot, toss the carrots with 1/3 of the olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Position over indirect heat (if using charcoal) and close the grill. Cook for 10 minutes.
d4e76be6-3179-4350-aea6-3d872e7cea92 Toss the cabbage in another 1/3 of the oil and season with salt and pepper. Turn the carrots on the grill and add the cabbage, Turn up the heat if you're using gas, or slide the veggies closer to the direct heat if you're using charcoal. Close the grill and cook for 4 to 5 minutes, or until the cabbage is lightly charred.
d4e76be6-3179-4350-aea6-3d872e7cea92 Toss the potatoes in the remaining oil and season with salt and pepper. Flip the cabbage and add the potatoes to a hot section of the grill. Cook for 3 to 5 more minutes, flipping the potatoes halfway through. The potatoes should have grill marks and be cooked through.
d4e76be6-3179-4350-aea6-3d872e7cea92 Remove all of the vegetables to a platter. Toss with the dressing and top with the parsley. Serve warm or room temperature.
019898c5-65ba-4bcb-b5b7-2f9ff11c600d Gather the ingredients.
019898c5-65ba-4bcb-b5b7-2f9ff11c600d Combine marinade ingredients in a small bowl and set aside. Place flat steak, chicken, or tofu in a resealable bag. Pour marinade over top making sure that all surfaces are coated. Seal bag and place in refrigerator. Marinate steak for 1-3 hours, chicken for 1-2 hours, and tofu or vegetables for 15-30 minutes.
019898c5-65ba-4bcb-b5b7-2f9ff11c600d While meat is marinating, prepare the lime-cilantro sauce. Place seeded and chopped jalapeño, green onion, cilantro, lime juice, and 1/2 cup/120 mL of the yogurt in a blender or food processor. Puree mixture well. If you intend to use a condiment bottle to drizzle sauce over the nachos, you will need to make sure there are no chunks remaining. Most blenders are efficient all pulverizing vegetable matter, but in case you are left with some unprocessed pieces, run the mixture through a sieve into a bowl. Add the remaining 1/2 cup/120 mL of yogurt and season with 1/4 teaspoon/1.75 mL salt. Transfer into condiment bottle (use a funnel to make this step easier) and store in the refrigerator until nachos are done.
019898c5-65ba-4bcb-b5b7-2f9ff11c600d Prepare grill for medium high heat. If using the oven, set to 375 degrees F.
019898c5-65ba-4bcb-b5b7-2f9ff11c600d Wash and rinse sweet potatoes. Dry off with a paper towel and chop off pointy ends. Cut into 1/4" slices. Add 2 tablespoons/30 mL of olive oil to cast iron pan. Make sure the entire bottom is well coated. Layer sweet potatoes by stacking them halfway on top of the previous one, working from the outside to the center in a circular pattern. Season with salt and place onto the grill on direct heat for 10 minutes. Move to indirect heat and cook for an additional 15-20 minutes. Watch for burning and adjust heat accordingly. ​​
019898c5-65ba-4bcb-b5b7-2f9ff11c600d Once sweet potatoes are cooking over indirect heat, it is time to cook the corn. Remove husks and threads and place onto the grill, rotating corn every 30 seconds to 1 minute, until it begins to blister and char a bit. Don't over do this process or you'll end up with hard, burnt corn. Remove from heat and let cool for a few minutes. Using a sharp knife, carefully cut away kernels and place into a bowl. Cover with plastic wrap until ready to use.
019898c5-65ba-4bcb-b5b7-2f9ff11c600d Remove steaks from marinade and place onto grill. If opting for a thin steak, it will be fully cooked in 5-7 minutes. Tofu and other vegetables will be between 3-5 minutes. If using chicken breast, consider cooking this first before the corn. This will take longer and needs to reach a safe temperature of 165 degrees F. in the thickest part of the breast before it is considered done. Once meat (tofu, or vegetables) has cooked through, remove from heat and cut into bite sized pieces.
019898c5-65ba-4bcb-b5b7-2f9ff11c600d Now it's time to assemble the nachos while the cast iron skillet is still on the grill. Place the pinto beans on top of the sweet potatoes. Next, the grilled corn kernels. Top with sliced steak (or whatever you choose for this portion), then crumbled queso fresco. Place the lid back on the grill and let it go for 5-7 minutes until everything has warmed through and cheese has melted.
019898c5-65ba-4bcb-b5b7-2f9ff11c600d Using heat resistant gloves, carefully remove cast iron skillet and place onto hot pads on a safe surface. The nachos will be sizzling at this point, so let them rest for 5-10 minutes or so. Drizzle liberally with sauce, garnish with cilantro, sliced green onions, and serve. The best way to get them out of the pan is with a spatula. Use a fork to eat these nachos, especially while it's still piping hot.
30525bb8-a035-48fb-a76b-219d18e66fcb Gather the ingredients.
30525bb8-a035-48fb-a76b-219d18e66fcb Fire up your grill, or if using a grill pan then preheat to hot but not searing.
30525bb8-a035-48fb-a76b-219d18e66fcb Pat dry the washed hearts with kitchen paper. Remove any browned or wilted outer leaves and check inside for any insects or remaining dirt (it is unlikely you will find any but best to check).
30525bb8-a035-48fb-a76b-219d18e66fcb Halve the romaine hearts lengthwise, leaving the cores intact. Brush all the surfaces of the lettuce with the olive oil.
30525bb8-a035-48fb-a76b-219d18e66fcb Grill the hearts, cut side down, over medium heat for 2 minutes on each side, until char marks appear on the surface of the lettuce and it wilts slightly.
30525bb8-a035-48fb-a76b-219d18e66fcb Alternately, turn a broiler on high heat and place the hearts of romaine 5 inches from the heat. Broil them for 2 minutes on each side, until the lettuce begins to brown and wilts very slightly. Watch the cooking process closely, as the lettuce will cook very quickly and burn.
30525bb8-a035-48fb-a76b-219d18e66fcb Place the grilled lettuce, cut side up, on a serving platter. Drizzle the romaine with balsamic vinegar, sprinkle with black pepper and freshly grated parmesan cheese (do not use pre-grated cheese as this does not melt as easily.
30525bb8-a035-48fb-a76b-219d18e66fcb Serve and enjoy!
80a57817-3bc8-45d2-8989-2d21802fb593 Gather the ingredients.
80a57817-3bc8-45d2-8989-2d21802fb593 Heat a gas or charcoal grill to medium-high heat (you should be able to hold your hand about 1 inch above the cooking grate for 3 to 4 seconds before pulling it away from the intensity of the heat).
80a57817-3bc8-45d2-8989-2d21802fb593 While the grill heats, trim off and discard any wilted greens at the top of the spring onions. Cut off and discard the root end of the onions as well. Be careful to cut right at the bottom of the onion and the top of the roots so the bulb stays together and you can cook and serve the onions intact.
80a57817-3bc8-45d2-8989-2d21802fb593 Brush the spring onions with olive oil or vegetable oil. Be liberal with the application of the oil — it prevents the onions from sticking to the hot grill and adds tons of flavor as it mixes with the juices from the onions.
80a57817-3bc8-45d2-8989-2d21802fb593 Put the spring onions on the preheated grill and cook them, turning once, until grill marks appear on both sides and the spring onions feel fork tender all the way through, about 15 minutes total cooking time.
80a57817-3bc8-45d2-8989-2d21802fb593 Sprinkle the grilled spring onions with salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste.
80a57817-3bc8-45d2-8989-2d21802fb593 Spritz the onions with fresh lemon juice or serve the lemon wedges on the side so everyone can dress their own plate.
a16684b8-8820-48e0-90f1-7c34484e057f Bring a large stock pot of water to boil. Add 1/2 tablespoon or 7.5 mL salt to water. Cut each chayote in half lengthwise and place into pot. Let cook on medium high heat for 15 minutes. Remove from heat and set onto clean towels to drain and cool. About 10 minutes. Once cooled, scoop out seeds and some of the flesh to make room for the filling. Blot with paper towels to remove any excess moisture and set aside.
a16684b8-8820-48e0-90f1-7c34484e057f While chayote is simmering, prepare the filling. Fry ground beef with white parts of the green onion. After 3 minutes, add the green part of the green onions, minced garlic, and remaining ingredients except for the broth. Continue cooking for another 6 minutes or until beef has cooked through. Remove from heat and pour in the chicken (or vegetable) stock. Cover and set aside for at least 10 minutes. If opting to keep it vegetarian, simply replace ground beef with meat substitute of your choice or sauteed vegetables.
a16684b8-8820-48e0-90f1-7c34484e057f Preheat grill for medium-high heat. If using a charcoal grill, keep a space available for indirect grilling.
a16684b8-8820-48e0-90f1-7c34484e057f Brush olive oil onto chayote halves. Make sure to get both the flesh and skin portions. Place cut side down onto grill for 3 to 4 minutes to achieve grill marks. Rotate once. Remove from grill and place about 1/3 cup or 80 mL of filling into the cut and grilled side. Press mixture to secure it in place.
a16684b8-8820-48e0-90f1-7c34484e057f Place chayote back onto the grill, skin side down. Cook on indirect heat for 25 to 35 minutes, or until chayote is nice and tender (not mushy). Right before taking them off the grill, add some more cheese on top of the filling and let it cook for an additional 1 to 2 minutes.
a16684b8-8820-48e0-90f1-7c34484e057f Once cooked, remove from heat and let rest for 5 minutes. Serve.
88817f1c-0226-4434-8548-ca0cd46f95f7 Gather the ingredients.
88817f1c-0226-4434-8548-ca0cd46f95f7 Rinse the lemons clean. If you have any plans to use or otherwise eat the peel, you may even want to go so far as to scrub them with soap before rinsing them. Pat them dry. To release extra juice, roll them on a hard surface.
88817f1c-0226-4434-8548-ca0cd46f95f7 Cut the lemons in half crosswise.
88817f1c-0226-4434-8548-ca0cd46f95f7 Optional: Pop out and discard any visible seeds. Use the tip of a paring knife to urge any deeper-set seeds to the surface. This is a kind service to your fellow diners since it minimizes the chance that they'll bite into a bitter seed while enjoying their lovely grilled lemons.
88817f1c-0226-4434-8548-ca0cd46f95f7 Use a pastry brush, silicone grilling brush, or a paper towel to brush the cut sides with a bit of oil. You can sprinkle the cut sides with fine sea salt, too, if you want to add a more intense savory effect to the grilled lemons.
88817f1c-0226-4434-8548-ca0cd46f95f7 Set the lemons cut-side-down on the hot grill or in the frying pan. Cook until the lemons are heated through and charred on the cut side, about 3 minutes. Ideally, you'll cook them without moving them so they char nicely, but adjust them if the heat seems uneven so they char evenly.
88817f1c-0226-4434-8548-ca0cd46f95f7 Enjoy!
7e153ea1-36cb-41ca-a831-483b8fc581e8 Gather the ingredients.
7e153ea1-36cb-41ca-a831-483b8fc581e8 In a large bowl, dissolve the 2 tablespoons of salt in 1 cup warm water; stir until the salt is fully dissolved. Add 6 to 8 cups cold water. Set the brine aside.
7e153ea1-36cb-41ca-a831-483b8fc581e8 Cut off and discard the stem end of the eggplant.
7e153ea1-36cb-41ca-a831-483b8fc581e8 Cut the eggplant into 3/4-inch thick slices (either diagonal, crosswise, or lengthwise).
7e153ea1-36cb-41ca-a831-483b8fc581e8 Place the slices in the saltwater brine.
7e153ea1-36cb-41ca-a831-483b8fc581e8 Weigh the eggplant slices down with an upside-down plate; let soak for at least 30 minutes or up to an hour.
7e153ea1-36cb-41ca-a831-483b8fc581e8 Meanwhile, heat a charcoal or gas grill to medium-high heat. You should be able to hold your hand about an inch above the cooking grate for 3 to 4 seconds before pulling it away from the heat.
7e153ea1-36cb-41ca-a831-483b8fc581e8 Drain the eggplant and pat it dry with paper towels or a clean kitchen towel.
7e153ea1-36cb-41ca-a831-483b8fc581e8 Lay the slices on a large baking sheet or tray. Brush one side with olive oil and sprinkle with salt.
7e153ea1-36cb-41ca-a831-483b8fc581e8 Place the slices with the oiled side on the grill. Close the lid if using a gas or electric grill and cook until grill marks appear; about 5 minutes.
7e153ea1-36cb-41ca-a831-483b8fc581e8 Brush the top sides of the slices with oil and sprinkle them with salt. Turn the slices over, close the lid of the grill, and cook until grill marks appear on the other side and the eggplant is very tender; about 5 more minutes.
7e153ea1-36cb-41ca-a831-483b8fc581e8 Serve hot or at room temperature.
b3babdcd-cd3a-4758-9c74-8eb2f296793b Gather the ingredients.
b3babdcd-cd3a-4758-9c74-8eb2f296793b Prepare a gas or charcoal grill for high heat (you can hold your hand an inch above the cooking grate for just 1 to 2 seconds before pulling it away because it feels so hot).
b3babdcd-cd3a-4758-9c74-8eb2f296793b Trim or peel the asparagus (see How to Trim Asparagus and/or How to Peel Asparagus if you've never prepared asparagus before).
b3babdcd-cd3a-4758-9c74-8eb2f296793b Toss the asparagus with the oil to coat it thoroughly. Feel free to use more oil, if you want; to coat it with a minimal amount involves lots of tossing.
b3babdcd-cd3a-4758-9c74-8eb2f296793b Place the asparagus on the grill, cover, and cook until the asparagus color heightens and grill marks appear, 4 to 5 minutes. Turn the asparagus, cover, and cook until tender, about 4 to 5 more minutes.
b3babdcd-cd3a-4758-9c74-8eb2f296793b Remove the asparagus from the grill. Sprinkle it with salt and lemon juice, if you like. Serve the grilled asparagus hot, warm, or at room temperature.
b3babdcd-cd3a-4758-9c74-8eb2f296793b Enjoy!
9e71d8c4-c699-402d-9d5b-65349e1995e5 Gather the ingredients.
9e71d8c4-c699-402d-9d5b-65349e1995e5 Heat the grill to medium-high
9e71d8c4-c699-402d-9d5b-65349e1995e5 When the grill is hot, slice eggplant about 1/2-inch thick.
9e71d8c4-c699-402d-9d5b-65349e1995e5 In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, balsamic vinegar, garlic, herbs, salt, and pepper. Brush both sides of the eggplant slices with the oil and vinegar mixture.
9e71d8c4-c699-402d-9d5b-65349e1995e5 Place eggplant on the hot preheated grill.
9e71d8c4-c699-402d-9d5b-65349e1995e5 Grill the eggplant for about 10 to 15 minutes, turning and basting occasionally.
235d0a36-ec75-43e9-8804-9a7817762c86 Preheat an oven to 400 F (Anywhere in the 350 to 425 F range will work, so if you already have something in the oven, there is no need to wait before popping the broccoli rabe in).
235d0a36-ec75-43e9-8804-9a7817762c86 Trim the broccoli rabe and spread it on a baking sheet or in a roasting pan. Drizzle the greens with the olive oil. Use your hands or two spoons to toss the broccoli rabe around, so it is all lightly coated with the oil. Spread the broccoli rabe back out into as much of a single layer as possible and sprinkle it with salt.
235d0a36-ec75-43e9-8804-9a7817762c86 Roast the broccoli rabe until it is reduced in size by about 2/3 and is brown on the edges, about 20 minutes. Depending on your oven (and what else may be in it), this may take longer. Feel free to use tongs to toss the leaves around a bit every 10 minutes or so. Serve roasted broccoli rabe hot or warm.
ab7d788d-5680-4ce8-8989-0f63d2a728f5 Brush the olive oil onto the cut sides of the acorn squash.
ab7d788d-5680-4ce8-8989-0f63d2a728f5 Cover the squash halves with foil, and poke holes to let steam and smoke through.
ab7d788d-5680-4ce8-8989-0f63d2a728f5 Prepare smoker. Place squash on smoker rack cut-side down. Smoke at 225 F for 1 1/2 to 2 hours.
ab7d788d-5680-4ce8-8989-0f63d2a728f5 When the squash is done, remove from the smoker and allow to sit while you make the spiced butter.
ab7d788d-5680-4ce8-8989-0f63d2a728f5 Melt the butter along with the sugar and spices in a saucepan. Stir to combine.
ab7d788d-5680-4ce8-8989-0f63d2a728f5 Remove the aluminum foil from the squash. Place a spoonful of the butter mixture on each squash half when ready to serve.
6dc29550-13c9-4602-9adb-5199c4ce11c6 Gather the ingredients.
6dc29550-13c9-4602-9adb-5199c4ce11c6 Bake potatoes until tender.
6dc29550-13c9-4602-9adb-5199c4ce11c6 Cut lengthwise in quarters.
6dc29550-13c9-4602-9adb-5199c4ce11c6 Scoop out to make shells about 1/2 inch thick.
6dc29550-13c9-4602-9adb-5199c4ce11c6 Paint with olive oil and coat both sides with dry ingredients.
6dc29550-13c9-4602-9adb-5199c4ce11c6 Place in prepared smoker at about 200 F/95 C and smoke for 20 to 40 minutes, depending on how smoky you want them.
6dc29550-13c9-4602-9adb-5199c4ce11c6 Sprinkle with cheese and let smoke until cheese melts.
6dc29550-13c9-4602-9adb-5199c4ce11c6 Top with chopped green onions and serve with barbecue sauce.
6dc29550-13c9-4602-9adb-5199c4ce11c6 Serve and enjoy!
61f9daae-9abd-4f6e-9823-4d4724c0ffe6 Preheat an oven to 375 F. Peel the carrots and trim off their ends, if you like; or simply trim their greens as pictured. Cut the carrots in long, even sticks or even, angled cross-section slices. If the carrots are relatively thin, as those pictured here, you can leave them whole—just be sure to check their thicker ends for tenderness at the end.
61f9daae-9abd-4f6e-9823-4d4724c0ffe6 Put the prepared carrots in a large baking dish. If you want to add a few garlic cloves to roast with the carrots, add them now—peel them or at least move most of their papery peel to make them easier to eat later. This is also the time to add a few sprigs of herbs if you like.
61f9daae-9abd-4f6e-9823-4d4724c0ffe6 Drizzle the carrots (and whatever you may have added with them) with the oil. Toss to coat the carrot pieces thoroughly. Sprinkle with salt and pop the dish in the preheated oven.
61f9daae-9abd-4f6e-9823-4d4724c0ffe6 Roast until the carrots are starting to brown on the bottom, about 20 minutes. Stir and continue roasting until the carrots are tender with lovely brown edges, about 20 more minutes.
cb5e9250-90f1-40c9-a10e-43e668ae7aa8 Combine orange juice, brown sugar, and butter in a saucepan. Simmer until it starts to thicken.
cb5e9250-90f1-40c9-a10e-43e668ae7aa8 Remove from heat and set aside.
cb5e9250-90f1-40c9-a10e-43e668ae7aa8 Meanwhile, preheat the grill and oil the cooking grates.
cb5e9250-90f1-40c9-a10e-43e668ae7aa8 Place carrots on grill over medium heat.
cb5e9250-90f1-40c9-a10e-43e668ae7aa8 Grill the carrots, turning occasionally for about 4 to 5 minutes depending on the size of the carrots.
cb5e9250-90f1-40c9-a10e-43e668ae7aa8 As carrots start to soften, brush with glaze.
cb5e9250-90f1-40c9-a10e-43e668ae7aa8 Continue cooking until glaze starts to darken on the carrots (about 3 to 4 more minutes).
cb5e9250-90f1-40c9-a10e-43e668ae7aa8 Remove, season lightly with salt and pepper and serve immediately.
2f33769d-3e91-4289-91b6-bd529934fbcf Cut poblano chiles in half lengthwise to create a boat for filling and scrape out seeds.
2f33769d-3e91-4289-91b6-bd529934fbcf Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a nonstick skillet. Add onion, garlic, jalapenos, red bell pepper, cilantro and cumin, and cook over medium heat until golden brown for about 4 minutes.
2f33769d-3e91-4289-91b6-bd529934fbcf Remove pan from heat and stir in the baked beans, hot sauce and 8 ounces of cheese. Add a bit of salt and pepper to taste. Spoon the mixture into the hollowed chiles and sprinkle with remaining cheese.
2f33769d-3e91-4289-91b6-bd529934fbcf Set up your grill for indirect grilling and preheat to medium. Arrange the chilies on the grill away from the direct heat. Cook until the chilies are tender and cheese is browned and bubbling about 30 to 40 minutes.
2f33769d-3e91-4289-91b6-bd529934fbcf Remove from grill and serve at once.
b8937a43-1750-490b-a0a9-faeaa355bddf Preheat grill.
b8937a43-1750-490b-a0a9-faeaa355bddf Cut unpeeled potatoes into 8 equal pieces.
b8937a43-1750-490b-a0a9-faeaa355bddf Place potatoes pieces in the center of a 12-14 inch piece of aluminum foil.
b8937a43-1750-490b-a0a9-faeaa355bddf Combine other ingredients, except cheese, in a small bowl and drizzle over potatoes. Toss lightly. Fold foil over and seal.
b8937a43-1750-490b-a0a9-faeaa355bddf Place on medium hot grill for 30-40 minutes.
b8937a43-1750-490b-a0a9-faeaa355bddf Potatoes should be easily pierced with a fork.
b8937a43-1750-490b-a0a9-faeaa355bddf Open packet and add cheese.
b8937a43-1750-490b-a0a9-faeaa355bddf Return to grill for 5 minutes or until cheese is melted.
b8937a43-1750-490b-a0a9-faeaa355bddf Serve hot.
b49b0f47-f6a8-4bf4-8105-a9629b6ebf0c Gather the ingredients.
b49b0f47-f6a8-4bf4-8105-a9629b6ebf0c Preheat the grill for medium heat.
b49b0f47-f6a8-4bf4-8105-a9629b6ebf0c Combine all ingredients in a large bowl and toss well to coat.
b49b0f47-f6a8-4bf4-8105-a9629b6ebf0c Tear off two very large pieces of foil to make a double-thick sheet.
b49b0f47-f6a8-4bf4-8105-a9629b6ebf0c Place potatoes in the center of the sheet, fold sides up to create a packet and to seal in juices.
