b49b0f47-f6a8-4bf4-8105-a9629b6ebf0c Place packet on grill and cook for 15 minutes.
b49b0f47-f6a8-4bf4-8105-a9629b6ebf0c Turn, and allow to cook for an additional 15-18 minutes.
b49b0f47-f6a8-4bf4-8105-a9629b6ebf0c To serve, cut packet with kitchen shears, allow to cool for a minute or two, then open foil enough to take out potatoes.
d7df3944-1ecf-4fb6-83fb-cd2bed9ab186 Gather the ingredients.
d7df3944-1ecf-4fb6-83fb-cd2bed9ab186 Heat a gas or charcoal grill to high heat (you should be able to hold our hand about an inch over the cooking grate for just 1 to 2 seconds before pulling it away from the heat).
d7df3944-1ecf-4fb6-83fb-cd2bed9ab186 While the grill heats, trim the cabbage, removing any damaged outer leaves and cutting off any browned or excess stem still attached to the head, but leaving the center core intact. Cut the cabbage into 8 wedges, being careful to keep a bit of the core in each cabbage wedge to hold the wedge of leaves together.
d7df3944-1ecf-4fb6-83fb-cd2bed9ab186 For ease of handling, and to make sure the leaves don't fall apart and into the flames once they're on the grill, skewer each cabbage wedge onto a grill-proof skewer. Brush the cabbage wedges lightly with olive oil and sprinkle them with salt.
d7df3944-1ecf-4fb6-83fb-cd2bed9ab186 Set the skewered cabbage wedges on the hot grill and cook until the edges are blackened and crispy and the center of the cabbage wedges are warm, turning to color all sides, 10 to 15 minutes. For more tender cabbage, cover the grill while they cook.
d7df3944-1ecf-4fb6-83fb-cd2bed9ab186 Serve the grilled cabbage hot, warm, or at room temperature.
d7df3944-1ecf-4fb6-83fb-cd2bed9ab186 Enjoy!
b3f2c39b-ad51-43fb-99ce-b95b0e65f1e8 Preheat grill for medium-high heat.
b3f2c39b-ad51-43fb-99ce-b95b0e65f1e8 Trim ends off tough ends from asparagus. Cut prosciutto slices into strips. Wrap half of one slice onto each asparagus spear.
b3f2c39b-ad51-43fb-99ce-b95b0e65f1e8 Combine minced garlic with olive oil and brush each spear with the mixture. The seasoned and wrapped spears with black pepper and place onto grill. Cook for 4 to 5 minutes, turning occasionally. Keep a close eye on these as the prosciutto is paper thin and prone to burning. Once cooked through, remove asparagus from heat and serve.
4db6063f-13d1-4b1d-b311-0d7fa56cff5f Gather the ingredients. Preheat an oven to 425 F (if you have something else going, know that these will roast up at any temperature down to 350 F; they'll just take longer and not get quite as nicely browned without getting a tad desiccated).
4db6063f-13d1-4b1d-b311-0d7fa56cff5f While the oven heats, trim the green beans.
4db6063f-13d1-4b1d-b311-0d7fa56cff5f Put the green beans in a large bowl, drizzle them with the olive oil, and toss to coat the beans thoroughly.
4db6063f-13d1-4b1d-b311-0d7fa56cff5f Lift the green beans out of the bowl (allowing any excess oil to stay in the bottom of the bowl, you want them coated but not dripping in oil) and spread them in a single layer on a baking sheet or in a shallow baking pan. The single layer part is important since it gives the beans the space they need to get properly roasted, instead of being piled together, which will lead them to partially steam more than roasted.
4db6063f-13d1-4b1d-b311-0d7fa56cff5f Roast the beans for about 10 minutes. While the beans roast, peel and mince the garlic if you're using it. Remove the pan from the oven, shake the beans about a bit, spreading them back into a single layer, and sprinkle with the garlic and lemon zest, if you like. Roast the beans until they're starting to brown on the tips, for another 2 or 3 minutes. If you want the beans more browned, feel free to leave them in the oven a bit longer.
4db6063f-13d1-4b1d-b311-0d7fa56cff5f Sprinkle with salt to taste, and serve hot or warm. They're still good closer to room temperature, which is good to know if you're looking for something to put on a buffet.
f90828a7-b8b1-4506-9011-0fa4103daceb Heat an oven to 400 F (anywhere between 350 F and 425 F will work, just adjust the timing up or down and pay attention to how the asparagus looks). While the oven heats, trim the asparagus. You can either break off the tough ends where they naturally snap by grabbing both ends of an asparagus spear and bending it until it breaks, or, for a more elegant presentation, you can trim off any dried part at the end of each spear and peel the spears.
f90828a7-b8b1-4506-9011-0fa4103daceb Lay the asparagus spears in a single layer in a baking dish or on a baking sheet. If you have an oven-proof serving dish, use that so you can bring the roasted asparagus directly to the table and serve it in the dish, but any oven-proof baking vessel works and a baking sheet is almost ideal since it let's the hot air circulate around the asparagus so effectively.
f90828a7-b8b1-4506-9011-0fa4103daceb Drizzle the asparagus with olive oil. Toss it around a bit so it's all more or less coated with the oil and spread it back into a single layer. Sprinkle it lightly with sea salt. Bake the asparagus until it's tender and starting to brown at the tips, about 15 minutes.
f90828a7-b8b1-4506-9011-0fa4103daceb Sprinkle the roasted asparagus with freshly grated lemon zest and/or squirt it with fresh lemon juice, if you like. If you have a Meyer lemon, its floral aroma pairs particularly well with fresh spring asparagus.
f90828a7-b8b1-4506-9011-0fa4103daceb Serve the roasted asparagus hot, warm, or at room temperature.
d2faf6b9-41a0-4f46-8501-5b3a62057731 Gather the ingredients.
d2faf6b9-41a0-4f46-8501-5b3a62057731 Preheat an oven to 375 F.
d2faf6b9-41a0-4f46-8501-5b3a62057731 While the oven heats, trim the green garlic: remove and discard the roots and dark green stalk. Exactly how much of the stalk to trim depends on how much chewing you're interested in doing. Peel off as much of the paper peel that has developed; this will depend greatly on exactly how "green" and immature the garlic is.
d2faf6b9-41a0-4f46-8501-5b3a62057731 Lay the trimmed green garlic in a baking pan or on a piece of aluminum foil large enough to fold over and cover the green garlic. Lightly drizzle the green garlic with the olive oil and sprinkle it with the salt.
d2faf6b9-41a0-4f46-8501-5b3a62057731 Cover the green garlic with foil and roast it for 30 minutes.
d2faf6b9-41a0-4f46-8501-5b3a62057731 Remove the foil covering the green garlic and continue roasting the green garlic until it's tender and nicely browned, about 15 minutes.
d2faf6b9-41a0-4f46-8501-5b3a62057731 Serve warm or at room temperature, and know that an additional drizzle of extra virgin olive oil doesn't hurt anything.
d2faf6b9-41a0-4f46-8501-5b3a62057731 Enjoy!
088e48c1-3e63-4f2b-873c-bd3ec980aeb3 Peel and core apples.
088e48c1-3e63-4f2b-873c-bd3ec980aeb3 Cut into thin strips of matchstick pieces.
088e48c1-3e63-4f2b-873c-bd3ec980aeb3 Place into a non-metallic bowl with 1 cup of water the juice of 2 lemons. This will help to keep the apples from turning brown.
088e48c1-3e63-4f2b-873c-bd3ec980aeb3 Let apples sit in the mixture for 15 minutes or so.
088e48c1-3e63-4f2b-873c-bd3ec980aeb3 In a large plastic or glass bowl, add mustard, lemon juice, salt, thyme, sugar, and caraway seeds. Stir a few times.
088e48c1-3e63-4f2b-873c-bd3ec980aeb3 Using a whisk, slowly whisk in oil to emulsify the dressing.
088e48c1-3e63-4f2b-873c-bd3ec980aeb3 Once the oil is well incorporated, stir in mayonnaise.
088e48c1-3e63-4f2b-873c-bd3ec980aeb3 Add the chopped cabbage and apple pieces and toss to coat.
088e48c1-3e63-4f2b-873c-bd3ec980aeb3 Cover bowl with plastic wrap and place into the refrigerator for at least 1 hour before serving. This slaw should be used the day it is prepared.
088e48c1-3e63-4f2b-873c-bd3ec980aeb3 Add to pulled pork or pulled chicken sandwiches or serve slaw as a side dish. Enjoy!
097333cb-1ab6-4af0-b1d0-1f577387957c Cut pumpkins in half, top to bottom. The insides can be scooped out if you desire, but it isn't necessary. It is easier to remove all this once the pumpkins are cooked. Prepare smoker of a two hour smoke at a temperature around 250 F. (120 C.). If using a charcoal grill, build the fire to one side for indirect grilling. Adjust vents to maintain a temperature around 250 F. (120 C.).
097333cb-1ab6-4af0-b1d0-1f577387957c Place pumpkin halves on the smoker or charcoal grill (away from the fire) and add wood chunks to the fire. This process will smoke the pumpkins as they cook and take 1 to 2 hours depending on the size of the pumpkins. Add additional smoking wood as needed.
097333cb-1ab6-4af0-b1d0-1f577387957c Once finished (the flesh of the pumpkin will be tender and they will start to collapse down), remove from smoker or grill and allow to cool. Pumpkins can be transferred to the oven to finish cooking if you want to limit the smokiness.
097333cb-1ab6-4af0-b1d0-1f577387957c Remove seeds and insides if you haven't already, peel away skin and coarse chop the remaining flesh. The pumpkin should have a strong smoky smell. Use as desired for soups, sauces, or pumpkin pie filling.
a0838760-f21a-48b5-9c5f-f4c629c6c76a Gather the ingredients.
a0838760-f21a-48b5-9c5f-f4c629c6c76a Wash beans and pour into a large saucepan or dutch oven.
a0838760-f21a-48b5-9c5f-f4c629c6c76a Add all other ingredients except the salt.
a0838760-f21a-48b5-9c5f-f4c629c6c76a Bring to a boil while stirring.
a0838760-f21a-48b5-9c5f-f4c629c6c76a Reduce heat and allow to simmer for two hours, covered.
a0838760-f21a-48b5-9c5f-f4c629c6c76a Stir occasionally, bringing up the beans from the bottom to prevent burning to so they will cook evenly.
a0838760-f21a-48b5-9c5f-f4c629c6c76a Add the salt after 1 hour.
a0838760-f21a-48b5-9c5f-f4c629c6c76a The beans are done when soft but still hold their shape.
a0838760-f21a-48b5-9c5f-f4c629c6c76a Serve and enjoy!
eb3c7a3d-8fd5-49fc-985e-1d9ce4aa13e1 Gather the ingredients.
eb3c7a3d-8fd5-49fc-985e-1d9ce4aa13e1 Preheat grill for medium heat.
eb3c7a3d-8fd5-49fc-985e-1d9ce4aa13e1 Place cut the pumpkin into a large bowl.
eb3c7a3d-8fd5-49fc-985e-1d9ce4aa13e1 Pour melted butter on top and add the remaining seasonings. Gently toss to coat.
eb3c7a3d-8fd5-49fc-985e-1d9ce4aa13e1 Scoop pumpkin out onto a very large piece of aluminum foil. The size is entirely dependent on how much pumpkin you have. Just make sure that the foil is large enough that once folded, there is ample room left for steam to rise (at least 2-3 inches). Consider using two pieces if necessary.
eb3c7a3d-8fd5-49fc-985e-1d9ce4aa13e1 Gather edges of the aluminum foil from opposing sides and roll downward, leaving enough room for steam.
eb3c7a3d-8fd5-49fc-985e-1d9ce4aa13e1 Secure open ends and place onto the grill and cook indirectly for 35 to 40.
eb3c7a3d-8fd5-49fc-985e-1d9ce4aa13e1 To check for doneness, use kitchen gloves and carefully unravel packet.
eb3c7a3d-8fd5-49fc-985e-1d9ce4aa13e1 Pierce a few slices with a knife. If it goes through with ease, the pumpkin is done.
eb3c7a3d-8fd5-49fc-985e-1d9ce4aa13e1 Rewrap the packet and remove from the grill.
eb3c7a3d-8fd5-49fc-985e-1d9ce4aa13e1 Allow pumpkin to sit for a 5 minutes before serving. If using in another recipe, let the pumpkin cool completely before using.
eb3c7a3d-8fd5-49fc-985e-1d9ce4aa13e1 If baking in the oven, place the packet on a cookie sheet and cook at 350 F, for 35-40 minutes.
18f42bdc-2301-4990-8e93-6315c36947b8 To prepare dressing, add apple jelly, red wine vinegar, water, and salt to a saucepan. Bring mixture to a boil, reduce heat and let simmer until mixture has reduced to a syrupy consistency. Remove from heat and cool to room temperature before using.
18f42bdc-2301-4990-8e93-6315c36947b8 Place sweet potato slices into a large stock pot with water and cook for 10-13 minutes. Potatoes should be soft, but not all the way cooked through. Remove from water, pay dry with paper towel and place onto baking sheet, cutting board, or platter. Brush with olive oil and add salt.
18f42bdc-2301-4990-8e93-6315c36947b8 Carefully place sweet potato and pear slices onto grill grate. Cook both for 3-4 minutes per side. Watch for burning. Once potatoes and pears have good grill marks and a caramelized surface, remove from heat and place onto clean baking sheet. This will allow them to cool slightly before assembling.
18f42bdc-2301-4990-8e93-6315c36947b8 To assemble: place salad greens onto large serving dish, top with sweet potatoes and pears, then crumbled feta cheese. Drizzle cooled dressing onto salad and garnish with chopped pecans.
0ca65f0b-3808-4eec-bc36-086c4a892147 Gather the ingredients.
0ca65f0b-3808-4eec-bc36-086c4a892147 Thread vegetables onto skewers, alternating between the items. Place in a shallow baking dish.
0ca65f0b-3808-4eec-bc36-086c4a892147 Combine lemon juice, vinegar, Italian seasoning, and salt. Pour over kebabs. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour to overnight.​
0ca65f0b-3808-4eec-bc36-086c4a892147 Preheat grill. Place skewers on grill over medium heat and grill for 10 minutes or until done, turning occasionally as needed.
0ca65f0b-3808-4eec-bc36-086c4a892147 Serve and enjoy!
36b47c94-29e8-4893-a219-0df9013e530b Gather the ingredients.
36b47c94-29e8-4893-a219-0df9013e530b Gently pull back the husks on each ear of corn. Remove the silk but not the husks.
36b47c94-29e8-4893-a219-0df9013e530b Place the ears in a large pan and fill with water to cover the corn. Let sit for a minimum of 1 hour.
36b47c94-29e8-4893-a219-0df9013e530b Combine olive oil with onion powder, brown sugar, paprika, chili powder, and salt.
36b47c94-29e8-4893-a219-0df9013e530b Remove from water and brush the corn with oil mixture.
36b47c94-29e8-4893-a219-0df9013e530b Pull the husks back over the corn.
36b47c94-29e8-4893-a219-0df9013e530b Prepare your smoker and smoke the ears of corn at 225 F/110 C for about 45 minutes to one hour.
36b47c94-29e8-4893-a219-0df9013e530b When they're done smoking, pull back the husks (you can leave them whole or cut them in half if you'd like) and top with green onions. Serve and enjoy.
05585c61-3657-4514-8654-aaf05838afeb Preheat an oven to 400 F. While the oven heats, trim the okra, removing the tough stem ends. Cut the okra pods in half lengthwise for faster, more even roasting. Cutting them before cooking in the dry heat of the oven also seems to further minimize the slime-factor for which these nutty pods are so famous.
05585c61-3657-4514-8654-aaf05838afeb Trim off and discard the root end and any dried part from the green ends of the green onions. Cut the green onions in half lengthwise, and then cut them (white and green parts) into 3-inch lengths.
05585c61-3657-4514-8654-aaf05838afeb Either in a roasting pan, on a rimmed baking sheet, or in a large bowl, combine the okra and the green onion. Drizzle the vegetables with the oil, and sprinkle with the salt. Toss to coat everything evenly and thoroughly. Spread the vegetables in a single layer in a roasting pan or rimmed baking sheet.
05585c61-3657-4514-8654-aaf05838afeb Roast the okra until it's tender and its edges are browning; this tends to happen somewhere in the neighborhood of 25 minutes. After 15 minutes, you may want to take the pan out and stir the vegetables around a bit, being sure to settle the okra back into a single layer before returning the pan to the oven to finish roasting. Serve the roasted okra hot or warm.
6ad811e7-28b8-4aac-9de3-073d1349da7a Heat oven to 450 F.
6ad811e7-28b8-4aac-9de3-073d1349da7a Scrub the new potatoes and then cut them in half or quarter them, depending on their size.
6ad811e7-28b8-4aac-9de3-073d1349da7a In a large bowl, toss the new potatoes with the oil, garlic, thyme, salt, and pepper.
6ad811e7-28b8-4aac-9de3-073d1349da7a Transfer potatoes to a baking pan and arrange in a single layer. Roast the new potatoes for 40 to 45 minutes, or until the potatoes are tender and browned.
da0602e0-aca7-4018-8608-90227f66efcc Cut tomatoes in half and remove the stems.
da0602e0-aca7-4018-8608-90227f66efcc Using 2 tablespoons of olive oil, lightly brush the cut ends of the tomatoes.
da0602e0-aca7-4018-8608-90227f66efcc Place tomatoes cut side down on a preheated grill over a medium heat. Grill for about 5 minutes or until the tomatoes start to brown and you can easily lift the skin off. Remove from grill.
da0602e0-aca7-4018-8608-90227f66efcc Carefully, remove skins from tomatoes, lightly blend in a blender or food processor and set aside.
da0602e0-aca7-4018-8608-90227f66efcc Meanwhile, heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large pot over a medium heat. Add onions. While stirring cook onions until they soften and turn translucent.
da0602e0-aca7-4018-8608-90227f66efcc Add remaining ingredients and stir together. Simmer on low for 10 to 15 minutes. Add water if the sauce becomes too thick.
7e78ab03-7339-4f66-9749-15ea5e923937 Gather the ingredients.
7e78ab03-7339-4f66-9749-15ea5e923937 Mix olive oil, vinegar, lemon juice, mustard, basil, parsley, garlic, salt, and black pepper together in a small bowl.
7e78ab03-7339-4f66-9749-15ea5e923937 Place cut vegetables in a resealable plastic bag. Pour marinade over vegetables, toss to coat, and seal bag. Place bag in the refrigerator and let sit for 1 to 3 hours.
7e78ab03-7339-4f66-9749-15ea5e923937 Preheat grill to medium heat. Place vegetables, alternating as you go, on skewers. Reserve marinade to brush vegetables as they cook.
7e78ab03-7339-4f66-9749-15ea5e923937 Place kebabs on grill and cover. Cook for 10 to 12 minutes, brushing with marinade every 2 to 3 minutes and rotating the skewers to cook the vegetables evenly.
7e78ab03-7339-4f66-9749-15ea5e923937 Remove kababs from grill when the vegetables are brown and tender.
6a7ff8cd-8cfc-4fc2-94be-32568bc3d541 Combine sugar, vinegar, oil, mustard, mayonnaise, salt and pepper in a saucepan over a low heat. Stir until sugar dissolves. Refrigerate dressing for 30 minutes.
6a7ff8cd-8cfc-4fc2-94be-32568bc3d541 Chop cabbage and sweet onion finely into thin pieces. Remove stem, core with seeds and any white parts of bell pepper. Slice into thin strips. If vegetables have accumulated a lot of liquid from washing and slicing, pat them dry with paper towels.
6a7ff8cd-8cfc-4fc2-94be-32568bc3d541 Place vegetables in a serving dish with cooled dressing. Using kitchen tongs, carefully, toss vegetables with dressing until well coated. Transfer to a serving bowl, cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1 1/2-2 hours before serving.
6a7ff8cd-8cfc-4fc2-94be-32568bc3d541 Coleslaw will keep for up to 2 days after preparation if stored, covered in the refrigerator. Serve dish on the side with brisket, pork, or chicken, or serve right on top of pulled pork in a delicious sandwich.
91a872fb-5f73-4e9e-82b2-dddab1150cee Trim off the top and outer skin of the onions. Cut a small bowl in the top of the onion and pour in 1 tablespoon of barbecue sauce. Wrap onions tightly in aluminum foil.
91a872fb-5f73-4e9e-82b2-dddab1150cee Place on grill and cook on an upper rack for about 45 minutes. These onions can also be cooked over a campfire.
91a872fb-5f73-4e9e-82b2-dddab1150cee Remove wrapped onions from the grill and set them aside to rest for 10 minutes. Carefully unwrap and serve.
2634719d-59f6-4c7b-90f8-b7a24b4cff93 Prepare smoker for a 1 1/2-hour cook time at around 275 F/135 C.
2634719d-59f6-4c7b-90f8-b7a24b4cff93 Cut the stem end of the butternut squash off, about an inch from the top. Brush with olive oil and sprinkle with salt. Place on the smoker and cook until soft all the way through.
2634719d-59f6-4c7b-90f8-b7a24b4cff93 A butternut squash, smoked for an hour and a half will have a strong smoke flavor. While this will cook down some when used in other recipes (like smoked butternut squash soup). To reduce the smoke flavor, cut the smoking time in half and finish the squash off in the oven.​
e1c706a5-af8a-4dad-a64e-3590d6a56f77 Gather the ingredients.
e1c706a5-af8a-4dad-a64e-3590d6a56f77 Preheat the oven to 425 Fahrenheit. Place the carrots in a roasting pan or baking dish just large enough to hold them in a single layer.
e1c706a5-af8a-4dad-a64e-3590d6a56f77 In a medium bowl or large liquid measuring cup, whisk together the water or broth, maple syrup, soy sauce, vinegar, olive oil, smoked paprika, and garlic powder. Pour the marinade over the carrots, cover the pan with foil, and roast in the preheated oven for 20 minutes.
e1c706a5-af8a-4dad-a64e-3590d6a56f77 While the carrots are roasting, place the tomatoes in a small baking dish, drizzle with 1 teaspoon of olive oil, and toss to coat. Place the sliced mushrooms in another small baking dish, add the remaining teaspoon of olive oil, and toss to coat.
e1c706a5-af8a-4dad-a64e-3590d6a56f77 After the carrots have roasted for 20 minutes, carefully remove the foil (watch out for escaping steam!). Turn the carrots and return the pan to the oven, along with the tomatoes and mushrooms. Roast, stirring the tomatoes and mushrooms once or twice, until the carrots are tender and glazed with the marinade, and the tomatoes and mushrooms are beginning to caramelize in spots, about 20 to 25 minutes more.
e1c706a5-af8a-4dad-a64e-3590d6a56f77 To assemble: Warm or toast the hot dog buns if desired. Place a carrot in each bun, and top with a spoonful of roasted mushrooms and roasted tomatoes. Add some crumbled goat cheese or feta and/or a sprinkling of za'atar, if desired. Serve immediately.
80301643-e010-4766-aa56-703bc387cbbf Preheat grill.
80301643-e010-4766-aa56-703bc387cbbf Clean sweet potatoes, cut off any bad spots. Cut into 1/2-inch slices.
80301643-e010-4766-aa56-703bc387cbbf Place on medium hot grill and cook for about 8 to 10 minutes on one side.
80301643-e010-4766-aa56-703bc387cbbf Soften butter and mix with honey.
80301643-e010-4766-aa56-703bc387cbbf Spread mixture over slices and turn.
80301643-e010-4766-aa56-703bc387cbbf Continue grilling for about 6 to 8 minutes.
80301643-e010-4766-aa56-703bc387cbbf Turn and spread on more honey butter.
80301643-e010-4766-aa56-703bc387cbbf Continue grilling until the honey butter gets all bubbly.
80301643-e010-4766-aa56-703bc387cbbf Make sure to keep an eye on the potatoes once the honey mixture is applied, given the sugar content of the honey.
80301643-e010-4766-aa56-703bc387cbbf Once cooked, remove from heat and top with chopped mint. However, this step is optional.
80301643-e010-4766-aa56-703bc387cbbf Serve and enjoy!
0be19b62-3516-4626-877d-f4409f86ed31 Gather the ingredients.
0be19b62-3516-4626-877d-f4409f86ed31 Heat a charcoal or gas grill to medium-high heat.
0be19b62-3516-4626-877d-f4409f86ed31 Cut the tomatoes in half crosswise (imagine the tomatoes are globes; cut them along the “equator”). Lay the tomato halves cut-side-up on a large baking sheet or tray. Brush the cut sides with olive oil and sprinkle them with salt.
0be19b62-3516-4626-877d-f4409f86ed31 Lay the tomatoes oiled-side-down on the grill. Close the lid if using a gas grill. Cook until grill marks appear on the tomatoes, about 5 minutes.
0be19b62-3516-4626-877d-f4409f86ed31 Brush the other sides with oil and sprinkle them with salt. Turn the tomato halves over, close the lid on a gas grill and cook until grill marks appear on the other side, about 5 more minutes.
0be19b62-3516-4626-877d-f4409f86ed31 Use tongs or a spatula to transfer the tomatoes back to the baking sheet or onto a servings platter.
0be19b62-3516-4626-877d-f4409f86ed31 Serve grilled tomatoes hot or at room temperature.
2990cb2f-13bb-4a77-9bc3-2e14c2711baa Gather the ingredients.
2990cb2f-13bb-4a77-9bc3-2e14c2711baa Preheat grill to medium heat.
2990cb2f-13bb-4a77-9bc3-2e14c2711baa Combine olive oil, garlic, balsamic vinegar, and thyme in small bowl.
2990cb2f-13bb-4a77-9bc3-2e14c2711baa Brush mixture onto both sides of each endive half. Sprinkle each piece with salt and pepper.
2990cb2f-13bb-4a77-9bc3-2e14c2711baa Place onto grill and cook for 6 minutes turning once.
2990cb2f-13bb-4a77-9bc3-2e14c2711baa When endives have wilted and are lightly browned, remove from heat and serve.
2990cb2f-13bb-4a77-9bc3-2e14c2711baa Serve as is or with chunky blue cheese dressing.
2990cb2f-13bb-4a77-9bc3-2e14c2711baa Enjoy!
c1f512e3-f641-4c17-8374-77c2d9eaa868 Gather the ingredients.
c1f512e3-f641-4c17-8374-77c2d9eaa868 Preheat grill for medium-high heat.
c1f512e3-f641-4c17-8374-77c2d9eaa868 Soak asparagus in cold water for 5 minutes to make sure to remove all sand or grit.
c1f512e3-f641-4c17-8374-77c2d9eaa868 Place sauce ingredients in blender, and blend until well combined. If making ahead, put into an airtight container, and store in the refrigerator.
c1f512e3-f641-4c17-8374-77c2d9eaa868 Remove asparagus from water, pat dry, brush lightly with oil, and place on grill grate. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes, rotating throughout cooking time.
c1f512e3-f641-4c17-8374-77c2d9eaa868 Remove from heat, drizzle with garlic-soy cream, and top with sesame seeds and chopped green onion
c1f512e3-f641-4c17-8374-77c2d9eaa868 Enjoy!
efdfcbf8-a179-47d6-8f1d-5f79bbc28ddb In a medium bowl, whisk together paprika, salt, garlic powder, onion powder, black pepper, dried parsley, cayenne pepper, cumin, coriander, hot chili powder, oregano, and if desired, the brown sugar until thoroughly mixed.
efdfcbf8-a179-47d6-8f1d-5f79bbc28ddb Pat the brisket dry on all sides using paper towels. With a spoon, sprinkle the rub liberally onto the meat. Simultaneously press it in and rub it with your fingertips until it adheres to the entire surface. Turn the meat and repeat on all sides.
efdfcbf8-a179-47d6-8f1d-5f79bbc28ddb Let the brisket sit for up to 24 hours (in the refrigerator) or cook immediately according to your recipe.
2f14f693-2e50-4959-8e3a-62f70d8b74cd Gather the ingredients.
2f14f693-2e50-4959-8e3a-62f70d8b74cd In a small bowl, combine the dark-brown sugar, paprika, salt, black pepper, white pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, and cayenne pepper until well mixed.
2f14f693-2e50-4959-8e3a-62f70d8b74cd To use, apply rub evenly over ribs. The general rule is what sticks is the perfect amount. Cook as directed in your recipe. Discard any rub that has come into contact with raw meat.
2f14f693-2e50-4959-8e3a-62f70d8b74cd Store any leftover rub that has not come into contact with raw meat by transferring it to a container with a lid. Store in a cool, dark place for up to 6 months.
0f41ff06-c517-4707-8e2f-7e7120fafac8 Gather the ingredients.
0f41ff06-c517-4707-8e2f-7e7120fafac8 In a medium bowl, mix together all of the ingredients until well combined.
0f41ff06-c517-4707-8e2f-7e7120fafac8 Store in an airtight container until ready to use.
e7adf9e0-ba8b-4496-b9c6-3c88a166da76 Gather the ingredients.
e7adf9e0-ba8b-4496-b9c6-3c88a166da76 Mix all ingredients together and store in a tightly covered container.
e7adf9e0-ba8b-4496-b9c6-3c88a166da76 Use with your choice of beef, chicken, pork, fish, seafood, or vegetables, and enjoy.
b3352dd6-b9df-42e5-84ea-e9ec8c9ba568 Gather the ingredients.
b3352dd6-b9df-42e5-84ea-e9ec8c9ba568 In a small bowl or container, mix all of the ingredients: brown sugar, paprika, salt, black pepper, cayenne, and dry mustard. Make sure there are no clumps fro the brown sugar and that it all has a fine consistency.
b3352dd6-b9df-42e5-84ea-e9ec8c9ba568 Seal the container until you are ready to use the rub.
b3352dd6-b9df-42e5-84ea-e9ec8c9ba568 Enjoy!
7c6adc33-c866-47d3-8a39-79d6f19809ca Gather the ingredients.
7c6adc33-c866-47d3-8a39-79d6f19809ca Combine all ingredients in a bowl.
7c6adc33-c866-47d3-8a39-79d6f19809ca Rub seasoning using 1 to 2 tablespoons per slab of ribs (the more you use, the spicier they will be).
7c6adc33-c866-47d3-8a39-79d6f19809ca Put on a grill in a single layer away from the direct heat source. Cook slowly for 1 1/2 to 2 hours on low heat.
7c6adc33-c866-47d3-8a39-79d6f19809ca After cooking wrap the ribs in foil and let them rest for 30 min. (This makes for very tender ribs.)
7c6adc33-c866-47d3-8a39-79d6f19809ca Enjoy!
4fd06993-3b35-41c5-ac87-fba7ccb8ad90 In a small bowl, combine paprika, salt, brown sugar, white sugar, ground cumin, chili powder, black pepper, and cayenne pepper; use as a dry rub on pork, chicken, beef, lamb, and vegetables. Make sure that rub has a fine consistency and that the brown sugar leaves no clumps.
4fd06993-3b35-41c5-ac87-fba7ccb8ad90 To apply the rub, gently pat onto all surfaces of meat and cook as directed.
4fd06993-3b35-41c5-ac87-fba7ccb8ad90 If making ahead of time, store in an airtight container in a cool place for up to six months after preparation.
92c9ab35-23d7-44bb-980c-5ad44563f1ea Combine coriander seeds, peppercorns and mustard seeds in a spice grinder. Grind coarsely.
92c9ab35-23d7-44bb-980c-5ad44563f1ea Add in remaining ingredients and mix well.
97e29e66-4df4-4896-9e8b-7cafd393b95c Mix all ingredients together.
97e29e66-4df4-4896-9e8b-7cafd393b95c Store in an airtight container and keep in a cool and dark place. Can be stored for up to 6 months after preparation.
97e29e66-4df4-4896-9e8b-7cafd393b95c Apply rub evenly over ribs. The general rule is what sticks is the perfect amount.
a120d7e3-6309-4ee8-babf-957ab77246b7 Gather the ingredients.
a120d7e3-6309-4ee8-babf-957ab77246b7 In a mixing bowl, combine all of the ingredients together.
a120d7e3-6309-4ee8-babf-957ab77246b7 Either use immediately or transfer to an airtight container. The rub can be stored up to six months in a cool, dark place.
8988d785-9f63-488e-8356-dfee17614d38 To prepare the basting sauce, combine all sauce ingredients in a saucepan (tomato sauce, barbecue sauce, cola, honey, brown sugar, apple cider vinegar, white pepper, and hot sauce.
8988d785-9f63-488e-8356-dfee17614d38 Let mixture come to a boil and then reduce and allow to simmer for 5 minutes. If the sauce is too thick, add 2 to 3 tablespoons water. Remove the sauce from the heat and set it aside.
8988d785-9f63-488e-8356-dfee17614d38 If you are using frozen ribs, they should be thawed. Remove the membrane from the underside of the ribs. Trim off any loose fat or meat.
8988d785-9f63-488e-8356-dfee17614d38 Place the ribs in a large pot with cold water. Bring the water to a boil. Parboil the ribs for 5 minutes and remove them onto a baking sheet. You might need to do the ribs in batches since they can be so large.
8988d785-9f63-488e-8356-dfee17614d38 Mix the brown sugar, salt, paprika, and white pepper in a small bowl. This is the rib rub.
8988d785-9f63-488e-8356-dfee17614d38 After ribs are parboiled, apply the rib rub to each side of the ribs. Don't worry if some of the rub falls off. The right amount is the amount that sticks.
8988d785-9f63-488e-8356-dfee17614d38 Preheat the grill. Place the beef ribs on the grill and cook over medium-low heat. Rewarm the basting sauce. Once the ribs have reached 165 F, begin basting. Turn and baste the ribs with the basting sauce every 10 minutes, until finished cooking, about 1 1/2 hours. Remove the ribs from the heat and serve immediately.
d19894af-20ef-4671-b508-731a46ed38ae Stir all ingredients together in a small bowl or cup.
d19894af-20ef-4671-b508-731a46ed38ae Sprinkle over the chicken, fish, ribs, or other meat you intend to barbecue. Press or rub the powder into the flesh.Tip: For extra moistness: Drizzle a tablespoon or two of vegetable oil over the meat first, slathering it evenly over surface. Then add the barbecue rub, pressing or rubbing it into the flesh or skin.
d19894af-20ef-4671-b508-731a46ed38ae Barbecue/grill the meat or fish until cooked.
d19894af-20ef-4671-b508-731a46ed38ae If desired, serve with this simple no-cook Thai sauce spooned over (or used as a dipping sauce). Just stir together:
29bd7995-0a43-4a3c-9696-51937e95b585 In a bowl, mix together all of the ingredients.
29bd7995-0a43-4a3c-9696-51937e95b585 Apply the rub evenly over the meat in an even coating.
29bd7995-0a43-4a3c-9696-51937e95b585 Store in the refrigerator in an airtight container for up to 10 days after initial preparation.
80877c9d-4c42-4ef7-8d97-4302bea1b69a Combine parsley, garlic, cayenne, lemon juice and zest in a food processor.
80877c9d-4c42-4ef7-8d97-4302bea1b69a Slowly add oil as you blend. Mix until smooth.
80877c9d-4c42-4ef7-8d97-4302bea1b69a Use immediately or store in an air-tight container in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.
cbed6819-0d00-4b25-b161-b3e8f34bf9f9 Gather the ingredients.
cbed6819-0d00-4b25-b161-b3e8f34bf9f9 Mix ingredients together in a small bowl.
cbed6819-0d00-4b25-b161-b3e8f34bf9f9 Firmly pack rub evenly onto brisket 30 to 40 minutes before smoking, then wrap in plastic wrap or place in a large plastic bag and let sit at room temperature.
bf90af75-ef69-40a0-92c8-2e7961c7c79d Gather the ingredients.
bf90af75-ef69-40a0-92c8-2e7961c7c79d Combine all ingredients in a large jar and shake to combine. This mop will settle, so shake it each time before using.
bf90af75-ef69-40a0-92c8-2e7961c7c79d Store this mop an airtight container and refrigerate for up to 3 months.
ff918ef1-b78e-48a0-85e4-7a2b7a615c3e Combine all ingredients in a spice mill or blender and grind until even and fine. Store in an airtight jar. Will store for about 6 months in a cool, dry place. Use this rub on any cut of beef or pork ribs.
ff918ef1-b78e-48a0-85e4-7a2b7a615c3e Apply rub evenly over ribs. The general rule is what sticks is the perfect amount.
d6fcc2b0-cf28-4910-a835-5093c2d5db77 Gather the ingredients.
d6fcc2b0-cf28-4910-a835-5093c2d5db77 Place coriander seeds, cumin seeds, fennel seeds, and cardamom pods in a pan over medium heat. Toast until seeds start to brown slightly - about 3 to 4 minutes.
d6fcc2b0-cf28-4910-a835-5093c2d5db77 Remove spices from heat and place into a spice grinder (or coffee grinder) and pulverize into a powder.
d6fcc2b0-cf28-4910-a835-5093c2d5db77 Place contents into a bowl and add remaining ingredients. Mix together and use.
d6fcc2b0-cf28-4910-a835-5093c2d5db77 Store rub in an airtight container in a cool, dry place for up to 6 months after initial preparation.
25236fdc-d894-4883-bce1-7c9938757e49 Gather the ingredients.
25236fdc-d894-4883-bce1-7c9938757e49 Combine all ingredients and mix together until it forms a paste.
25236fdc-d894-4883-bce1-7c9938757e49 Rub this mixture over the surface of the meat, making sure to get it evenly distributed.
0bdead18-d778-45f3-8599-5aa9f209f632 Gather the ingredients.
0bdead18-d778-45f3-8599-5aa9f209f632 Combine all ingredients in a small bowl.
0bdead18-d778-45f3-8599-5aa9f209f632 Apply wet rub all over prime rib roast and cook as directed.
d8cb4d31-beed-4de7-b4d4-b4efd9f6352b Mix ingredients together in bowl and apply rub to brisket 2 to 4 hours before cooking.
d8cb4d31-beed-4de7-b4d4-b4efd9f6352b Refrigerate meat for a minimum of 4 to 6 hours to enhance flavor. This rub can be stored for several months in an airtight container, in a dark, cool place.
96ad3434-a74f-471e-a206-bc24ba3dc758 In a medium skillet, toast cumin seeds for 2 to 3 minutes over medium heat. Make sure to move the pan around so that the seeds do not burn. Once the seeds have a deep brown (not charred) color and spice smells fragrant, remove from heat.
96ad3434-a74f-471e-a206-bc24ba3dc758 Place toasted cumin into a coffee or spice grinder and grind into a powder. Place into a bowl and add remaining ingredients. Form into a paste. This rub can be stored for 10 days in the refrigerator in an airtight container. Make this a day ahead before using on steaks to allow the flavors to bloom.
96ad3434-a74f-471e-a206-bc24ba3dc758 To use, simply apply 1 to 2 tablespoons of mixture (depending on the size of cut) to steaks. Grill as directed.
9856e1c8-14c1-4771-91ac-46a12c46a807 Mix ingredients together. Store in an airtight container for up to 6 months after preparation.
9856e1c8-14c1-4771-91ac-46a12c46a807 Spread evenly on prepared ribs that have been patted dry and let sit until the rub appears moist.
7b3fdb41-a36a-4644-83ca-755e60c833d7 Gather the ingredients.
7b3fdb41-a36a-4644-83ca-755e60c833d7 Mix the dry ingredients with Cajun seasoning and rub into ribs.
7b3fdb41-a36a-4644-83ca-755e60c833d7 Add the hot sauce and Worcestershire sauce to your liking.
7b3fdb41-a36a-4644-83ca-755e60c833d7 Let sit overnight.
7b3fdb41-a36a-4644-83ca-755e60c833d7 Smoke or grill and serve with your favorite BBQ sauce.
7b3fdb41-a36a-4644-83ca-755e60c833d7 Enjoy!
51729b65-19cc-4e5a-bdf3-e749909ebbc7 Gather the ingredients.
51729b65-19cc-4e5a-bdf3-e749909ebbc7 Preheat smoker and add wood chips of your choice. Clean and dry the brisket.
51729b65-19cc-4e5a-bdf3-e749909ebbc7 Place rub ingredients into a coffee grinder or spice mill.
51729b65-19cc-4e5a-bdf3-e749909ebbc7 Grind until mixture is fine and even.
51729b65-19cc-4e5a-bdf3-e749909ebbc7 Apply rub onto brisket.
51729b65-19cc-4e5a-bdf3-e749909ebbc7 Place brisket in the smoker for 8 to 10 hours. Keep the smoker temperature at about 220 F/105 C. To increase tenderness, take the brisket out of the smoker, wrap in aluminum foil and place in an oven at 180 to 200 F for the last two hours.
51729b65-19cc-4e5a-bdf3-e749909ebbc7 Typically after 8 to 10 hours a piece of meat will have absorbed as much smoke as it can and additional smoking may impart a bitter flavor.
51729b65-19cc-4e5a-bdf3-e749909ebbc7 Take brisket off of heat and allow to sit for 20 minutes before slicing. Serve with your favorite sides.
51729b65-19cc-4e5a-bdf3-e749909ebbc7 Enjoy!
394d8f0a-c872-4492-9f13-a1a634dc5252 Gather the ingredients.
394d8f0a-c872-4492-9f13-a1a634dc5252 In a small bowl, mix together all of the seasonings.
394d8f0a-c872-4492-9f13-a1a634dc5252 Store in an airtight container, in a cool, dark place for up to 6 months.
c0275dba-ae5c-442e-a510-ff64bb0e761c Gather the ingredients.
c0275dba-ae5c-442e-a510-ff64bb0e761c Mix all of the ingredients together.
c0275dba-ae5c-442e-a510-ff64bb0e761c If you are making the turkey rub ahead of time, store it in an airtight container.
d4c5a9a4-2a52-4502-b062-a45492ec3c30 Gather the ingredients.
d4c5a9a4-2a52-4502-b062-a45492ec3c30 Combine all ingredients and store in an airtight container for up to six months in a cool, dry place.
d4c5a9a4-2a52-4502-b062-a45492ec3c30 To use, pat the steak dry with a paper towel.
d4c5a9a4-2a52-4502-b062-a45492ec3c30 Apply the rub generously to the steak, massaging it in over the entire surface.
d4c5a9a4-2a52-4502-b062-a45492ec3c30 Allow the steak to sit at room temperature for at least 30 minutes before grilling or barbecuing. This will allow the moisture of the steak to keep the rub attached during cooking. If you simply dusted the steak with rub right before grilling, you will end up with a well-seasoned grill, not a well-seasoned steak.
d4c5a9a4-2a52-4502-b062-a45492ec3c30 Enjoy!
71c7b08b-fb07-49fc-99cd-21d0907c7239 Gather the ingredients.
71c7b08b-fb07-49fc-99cd-21d0907c7239 Mix all of the ingredients and store the rib seasoning in an airtight container in a cool dark place.
71c7b08b-fb07-49fc-99cd-21d0907c7239 Apply the rub to pork with a shaker right before it goes into the smoker, charcoal grill, gas grill, or oven. Apply the rub evenly over ribs. The general rule is what sticks is the perfect amount.
e913e762-2494-4a70-a34c-e41868790d97 Combine all ingredients and mix well. Work into the surface of the brisket, especially over the exposed meat. Cook as directed. This rub may be stored in an airtight container in a cool, dark place for several months.
e913e762-2494-4a70-a34c-e41868790d97 Double or triple the recipe if you intend to smoke a few briskets. Make sure that you portion out what you will be using and save the rest as instructed above. Discard any remaining rub that has come into contact with raw meat.
a0c863a9-e59f-4c7c-b301-c32ea03ee60e Gather the ingredients.
a0c863a9-e59f-4c7c-b301-c32ea03ee60e Trim excess fat from brisket.
a0c863a9-e59f-4c7c-b301-c32ea03ee60e Season with garlic powder, onion powder, black pepper, cayenne, and paprika.
a0c863a9-e59f-4c7c-b301-c32ea03ee60e Place on the rotisserie and put on a preheated grill. Prop the lid a little and let cook.
a0c863a9-e59f-4c7c-b301-c32ea03ee60e Meanwhile, prepare the sauce. Melt butter in a saucepan and sauté onion and garlic for about 5 minutes.
a0c863a9-e59f-4c7c-b301-c32ea03ee60e Add water, cider vinegar, brown sugar, Worcestershire sauce, chili powder, and a little salt and pepper to taste. Let simmer for 10 to 15 minutes. Add beer.
a0c863a9-e59f-4c7c-b301-c32ea03ee60e Baste over brisket about every 30 minutes. Cook brisket over low heat for about 4 to 5 hours.
a0c863a9-e59f-4c7c-b301-c32ea03ee60e Remove brisket from grill and slice thinly.
a0c863a9-e59f-4c7c-b301-c32ea03ee60e Serve with your favorite sides and enjoy!
6d5590a8-d492-40de-a1bc-c53d37b9bc3f Gather the ingredients.
6d5590a8-d492-40de-a1bc-c53d37b9bc3f In a medium mixing bowl, mix rub ingredients into a paste. Coat pork shoulder with rub, cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate 1 hours. Preheat smoker and prepare for an 8 hour smoke.
6d5590a8-d492-40de-a1bc-c53d37b9bc3f Make sure wood chips are soaked and drained before using. Add charcoal and wood chips as necessary to keep the temperature low, around 225 F/110 C. Smoke pork shoulder for about 8 hours or until internal temperatures reach 185 F/85 C.
6d5590a8-d492-40de-a1bc-c53d37b9bc3f Once the pork is cooked remove from the smoker. Wrap tightly in foil and allow to sit for an hour.
6d5590a8-d492-40de-a1bc-c53d37b9bc3f Afterward, unwrap pork butt and shred.
6d5590a8-d492-40de-a1bc-c53d37b9bc3f Combine pork with 1/3 of your favorite table sauce. Keep warm and serve on white bread buns with remaining sauce on the side.
6d5590a8-d492-40de-a1bc-c53d37b9bc3f Top with cole slaw and favorite finishing sauce.
6d5590a8-d492-40de-a1bc-c53d37b9bc3f Serve and enjoy!
2c8337ee-faf1-4a3f-a22f-9b56055d2dbd Gather the ingredients.
2c8337ee-faf1-4a3f-a22f-9b56055d2dbd Combine all ingredients in a small bowl. Store in an airtight container, for up to six months, or, use immediately by applying rub generously to prime rib and cooking as directed.
c5047dc5-912e-449e-8868-ce455c75bcb5 Gather the ingredients.
c5047dc5-912e-449e-8868-ce455c75bcb5 Combine everything in a medium bowl and taste. If opting for a spicier rub, add cayenne pepper a little bit at a time. Taste, and add more if needed. Use immediately.
c5047dc5-912e-449e-8868-ce455c75bcb5 If making ahead of time, store in an airtight container in a cool cupboard for up to 6 months. Do not store any rub that has come into contact with raw meat.
e2f61aac-1a97-4355-bb19-9485d27099c6 Gather the ingredients.
e2f61aac-1a97-4355-bb19-9485d27099c6 Mix all ingredients together in medium bowl.
e2f61aac-1a97-4355-bb19-9485d27099c6 Use immediately or store in an airtight container in a cool dry place (a cupboard will do), for up to 6 months after preparation.
e2f61aac-1a97-4355-bb19-9485d27099c6 Enjoy!
ea855561-b03a-4870-a616-2762ca25f492 Combine all ingredients and store in an airtight container in a cool, dry place.
ea855561-b03a-4870-a616-2762ca25f492 The mixture will stay fresh for up to 6 months if housed properly.
afbeaac5-f8c6-4f6c-a1e9-ede4d782a962 Combine the mixture in a small bowl and use right away. Store mixture in an airtight container in a cool, dry place for up to 6 months after preparation.
afbeaac5-f8c6-4f6c-a1e9-ede4d782a962 If you are interested in using this mixture in a wet rub, mix rub with the juice of two limes and 1/4 cup of oil.
6aff10c1-fec8-4566-b6c3-4793fd6071ab Gather the ingredients.
6aff10c1-fec8-4566-b6c3-4793fd6071ab Take the whole chicken wings and flip the tips around, tucking them in so they don't burn.
6aff10c1-fec8-4566-b6c3-4793fd6071ab Combine the spices in a large resealable plastic bag.
6aff10c1-fec8-4566-b6c3-4793fd6071ab Toss the chicken wings in the bag with the spices to coat. Let sit in the refrigerator for 15 to 20 minutes.
6aff10c1-fec8-4566-b6c3-4793fd6071ab Preheat the grill to medium-high heat and set up for indirect grilling.
6aff10c1-fec8-4566-b6c3-4793fd6071ab When hot, place the chicken wings over the direct heat for 5 minutes, turning frequently.
6aff10c1-fec8-4566-b6c3-4793fd6071ab Move the wings to the indirect (cooler) side and grill, turning once, and continue grilling until done (you want an internal temperature of 175 to 180 F). This should take about 20 to 25 minutes. Watch closely to prevent burning.
6aff10c1-fec8-4566-b6c3-4793fd6071ab Remove the wings from grill and serve immediately.
a1f39550-00ae-4500-9067-710a178f072c Place steak in resealable plastic bag. Combine marinade ingredients and pour over steak. Work marinade into ​the meat. Seal bag and place in refrigerator for 2 to 4 hours.
a1f39550-00ae-4500-9067-710a178f072c Preheat grill for medium-high heat. Remove steak from ​the dish, reserving marinade. Place meat on the grill and allow to cook for 15 to 17 minutes.
a1f39550-00ae-4500-9067-710a178f072c When ​the meat reaches desired doneness, remove from heat and allow to sit for five minutes before slicing. Serve immediately.
53c34b88-be01-410e-8bb8-3d228b32c523 Gather the ingredients.
53c34b88-be01-410e-8bb8-3d228b32c523 Place chilies, cloves, peppercorns, mustard and coriander seeds in a spice grinder. Grind until spices are a fine powder. Pour into a bowl and add remaining spices.
53c34b88-be01-410e-8bb8-3d228b32c523 Place pork chops onto a baking sheet. Take rub and apply all over the front and back of the meat. Let stand at room temperature for up to 20 minutes. If you are making ahead of time, coat with spices, cover with plastic wrap and place into the refrigerator. Let stand for 20 to 30 minutes at room temperature before placing onto​ the grill.
53c34b88-be01-410e-8bb8-3d228b32c523 To prepare for charcoal grilling, remove the cooking grate and light the charcoal in a charcoal chimney (look for a red, ashen color to the briquettes). You will need enough charcoal to cover half the coal grate, about two layers thick. Place cooking grate over hot coals and open vent. Oil grate and place chops onto grill directly over the coals. Grill for two minutes per side. Move to the indirect cooking space (where there are no coals) and continue cooking for 4 to 6 minutes per side or until the internal temperature is between 160 and 165 F.
53c34b88-be01-410e-8bb8-3d228b32c523 Remove from grill and cover with foil. Allow chops to rest for 5 minutes. If using a gas unit, set temperature for medium-high heat and cook 8 to 9 minutes per side or until internal temperature is right. After the meat has had a chance to rest, serve immediately with your favorite side dishes.
53c34b88-be01-410e-8bb8-3d228b32c523 Enjoy!
af4e09e3-3920-4d3e-9d37-dfd5fe544d7d Mix all ingredients together and store in an airtight container in a cool, dry place.
af4e09e3-3920-4d3e-9d37-dfd5fe544d7d To use, rub mixture over chicken, cover, and place into refrigerator for 1 hour before grilling or baking.
af4e09e3-3920-4d3e-9d37-dfd5fe544d7d The mixture can be added to plain yogurt and lemon or lime juice to form a delicious marinade. In this case, place chicken in a resealable plastic bag, add marinade made out of rub ingredients and place into refrigerator for 2 to 6 hours.
47854ac6-ca1c-4306-9c42-32bb15340a31 Preheat smoker and add wood chips (follow your instruction manual).
47854ac6-ca1c-4306-9c42-32bb15340a31 Clean and dry the brisket.
47854ac6-ca1c-4306-9c42-32bb15340a31 Combine rub ingredients and apply them onto brisket.
47854ac6-ca1c-4306-9c42-32bb15340a31 Place brisket in the smoker for 8 to 10 hours.
47854ac6-ca1c-4306-9c42-32bb15340a31 Keep the smoker temperature at about 220 F/105 C. To increase tenderness, take the brisket out of the smoker, wrap in aluminum foil and place in the oven at 180 to 200 F/80 to 90 C for the last two hours.
47854ac6-ca1c-4306-9c42-32bb15340a31 Typically after 8 to 10 hours a piece of meat will have absorbed as much smoke as it can and additional smoking may impart a bitter flavor.
47854ac6-ca1c-4306-9c42-32bb15340a31 Take brisket off of heat and allow to sit for 20 minutes before slicing.
47854ac6-ca1c-4306-9c42-32bb15340a31 Serve and enjoy!
4771f54e-682d-4b6a-8442-9849d59ab4d6 Mix all ingredients together. Grind this paste together to force the seasonings into the garlic.
4771f54e-682d-4b6a-8442-9849d59ab4d6 Rub into the meat before cooking.
4771f54e-682d-4b6a-8442-9849d59ab4d6 This rub can be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to two weeks.
d4f6d810-1b18-416c-9a83-d49b563764e5 Gather the ingredients.
d4f6d810-1b18-416c-9a83-d49b563764e5 In a spice grinder, grind the bay leaves into a fine powder. Place in a small bowl. Also grind the thyme, oregano, peppercorns.
d4f6d810-1b18-416c-9a83-d49b563764e5 Add all ingredients to bowl and mix together. Divide into three equal parts.
d4f6d810-1b18-416c-9a83-d49b563764e5 Rub one part on the inside of the turkey; rub the second part under the skin around the breasts; and rub the last portion over the outside of the turkey.
d4f6d810-1b18-416c-9a83-d49b563764e5 Refrigerate overnight.
d4f6d810-1b18-416c-9a83-d49b563764e5 Cook your turkey and enjoy!
12a7599a-702b-423e-83df-6ddd55bbc1c5 Mix all ingredients together.
12a7599a-702b-423e-83df-6ddd55bbc1c5 Store in an airtight container in a cool, dark place. This rub will last up to six months if stored properly.
12a7599a-702b-423e-83df-6ddd55bbc1c5 To use, simply coat meat thoroughly with a liberal amount of rub mixture.
12a7599a-702b-423e-83df-6ddd55bbc1c5 Grill or bake as directed.
4a631627-076f-4fdc-93d9-0ad98042454c Gather the ingredients.
4a631627-076f-4fdc-93d9-0ad98042454c Season the pork on the outside as you wish. Combine the apple juice or cider, apple cider vinegar, water, Worcestershire sauce, maple syrup, melted butter, and pork rub in a small mixing bowl.
4a631627-076f-4fdc-93d9-0ad98042454c Using a meat injection syringe, inject the mixture into several different spots in the pork roast.
4a631627-076f-4fdc-93d9-0ad98042454c Grill or smoke right away or store in the fridge until ready to use (up to a few hours).
e3bf147c-7a81-4562-a1d0-dc9d8f558d10 Gather the ingredients.
e3bf147c-7a81-4562-a1d0-dc9d8f558d10 In a large resealable food storage bag (plastic), combine the oil, vinegar, sugar, ketchup, onion, Worcestershire sauce, salt, garlic, and Tabasco. Add the chicken and turn to coat thoroughly. Seal the bag and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight, turning occasionally.
e3bf147c-7a81-4562-a1d0-dc9d8f558d10 Pour marinade into a saucepan and bring to a full rolling boil over high heat. Remove from the heat and set aside.
e3bf147c-7a81-4562-a1d0-dc9d8f558d10 Heat the grill to moderate or medium-high heat, about 350 F to 375 F.
e3bf147c-7a81-4562-a1d0-dc9d8f558d10 First, sear the chicken over direct heat for about 2 to 3 minutes per side.
e3bf147c-7a81-4562-a1d0-dc9d8f558d10 Continue grilling the chicken leg quarters over indirect heat -- not directly over coals or gas burners -- turning frequently and basting with the reserved boiled marinade, for about 35 to 55 minutes, depending on size.
e3bf147c-7a81-4562-a1d0-dc9d8f558d10 The chicken should be fork tender and juices will run clear. The temperature should register at least 165 F on an instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the meat but not touching bone.
e3bf147c-7a81-4562-a1d0-dc9d8f558d10 Serve and enjoy!
da83234d-0b0a-40a1-be6a-3e096fd4e796 Gather the ingredients.
da83234d-0b0a-40a1-be6a-3e096fd4e796 Melt the butter over low heat in a small saucepan. Add the chicken broth, lemon juice, garlic powder, black pepper, and white pepper. Mix well. Add salt until mixture has a good but not overpowering flavor.
da83234d-0b0a-40a1-be6a-3e096fd4e796 Remove the mixture from heat and allow to cool until just warm for 8 minutes.
da83234d-0b0a-40a1-be6a-3e096fd4e796 Load it into a meat injector and slowly inject it into various spots in the bird. The breast meat really benefits from this mixture. It's good to inject dozens of sites with about 2 teaspoons per site, or less if you see the fluid oozing from the site.
da83234d-0b0a-40a1-be6a-3e096fd4e796 Massage around all of the injection sites to distribute the mixture throughout the bird.
da83234d-0b0a-40a1-be6a-3e096fd4e796 The leftover mixture can be used as a baste while the chicken or turkey is on the grill or in the oven. Otherwise, discard the leftover sauce.
da83234d-0b0a-40a1-be6a-3e096fd4e796 Cover the bird and let rest in the fridge for several hours (overnight if possible) before cooking.
da83234d-0b0a-40a1-be6a-3e096fd4e796 Cook your poultry by roasting, smoking, or deep-frying.
ddef514a-9887-4aa2-a9b6-2478a0786ee4 Gather the ingredients.
ddef514a-9887-4aa2-a9b6-2478a0786ee4 Combine all ingredients in a medium saucepan. Let boil for 1 minute, reduce heat, and simmer for additional 8 to 10 minutes.
ddef514a-9887-4aa2-a9b6-2478a0786ee4 Remove from heat and let cool completely before using. (If making ahead of time, marinade may be stored in the refrigerator for no more than one week.)
ddef514a-9887-4aa2-a9b6-2478a0786ee4 Marinate chicken in mixture for 4 to 12 hours.
ddef514a-9887-4aa2-a9b6-2478a0786ee4 For the sauce option, follow the above instructions only simmer the sauce over medium-low heat for 15 minutes.
ddef514a-9887-4aa2-a9b6-2478a0786ee4 Thicken the mixture with water and cornstarch. Turn up the heat to medium-high and bring to a heavy simmer.
ddef514a-9887-4aa2-a9b6-2478a0786ee4 Add cornstarch to the sauce and using a whisk, stir together for 20 to 30 seconds until the cornstarch thickens. (The sauce should be slightly thickened and able to coat the back of a spoon.)
ddef514a-9887-4aa2-a9b6-2478a0786ee4 Remove from heat and use on cooked chicken, turkey, or other types of poultry.
ddef514a-9887-4aa2-a9b6-2478a0786ee4 Enjoy!
501f8655-5e4a-43f4-b09e-faecbf573716 Gather the ingredients.
501f8655-5e4a-43f4-b09e-faecbf573716 Mix together the lemon juice, vinegar, olive oil, honey, garlic, salt, pepper, and cayenne (if using) in a small mixing bowl.
501f8655-5e4a-43f4-b09e-faecbf573716 Place the ribs in a container large enough to lay the racks flat. Pour the marinade over the ribs, coating them completely. Make sure to turn the rack of ribs a couple of times so it is coated with the marinade on all sides. Cover the container with plastic wrap and let it sit in the refrigerator for 12 to 24 hours.
501f8655-5e4a-43f4-b09e-faecbf573716 Prepare a smoker or grill. Remove the ribs from the marinade and cook according to the smoker instructions or your favorite rib recipe.
5606f669-bdf1-4d96-867b-fc26b761909f Gather the ingredients.
5606f669-bdf1-4d96-867b-fc26b761909f Place red-wine vinegar and Worcestershire sauce in a bowl and whisk together.
5606f669-bdf1-4d96-867b-fc26b761909f Slowly drizzle in olive oil or avocado oil, whisking constantly, until well combined.
5606f669-bdf1-4d96-867b-fc26b761909f Add sea salt, oregano, pepper, thyme, onion powder, and minced garlic, and stir until well combined. Let the mixture stand at room temperature for 5 minutes or so before using.
5606f669-bdf1-4d96-867b-fc26b761909f Place steak in a resealable plastic bag and pour the marinade over the top, massaging it into the meat and making sure all surfaces are coated well.
5606f669-bdf1-4d96-867b-fc26b761909f Seal the bag, put it on a rimmed pan to catch any escaping juices or in a shallow bowl and place in the refrigerator for about 2 1/2 hours. Marinating time for beef depends on the cut and thickness. Consult this marinating beef chart to get the right time for your steak.
5606f669-bdf1-4d96-867b-fc26b761909f Once the meat is marinated, it's time to grill according to your preferred method.
5606f669-bdf1-4d96-867b-fc26b761909f This marinade can be made ahead of time and stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to five days.
3a89d818-4218-4d53-9347-bfed556a39ba Gather the ingredients.
3a89d818-4218-4d53-9347-bfed556a39ba Add balsamic vinegar to a small bowl, slowly whisk in olive oil. Add salt and sugar and continue whisking until dissolved. Add garlic, oregano, basil, onion powder, black pepper, and red pepper flakes (if using for some heat). Stir to combine. Let mixture stand at room temperature for at least 5 to 10 minutes before using.
3a89d818-4218-4d53-9347-bfed556a39ba Pour into a zip-top bag and add the chicken breasts. Marinate for 30 minutes to 2 hours. This is enough marinade for 4 to 6 chicken breasts.
3a89d818-4218-4d53-9347-bfed556a39ba If making ahead of time, store marinade in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 5 days after initial preparation.
43343454-7ec6-41c6-b868-53b9f7375721 Gather the ingredients.
43343454-7ec6-41c6-b868-53b9f7375721 Juice 2 lemons into a small bowl.
43343454-7ec6-41c6-b868-53b9f7375721 Slowly drizzle olive oil into the lemon juice while whisking. This will help to emulsify the mixture.
43343454-7ec6-41c6-b868-53b9f7375721 Add the remaining ingredients and stir.
43343454-7ec6-41c6-b868-53b9f7375721 Allow the mixture to stand at room temperature for 10 minutes before using.
000466af-b66a-4c3b-9c92-c1f5a2f217cb Gather the ingredients.
000466af-b66a-4c3b-9c92-c1f5a2f217cb Combine all ingredients in a medium bowl. Stir gently until sugar is completely dissolved.
000466af-b66a-4c3b-9c92-c1f5a2f217cb Use immediately or store in a refrigerator, covered for 6 to 7 days after preparation.
5c6def87-2b91-4c77-bc5c-a2e9302221bf Combine the olive oil, rice wine vinegar, red wine, garlic, lemon or lime juice, sugar, salt, and pepper.
5c6def87-2b91-4c77-bc5c-a2e9302221bf Heat one side of the barbecue grill and place a chunk of soaked mesquite wood directly on hot coals (or lava rocks when using a gas grill). Adjust the heat to keep the wood from flaming. You want ​to smoke it and not fire.
5c6def87-2b91-4c77-bc5c-a2e9302221bf Place the marinade in an open pot on the opposite side of the grill and close the lid of the grill. Let it smoke for 20 to 25 minutes. The smoke will flavor the marinade.
5c6def87-2b91-4c77-bc5c-a2e9302221bf Remove the pot and add additional red wine to replace the liquid lost by evaporation.
5c6def87-2b91-4c77-bc5c-a2e9302221bf Cool it to room temperature, then refrigerate if not using immediately. Be sure to keep it in a tightly closed container to keep the delicious smoke in the marinade and not flavoring everything else in your refrigerator.
0effa0d8-3940-4734-b684-65427e020ee0 Gather the ingredients.
0effa0d8-3940-4734-b684-65427e020ee0 2 hours prior to grilling, prepare fish by rinsing with cold water. Pat dry with paper towel. Cut into 1-inch cubes. Set aside.
0effa0d8-3940-4734-b684-65427e020ee0 Mix olive oil, lemon juice, dill, and vinegar to make the marinade. Pour marinade into a large freezer bag and add fish. Make sure fish is well coated with marinade. Place freezer bag in the refrigerator for two hours.
0effa0d8-3940-4734-b684-65427e020ee0 While fish is marinating, chop vegetables. Half the cucumber lengthwise and slice into 1/2 inch pieces. Cut the onions into eights. Cut red pepper into 1/3 chunks. Set aside.
0effa0d8-3940-4734-b684-65427e020ee0 Remove fish from marinade. Discard marinade.
0effa0d8-3940-4734-b684-65427e020ee0 Assemble kebabs according to taste. Many people like a combination of alternating pieces of meat and vegetables. This combination is entirely a matter of personal choice. It does not affect the cooking.
0effa0d8-3940-4734-b684-65427e020ee0 If you are using steel skewers, be sure to put a light coat of oil on them before adding the fish and vegetables. They will slide on and off much easier.
0effa0d8-3940-4734-b684-65427e020ee0 Spray the grill lightly with cooking oil and place the fish kebabs on the grill. Cook for about 4-6 minutes each side or until the fish flakes easily with a fork.
0effa0d8-3940-4734-b684-65427e020ee0 Serve over white rice.
df416a65-0dc5-4309-a22e-8dc82eac0cce Mix together mustard and vinegar. Add minced garlic, dried sage, bay leaves, salt, and black pepper. Using a whisk, combine mixture while slowly adding oil. This will create an emulsion, blending the oil into the remaining ingredients. Let mixture stand for 5 to 10 minutes so flavors can combine.
df416a65-0dc5-4309-a22e-8dc82eac0cce Use right away or store in the refrigerator in an airtight container for up to 5 days after preparation.
df416a65-0dc5-4309-a22e-8dc82eac0cce Marinate pork for up to 12 hours, chicken for 4 to 8 hours, vegetables and vegetable substitutes for 30 to 60 minutes. Cook as directed.
32d73946-c032-461b-9a43-405251b7bd43 Combine all ingredients and mix well. Let mixture stand for 5 minutes before using.
32d73946-c032-461b-9a43-405251b7bd43 Marinade meats as follows: red meat and pork, 4 to 12 hours, chicken and other poultry, 2 to 6 hours, fish, seafood, vegetables, and meat alternatives, 15 to 30 minutes.
32d73946-c032-461b-9a43-405251b7bd43 If making ahead of time, store in an airtight container in the fridge for no more than one week after preparation.
06d13a03-cd0f-4989-9981-348395cd508c Trim excess fat from the meat and place in ​slow cooker crockery insert. Add onion, green pepper and 1 cup water, along with the beef bouillon.
06d13a03-cd0f-4989-9981-348395cd508c Cover and cook on LOW for 8 to 10 hours, until meat is well done and shreds easily with a fork.
06d13a03-cd0f-4989-9981-348395cd508c Pour liquids into a saucepan and boil until reduced to about 1/2 cup.
06d13a03-cd0f-4989-9981-348395cd508c Add the reduced liquid back to the slow cooker along with the remaining ingredients; stir to mix. Cover and cook on LOW for about 1 hour, stirring occasionally. Meat should be pretty well shredded by the end of the cooking time.
06d13a03-cd0f-4989-9981-348395cd508c Spoon over toasted bun halves to serve.
bb6753ad-ff05-45e7-8d2f-f7157b431562 Combine all ingredients in a large bowl, stirring constantly until salt is dissolved.
bb6753ad-ff05-45e7-8d2f-f7157b431562 This is enough brine for about 6 pounds of meat. Brine pork and beef for 1 hour per pound and poultry for 30 minutes per pound.
a3e88bca-4851-4ec8-95e2-518ba2398d27 Gather the ingredients.
a3e88bca-4851-4ec8-95e2-518ba2398d27 Make sure that your Italian seasoning is finely ground. If you need to, run it through a spice grinder or a mortar and pestle.
a3e88bca-4851-4ec8-95e2-518ba2398d27 Combine all ingredients and mix well. This marinade will settle so you need to give it a stir every time you reload the needle.
a3e88bca-4851-4ec8-95e2-518ba2398d27 Inject the marinade into the turkey, butter the inside, and/or season the outside if you like. Discard remaining marinade.
a3e88bca-4851-4ec8-95e2-518ba2398d27 Cook turkey, serve, and enjoy!
0fa6f0b8-c917-4227-8503-277f5b4420db Gather the ingredients.
0fa6f0b8-c917-4227-8503-277f5b4420db Combine the oil, vinegar, soy sauce, Worcestershire, ketchup, mustard, garlic, pepper, oregano, and crushed red pepper flakes in a large measuring cup or bowl.
0fa6f0b8-c917-4227-8503-277f5b4420db Put the steak in a large food storage bag or nonreactive container and pour the marinade over it. Seal the bag and turn it several times to coat the meat; refrigerate the steak for 4 to 8 hours. Turn the steak frequently during its time in the refrigerator so the marinade covers both sides.
f8dc5d52-b1e3-4780-8e62-112aecbd7e35 Gather the ingredients.
f8dc5d52-b1e3-4780-8e62-112aecbd7e35 Combine all ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth. Depending on size of the blender, this process might need to be done in batches.
f8dc5d52-b1e3-4780-8e62-112aecbd7e35 Use marinade right away or, if making ahead, simply store in an airtight container and keep in the refrigerator for up to 7 days. We recommend making this the day before using to let the flavors marry well; however, it is not required.
b8b4cd51-f948-4d98-9f16-181f9692e5a0 In a small mixing bowl, whisk together all the ingredients, except the pork loin. Place the pork into a plastic freezer bag and pour in the marinade. Press out air, seal the bag and marinate the pork for 3 hours.
b8b4cd51-f948-4d98-9f16-181f9692e5a0 Preheat oven to 350 F. Place the pork in a baking dish, season with additional salt and fresh ground black pepper to taste, and pour in the marinade. Add 1/2 cup of water, and place in the preheated oven. Roast for about 1 hour, basting occasionally with the marinade until the internal temperature reaches 145 to 150 F. Remove and let the pork loin rest for 10 minutes before serving. Slice and serve with some of the marinade drizzled over the top.
c9bff64a-7233-4188-9b9e-b1d0a610f235 Gather the ingredients.
c9bff64a-7233-4188-9b9e-b1d0a610f235 Combine all ingredients and mix until the sugar is completely dissolved.
c9bff64a-7233-4188-9b9e-b1d0a610f235 Marinate brisket overnight. Discard marinade when done.
c9bff64a-7233-4188-9b9e-b1d0a610f235 Grill or smoke as directed.
c9bff64a-7233-4188-9b9e-b1d0a610f235 Enjoy!
6acc3a1f-6f40-4ce7-830b-b0d72102a806 Combine all ingredients in a medium non-metal bowl.
6acc3a1f-6f40-4ce7-830b-b0d72102a806 Toss to combine and let stand for 15 minutes.
6acc3a1f-6f40-4ce7-830b-b0d72102a806 Add steaks to a zip top bag.
6acc3a1f-6f40-4ce7-830b-b0d72102a806 Pour marinade over steaks, seal bag and let marinate meat for 3 to 4 hours (but no more), in the refrigerator.
6acc3a1f-6f40-4ce7-830b-b0d72102a806 If you are working with a larger piece of meat, double the recipe and marinate for 6 to 8 hours.
ca29c205-ef3b-406b-9f1b-8167e2c65925 Gather the ingredients.
ca29c205-ef3b-406b-9f1b-8167e2c65925 Combine everything in a bowl and whisk together until smooth.
ca29c205-ef3b-406b-9f1b-8167e2c65925 The best method for marinating a turkey is to use a large food-safe plastic bag. Coat the turkey with the marinade using a brush or by hand. Work the marinade over the entire surface, inside and out.
ca29c205-ef3b-406b-9f1b-8167e2c65925 Place the turkey in the plastic bag and close. Refrigerate for 10 to 20 hours.
ca29c205-ef3b-406b-9f1b-8167e2c65925 After marinating, remove ​the turkey from bag allowing excess marinade to drain. Discard excess.
ca29c205-ef3b-406b-9f1b-8167e2c65925 Cook your turkey, serve, and enjoy!
8591e9b9-0839-458b-bd7e-d4d23ea07ec1 Gather the ingredients.
8591e9b9-0839-458b-bd7e-d4d23ea07ec1 Combine all the ingredients in a double boiler, mix and simmer on medium to medium-low heat for 10 minutes or until it begins to thicken.
8591e9b9-0839-458b-bd7e-d4d23ea07ec1 Once the sauce has thickened, remove from heat and allow the mixture to cool for 5 to 10 minutes before using on all types of pork and poultry.
8591e9b9-0839-458b-bd7e-d4d23ea07ec1 Use toward the last 5 to 15 minutes of cook time, depending on size and cut of meat. Watch for burning. The sauce can also be served on the side.
8591e9b9-0839-458b-bd7e-d4d23ea07ec1 Enjoy!
9082f17e-91a0-416f-bd1e-a73211eefcbf Gather the ingredients.
9082f17e-91a0-416f-bd1e-a73211eefcbf In a medium saucepan, bring 2 cups of water to a boil.
9082f17e-91a0-416f-bd1e-a73211eefcbf Add the salt and sugar, and stir until dissolved.
9082f17e-91a0-416f-bd1e-a73211eefcbf Add the remaining 6 cups of cold water and stir in the whole peppercorns and allspice berries. Let the mixture cool completely before using it.
9082f17e-91a0-416f-bd1e-a73211eefcbf Place the pork tenderloin in a large bowl, stock pot, or plastic container.
9082f17e-91a0-416f-bd1e-a73211eefcbf Pour the cooled brine mixture over the pork. Cover it with a lid or plastic wrap, and store in the refrigerator. Brine the pork for 8 to 12 hours.
9082f17e-91a0-416f-bd1e-a73211eefcbf When ready to cook, remove the meat from the brine. Quickly rinse it under cool water, and pat dry with paper towels. Do not over-rinse as this will remove all the salt and will leave the meat quite bland.
9082f17e-91a0-416f-bd1e-a73211eefcbf Coat the tenderloin with the salt-free seasoning rub of your choice, and cook as directed per the grilling or oven roasting instructions of your preferred recipe.
ba148978-2ab7-4163-99ff-ad5949525460 Combine all ingredients in a glass or plastic bowl, and mix thoroughly.
ba148978-2ab7-4163-99ff-ad5949525460 Marinate beef for 4 to 8 hours, pork and poultry for 2 to 4 hours, and seafood for no more than 20 minutes in a zip-top bag in the refrigerator. If you make the marinade a day in advance and let it sit in the refrigerator, the flavors will have more time to combine.
2051aca8-5316-44fd-a053-e031a0e97e4d Combine all marinade ingredients in a medium bowl. Place the tri-tip roast in a large resealable plastic bag. Pour marinade over meat, seal bag and allow to marinate for 4 to 6 hours in the refrigerator.
2051aca8-5316-44fd-a053-e031a0e97e4d Preheat grill on medium heat and prepare for indirect cooking. Remove roast from the pan making sure to reserve marinade. Place roast onto a lightly oiled grill grate and allow to cook until internal temperature reaches 150 to 165 F or about 25 to 35 minutes.
2051aca8-5316-44fd-a053-e031a0e97e4d While the tri-tip is cooking, it is time to prepare the sauce. Using side burner and a medium saucepan, bring reserved marinade to boil. Combine 1 tablespoon of cornstarch with 3 tablespoons of water. Add mixture to marinade. Stir until the sauce has thickened. Reduce heat to low and allow to simmer for an additional 3 to 5 minutes.
2051aca8-5316-44fd-a053-e031a0e97e4d Once tri-tip has reached the desired doneness, remove from grill and tent with aluminum foil, and allow meat to rest for 10 minutes. Carve roast, top with sauce, and serve with you favorite sides.
2051aca8-5316-44fd-a053-e031a0e97e4d Enjoy!
4e8fa501-e46c-40f8-be93-f0c6ebd2e143 Combine all ingredients in a small bowl until brown sugar has dissolved.
4e8fa501-e46c-40f8-be93-f0c6ebd2e143 Store marinade in an airtight container in refrigerator until ready to use. Mixture will last for 5-7 days if stored properly. Recipe yields about 3/4 cup or enough for about 4 pork chops. Increase recipe to suit your needs and quantity of pork chops.
4e8fa501-e46c-40f8-be93-f0c6ebd2e143 To marinate: place pork chops into a resealable plastic bag (2 bags if you are preparing more than 4 chops). Pour marinade over top, making sure all surfaces of meat are well coated. Seal bag and place into refrigerator for 4 to 12 hours. Cook as directed.
4e8fa501-e46c-40f8-be93-f0c6ebd2e143 This mixture can also be used as a sauce or baste. Simmer over medium heat in a saucepan for 7 to 8 minutes, stirring often. If you'd like it thicker, increase heat to medium-high, mix together 1 to 2 teaspoons cornstarch with 2 tablespoons warm water until dissolved. Add to mixture and stir in for 1 to 2 minutes until desired thickness is achieved.
d6661cee-7b58-4967-9779-6da582c9719b Gather the ingredients.
d6661cee-7b58-4967-9779-6da582c9719b Place the beef roast and onions in a large resealable bag.
d6661cee-7b58-4967-9779-6da582c9719b In a small bowl, combine the wine, oil, garlic, salt, pepper, rosemary, celery seeds, thyme leaves, and sage to make a marinade.
d6661cee-7b58-4967-9779-6da582c9719b Pour the marinade mixture over the top of the beef roast and seal the bag. Refrigerate the roast for several hours or up to one day.
d6661cee-7b58-4967-9779-6da582c9719b Preheat the grill to high heat. Remove the roast from the bag, retaining the marinade.
d6661cee-7b58-4967-9779-6da582c9719b Place the roast on the rotisserie spit, making sure to get it as balanced as you can. Secure it tightly and place it on grill over high heat.
d6661cee-7b58-4967-9779-6da582c9719b After 15 minutes, reduce the heat or move the coals away from the roast and continue cooking it.
d6661cee-7b58-4967-9779-6da582c9719b Meanwhile, pour 2 cups of the marinade into a saucepan. Bring it to a boil, reduce the heat to medium, and simmer for 3 to 4 minutes, stirring often. Remove it from the heat and add the butter.
d6661cee-7b58-4967-9779-6da582c9719b Baste the roast with the basting mixture every 30 minutes during the cooking time. Continue cooking until done, about 1 hour 30 minutes. Use a meat thermometer to ensure your roast is done to your liking—130 to 135 F is medium-rare, and recommended for a beef roast.
d6661cee-7b58-4967-9779-6da582c9719b Remove the roast to a platter and allow the roast to rest for 10 minutes.
d6661cee-7b58-4967-9779-6da582c9719b Slice thin against the grain and serve.
9c27b890-efc9-425a-a51b-97e492b78f86 Combine all ingredients and mix until sugar is completely dissolved.
9c27b890-efc9-425a-a51b-97e492b78f86 Use this marinade for two to eight hours depending on the thickness of the meat.
35faa4a8-b176-41ad-849c-941b7d336823 Gather the ingredients.
35faa4a8-b176-41ad-849c-941b7d336823 In a medium bowl, combine all ingredients, including the rub. Stir gently until most of the rub ingredients has incorporated into the liquid mixture. Let mixture stand for 10 minutes before using.
35faa4a8-b176-41ad-849c-941b7d336823 Use for marinading ribs.
0fca1e06-70b4-4b1d-9e7c-325856041c54 Cut lemons in half and squeeze out the juice into a medium plastic or glass bowl. Add remaining ingredients and mix well.
0fca1e06-70b4-4b1d-9e7c-325856041c54 Marinate chicken or pork for 1 to 2 hours in the mixture. The mixture can be made ahead of time and stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for 1 week and in the freezer for up to 3 months.
bef9ef23-ba9b-40e4-a33c-1b06984f4f80 Gather the ingredients.
bef9ef23-ba9b-40e4-a33c-1b06984f4f80 Pat the pork chops dry with paper towels.
bef9ef23-ba9b-40e4-a33c-1b06984f4f80 Put the chops in a large, zip-close food storage bag or nonreactive container with a lid.
bef9ef23-ba9b-40e4-a33c-1b06984f4f80 In a bowl, combine the soy sauce, Worcestershire sauce, vegetable oil, apple cider vinegar, mustard, brown sugar, garlic, salt, and pepper.
bef9ef23-ba9b-40e4-a33c-1b06984f4f80 Pour the marinade mixture over the pork chops.
bef9ef23-ba9b-40e4-a33c-1b06984f4f80 Seal the bag or put a lid on the container and turn to thoroughly coat the pork chops. Refrigerate for 3 to 6 hours, turning the bag or container occasionally.
bef9ef23-ba9b-40e4-a33c-1b06984f4f80 Grill the pork chops over direct high heat for 5 to 7 minutes on each side, or until the chops register at least 145 F — the minimum safe temperature for pork — on an instant-read thermometer. If the pork chops are very thick, allow more time.
bef9ef23-ba9b-40e4-a33c-1b06984f4f80 Serve with your choice of sides and enjoy!
1a43e4eb-3af6-4fe5-97ad-5d336de17df7 Finely chop garlic, shallot, and onion and place in a small bowl.
1a43e4eb-3af6-4fe5-97ad-5d336de17df7 Add chopped fresh parsley and tarragon, Worcestershire sauce, Dijon mustard, Guinness beer, soy sauce, and seasonings then mix well to combine.
1a43e4eb-3af6-4fe5-97ad-5d336de17df7 Let stand at room temperature for 30 minutes so flavors can blend together.
1a43e4eb-3af6-4fe5-97ad-5d336de17df7 Marinate beef, lamb, and pork for 4 to 24 hours. Chicken and poultry for 2 to 8 hours, and vegetables and meat substitutes for 1 hour.
1a43e4eb-3af6-4fe5-97ad-5d336de17df7 Once you have finished marinating, place the unused marinade in a small saucepan and reduce it for one or two minutes until slightly thickened.
1a43e4eb-3af6-4fe5-97ad-5d336de17df7 Add more beer to the marinade at this stage if desired.
1a43e4eb-3af6-4fe5-97ad-5d336de17df7 This can be served as a sauce or cooled completely and stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for future use. The mixture will stay good for up 5 days.
a4a081d7-28bf-4ba7-b861-789c0b1fd0c5 Gather the ingredients.
a4a081d7-28bf-4ba7-b861-789c0b1fd0c5 Mix all ingredients together in a small bowl.
a4a081d7-28bf-4ba7-b861-789c0b1fd0c5 Pour over brisket and let marinate overnight in the refrigerator, turning occasionally.
a4a081d7-28bf-4ba7-b861-789c0b1fd0c5 Remove brisket from marinade and boil remaining marinade for 5 minutes to use as a mop.
3951b0c1-381f-4a06-a49b-18ea2ff16049 Gather the ingredients.
3951b0c1-381f-4a06-a49b-18ea2ff16049 In a small saucepan, add soy sauce, sesame oil, and honey. Bring to a good simmer, reduce heat to a low simmer and add sherry, ginger, black pepper, and pepper flakes. After one minute, remove from heat and allow the marinade to cool 20 minutes before adding chopped scallions and roasted sesame seeds.
3951b0c1-381f-4a06-a49b-18ea2ff16049 To use, place ribs in a resealable plastic bag and pour cooled marinade over top. Seal bag and place into the refrigerator for 4 to 24 hours.
3951b0c1-381f-4a06-a49b-18ea2ff16049 Enjoy!
f370fda8-026d-49ae-a223-f43b02ca2b59 Gather the ingredients.
f370fda8-026d-49ae-a223-f43b02ca2b59 Trim beef tri-tip of excess fat. Combine other ingredients, except sesame seeds and mix well.
f370fda8-026d-49ae-a223-f43b02ca2b59 Place beef tri-tip in a resealable plastic bag and coat well with marinade. Refrigerate for several hours (6 to 12 hours).
f370fda8-026d-49ae-a223-f43b02ca2b59 Preheat grill.
f370fda8-026d-49ae-a223-f43b02ca2b59 Remove beef tri-tip from marinade and discard any remaining marinade in bag.
f370fda8-026d-49ae-a223-f43b02ca2b59 Grill beef tri-tip over medium heat, turning occasionally for about 25 to 30 minutes depending on the thickness of the cut and your preferred doneness.
f370fda8-026d-49ae-a223-f43b02ca2b59 Once done, remove from grill and let rest for 5 to 10 minutes.
f370fda8-026d-49ae-a223-f43b02ca2b59 Carve across the grain, sprinkle with sesame seeds, and serve.
0776175a-efd1-45ef-b50e-bce46ff71965 Combine all ingredients in a saucepan and bring to a boil.
0776175a-efd1-45ef-b50e-bce46ff71965 Remove from heat and allow to cool completely.
0776175a-efd1-45ef-b50e-bce46ff71965 Place with pork in a large container making sure that brine completely covers the pork. Cover and refrigerator for 6 hours for smaller items like chops, and up to 24 hours for larger cuts.
c51c6ef6-c2de-45b7-b9ff-44ffcbd5d574 Place brisket into a large, deep container. Combine remaining ingredients in a large mixing bowl and pour over meat. Make sure all surfaces of the brisket are well coated. Cover dish with plastic wrap and allow to marinate in the refrigerator for 2 to 4 hours. Remove brisket, but reserve marinade for later, by storing in the refrigerator.
c51c6ef6-c2de-45b7-b9ff-44ffcbd5d574 Prepare smoker. You will want it to smoke for about 5 to 7 hours at 220 to 230 F/105-110 C. Place brisket on the smoker and cook until the internal temperature reaches 185 F/85 C. Remove brisket from smoker and wrap tightly in aluminum foil. Let sit for thirty minutes.​
c51c6ef6-c2de-45b7-b9ff-44ffcbd5d574 Place reserved marinade in a saucepan and bring to a high simmer for 1 to 2 minutes. Reduce heat and simmer on medium-low to low for another 8 to 10 minutes or until sauce begins to thicken. Remove from heat and serve sangria sauce over sliced brisket.
d85a9317-004d-425b-a97e-3aed0ec75a15 Gather the ingredients.
d85a9317-004d-425b-a97e-3aed0ec75a15 Combine all ingredients and mix until the sugar is completely dissolved. Use right away.
d85a9317-004d-425b-a97e-3aed0ec75a15 Marinate meats for 4 to 12 hours.
d85a9317-004d-425b-a97e-3aed0ec75a15 Enjoy!
1d8c459d-a51f-4d9e-8f27-7526ea412db9 Gather the ingredients.
1d8c459d-a51f-4d9e-8f27-7526ea412db9 Combine all ingredients in a medium bowl and add meat or vegetables.
1d8c459d-a51f-4d9e-8f27-7526ea412db9 For vegetables and shrimp, marinate for 1 hour, for chicken up to 3 hours, and for beef up to 8 hours.
f9abbef1-27c6-48f0-a923-d821237d87dd Place skirt steak in resealable plastic bag. Combine marinade ingredients in a bowl. Pour over skirt steaks, making sure to evenly distribute marinade all over the meat. Seal bag and place into refrigerator for 2 to 5 hours.
f9abbef1-27c6-48f0-a923-d821237d87dd If using a charcoal grill, you want a two layer fire, with the coals nice and hot. Place marinated steaks onto grill grate and cook for 3 to 5 minutes per side, with the lid off. Make sure to watch it closely as these steaks cook quickly.
f9abbef1-27c6-48f0-a923-d821237d87dd Once cooked through remove from fire and allow to rest for 5 minutes. Slice against the grain into thin strips, serve onto warmed tortillas, and top with corn salsa, sliced green onion, guacamole, and chopped cilantro.
f9abbef1-27c6-48f0-a923-d821237d87dd Enjoy!
b60058a6-481c-4348-92c3-1b3e74914cff Combine all marinade ingredients in a small bowl.
b60058a6-481c-4348-92c3-1b3e74914cff Remove giblets and wing tips from chicken.
