b60058a6-481c-4348-92c3-1b3e74914cff Wash out the chicken cavity and pat dry.
b60058a6-481c-4348-92c3-1b3e74914cff Place chicken in a deep dish, coat with yogurt mixture, cover and allow the chicken to marinate in the refrigerator for 2 to 3 hours.
b60058a6-481c-4348-92c3-1b3e74914cff Preheat grill.
b60058a6-481c-4348-92c3-1b3e74914cff Remove chicken from dish and discard marinade.
b60058a6-481c-4348-92c3-1b3e74914cff Place chicken on rotisserie spit and cook over indirect medium-high heat for 2 hours, or until the internal temperature reaches between 165 and 170 F (75 C.)
b60058a6-481c-4348-92c3-1b3e74914cff If heat is too high, reduce and cook over medium heat instead.
b60058a6-481c-4348-92c3-1b3e74914cff Once cooked, remove from heat and loosely tent with aluminum foil.
b60058a6-481c-4348-92c3-1b3e74914cff Let chicken rest for 10 minutes before carving.
969c9b48-b4f2-475c-bfd8-71f27eaad0ed Cut 1-inch diamonds about 1/8 inch deep in both sides of the flank steak.
969c9b48-b4f2-475c-bfd8-71f27eaad0ed Combine crushed garlic, olive oil, red wine vinegar salt, and black pepper in a small non-metallic bowl.
969c9b48-b4f2-475c-bfd8-71f27eaad0ed Place steak in a resealable plastic bag.
969c9b48-b4f2-475c-bfd8-71f27eaad0ed Pour marinade over steak, making sure all surfaces are covered.
969c9b48-b4f2-475c-bfd8-71f27eaad0ed Seal bag, letting out any excess air and place into the refrigerator for 6 to 12 hours.
c137f6fd-6ca8-4600-b1d3-7dbac580db13 Place pork cubes in a shallow glass baking dish.
c137f6fd-6ca8-4600-b1d3-7dbac580db13 Combine other ingredients and mix well.
c137f6fd-6ca8-4600-b1d3-7dbac580db13 Pour over pork, cover and let marinate in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours.
c137f6fd-6ca8-4600-b1d3-7dbac580db13 Drain and reserve marinade. Arrange pork cubes onto skewers, leaving about 1/4 inch space in between each cube.
c137f6fd-6ca8-4600-b1d3-7dbac580db13 Brush marinade over meat and place on a hot grill.
c137f6fd-6ca8-4600-b1d3-7dbac580db13 Cook for about 5 minutes over a medium fire then turn.
c137f6fd-6ca8-4600-b1d3-7dbac580db13 Baste with more marinade and continue cooking for another 5 minutes.
c137f6fd-6ca8-4600-b1d3-7dbac580db13 Discard remaining marinade.
c137f6fd-6ca8-4600-b1d3-7dbac580db13 Continue cooking and turning until done, or once the meat reaches an internal temperature of 165 F.
c137f6fd-6ca8-4600-b1d3-7dbac580db13 Once cooked, remove from heat and serve with side sauces of choice.
fa2c1ff3-5ca6-4ab1-a0d0-2f8d7602526e Gather the ingredients.
fa2c1ff3-5ca6-4ab1-a0d0-2f8d7602526e In a large nonreactive baking dish or container, whisk together the soy sauce, garlic, dry mustard, and the coarsely ground black pepper.
fa2c1ff3-5ca6-4ab1-a0d0-2f8d7602526e Do not rinse the steaks, but pat them dry with a paper towel. Add them to the marinade and turn them to coat thoroughly. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 2 to 5 hours.
fa2c1ff3-5ca6-4ab1-a0d0-2f8d7602526e When ready to cook, oil the grill and prepare it for high direct heat, or about 450 F. If broiling, turn the oven to BROIL.
fa2c1ff3-5ca6-4ab1-a0d0-2f8d7602526e When the grill or broiler has come up to temperature, remove the steaks from the marinade, discard the marinade, and place the steaks on your chosen cooking surface.
fa2c1ff3-5ca6-4ab1-a0d0-2f8d7602526e Grill the steaks until the desired temperature and doneness has been reached, using tongs to turn the steaks only once. To obtain grill marks, halfway through cooking the first side, turn it perpendicular on the grates to create the crosshatch pattern. After turning the steak over (remember: only once), repeat halfway through on the second side.
fa2c1ff3-5ca6-4ab1-a0d0-2f8d7602526e Remove from the grill and serve with your favorite side dishes like a baked potato or French fries and a leafy green salad.
fa2c1ff3-5ca6-4ab1-a0d0-2f8d7602526e Enjoy!
263d6b75-84c9-409e-8705-ec48f76397fc Gather the ingredients.
263d6b75-84c9-409e-8705-ec48f76397fc Combine all ingredients in a small bowl plastic or glass bowl.
263d6b75-84c9-409e-8705-ec48f76397fc Let stand for 5 minutes. Substitute peanut oil with vegetable oil. (If there isn't an allergy concern, but a taste preference, use 3 tablespoons/45 milliliters vegetable oil and 1 tablespoon/15 milliliter sesame oil combined.)
263d6b75-84c9-409e-8705-ec48f76397fc Marinade pork chops or tenderloin in a zip-top bag for at least 4 to 6 hours in the refrigerator. You can also freeze bags of pork chops, marinade and all. They will last up to three months in the freezer if you release all of the air out of the plastic bag before sealing.
263d6b75-84c9-409e-8705-ec48f76397fc Cook as directed.
263d6b75-84c9-409e-8705-ec48f76397fc Enjoy!
5f6e7b61-2fb2-401f-a76a-eeaa6d9b3866 Combine all ingredients except the chicken and pour into a shallow baking dish or resealable plastic bag. Add chicken and turn to coat.
5f6e7b61-2fb2-401f-a76a-eeaa6d9b3866 Cover and place in refrigerator to marinate in jerk seasoning for 30 minutes to 1 hour. Preheat grill. Remove chicken from jerk marinade and pour marinade into a saucepan.
5f6e7b61-2fb2-401f-a76a-eeaa6d9b3866 Bring to a boil. Place chicken on grill cooking approximately 7 to 10 minutes per side (or until done), basting periodically with remaining cooked jerk marinade.
744cd4ab-3d04-44dd-84c1-f1d4f4174377 Gather the ingredients.
744cd4ab-3d04-44dd-84c1-f1d4f4174377 Heat up a medium saucepan on medium-low. Add all of the ingredients, but just 1/4 teaspoon of cayenne powder. Allow the mixture to simmer for 5 to 8 minutes.
744cd4ab-3d04-44dd-84c1-f1d4f4174377 Taste for flavor and add the remaining 1/4 teaspoon of cayenne if you'd like a spicier sauce.
744cd4ab-3d04-44dd-84c1-f1d4f4174377 Remove from heat and allow to cool completely before using.
744cd4ab-3d04-44dd-84c1-f1d4f4174377 Store covered in the refrigerator for up to a week.
744cd4ab-3d04-44dd-84c1-f1d4f4174377 Enjoy.
08f53c9d-d4d0-4e53-9459-59d1545f66e2 Combine all of the ingredients in a medium saucepan over low heat. Stir occasionally and let simmer for 20 minutes. The sauce should be thin, but not watery.
08f53c9d-d4d0-4e53-9459-59d1545f66e2 Remove the sauce from the heat and let it cool, about 20 to 30 minutes.
08f53c9d-d4d0-4e53-9459-59d1545f66e2 You can use the sauce immediately after cooling, but it is better if you allow it to sit for a day (refrigerated). Place it in an airtight container in the refrigerator (a squeeze bottle is a handy storage container). The barbecue sauce can be stored refrigerated for up to one week after preparation or three to four months in the freezer.
8941435b-1443-4e39-8fb2-4c9b41d1d9d1 Gather the ingredients.
8941435b-1443-4e39-8fb2-4c9b41d1d9d1 Stir watermelon juice, balsamic vinegar, brown sugar, soy sauce, oil, Dijon mustard, garlic, and pepper flakes together.
8941435b-1443-4e39-8fb2-4c9b41d1d9d1 Pour enough sauce over your vegetables, chicken, pork, fish or shellfish to marinate reserving some for basting or dipping later. Cover and refrigerate several hours or overnight.
767a0e55-b98c-49c7-a961-99ed26259f9a Gather the ingredients.
767a0e55-b98c-49c7-a961-99ed26259f9a In a medium bowl, whisk together mayonnaise, cider vinegar, and lemon juice until creamy and smooth. If you do not want the sauce quite as tart, use half the amount of apple cider vinegar.
767a0e55-b98c-49c7-a961-99ed26259f9a Stir in black pepper, salt, cayenne pepper, and optional garlic, mustard, sugar, and horseradish. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before using.
767a0e55-b98c-49c7-a961-99ed26259f9a Brush lightly over chicken, turkey, or pork during the last few minutes of grilling. Since this sauce also is great as a dipping sauce to serve at the table, set some aside before you start grilling the meat.
767a0e55-b98c-49c7-a961-99ed26259f9a The unused sauce can be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for 3 to 4 days.
6a419ac2-598e-4d63-993e-441f8478f696 Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and sauté for 2 to 3 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add garlic and cook for 15 to 20 seconds or until it becomes fragrant. (Do not let the garlic burn or it will cause the sauce to become bitter.)
6a419ac2-598e-4d63-993e-441f8478f696 Add remaining ingredients (vinegar last), reduce heat and simmer over low for 12 to 15 minutes. Stir every so often.
6a419ac2-598e-4d63-993e-441f8478f696 Remove sauce from heat and let cool for 20 minutes.
6a419ac2-598e-4d63-993e-441f8478f696 Use right away or store in an airtight container or jar in the refrigerator for up to one week after preparation.
5bb402d0-1e31-4405-a855-b4db83ed2cdb Gather the ingredients.
5bb402d0-1e31-4405-a855-b4db83ed2cdb Blend the minced onion and water into a puree.
5bb402d0-1e31-4405-a855-b4db83ed2cdb Heat a medium-sized saucepan over medium heat. Add the olive oil. When the oil is warm, pour in the onion puree. Simmer for 2 to 3 minutes.
5bb402d0-1e31-4405-a855-b4db83ed2cdb Add the rest of the ingredients, and cayenne if using. Mix thoroughly and simmer on low for 12 to 15 minutes.
5bb402d0-1e31-4405-a855-b4db83ed2cdb Once cooked, allow the sauce to cool to room temperature before using, about 30 minutes.
5bb402d0-1e31-4405-a855-b4db83ed2cdb If you are making the sauce ahead of time, place it in an airtight container and store in the refrigerator for up to one week.
5bb402d0-1e31-4405-a855-b4db83ed2cdb Enjoy.
ae4f9ef3-bb2e-44a3-8a16-49b9962d83c7 Melt the butter in a saucepan. Add the lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, honey, salt, and pepper. Bring the sauce to a simmer over medium heat for 5 minutes, or until honey has melted through and the sauce is well combined.
ae4f9ef3-bb2e-44a3-8a16-49b9962d83c7 Remove the sauce from the heat and carefully add in the vinegar a little at a time. Let the sauce cool for 5 to 10 minutes before using.
ae4f9ef3-bb2e-44a3-8a16-49b9962d83c7 If you making the sauce ahead of time (rather than using immediately), let the sauce cool for 20 minutes and then place into an airtight container. Store it in the refrigerator for up to 4 to 5 days. When ready to use it, warm it on stove top or microwave.
4967755e-9034-4e7a-ba8c-5c5f33611aa6 Heat the oil in a medium saucepan. Add garlic and cook over medium-high heat for 20 seconds. Take care not to burn the garlic.
4967755e-9034-4e7a-ba8c-5c5f33611aa6 Add the remaining ingredients—ketchup, water, cider vinegar, brown sugar, paprika, chili powder, and cayenne, and reduce the heat to medium. Simmer on low for 13 to 15 minutes until thickened. Stir occasionally. Watch for burning and reduce the heat or take it off of the burner, if needed.
4967755e-9034-4e7a-ba8c-5c5f33611aa6 Remove the sauce from the heat and let it cool for 5 minutes before using on ribs.
4967755e-9034-4e7a-ba8c-5c5f33611aa6 Prior to using the sauce on the ribs, set some sauce aside for a table sauce.
4967755e-9034-4e7a-ba8c-5c5f33611aa6 Store any unused sauce (that hasn't come into contact with uncooked meat) in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to one week after preparation. The sauce can be made up to one week in advance. Simply reheat the sauce on the stovetop or in a microwave to use within 5 minutes.
4b18455d-8026-48c3-b0b4-47b7e2f2a249 In a medium saucepan, combine the ingredients (whiskey, ketchup, dark brown sugar, vinegar, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, minced garlic, dry mustard, salt, and pepper) and mix well.
4b18455d-8026-48c3-b0b4-47b7e2f2a249 Simmer over medium-low heat for 20 minutes, stirring often. Reduce heat to low if needed. Make sure to keep a close eye on this sauce as it cooks. The sauce should be thick by the end of simmering.
4b18455d-8026-48c3-b0b4-47b7e2f2a249 Remove the sauce from the heat and allow it to cool completely for about 15 to 20 minutes.
4b18455d-8026-48c3-b0b4-47b7e2f2a249 Use immediately after cooling or store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to seven days after preparation. Warm the refrigerated sauce on the stovetop for a few minutes before using.
4b18455d-8026-48c3-b0b4-47b7e2f2a249 Apply to grilled or smoked ribs as directed.
b5507913-65f7-4909-8cf6-4e66772f9f23 Gather the ingredients.
b5507913-65f7-4909-8cf6-4e66772f9f23 Melt the butter in a small saucepan.
b5507913-65f7-4909-8cf6-4e66772f9f23 Pour in lemon juice and add the remaining ingredients. Let the mixture simmer on low for about 3 minutes.
b5507913-65f7-4909-8cf6-4e66772f9f23 Remove from heat and let stand at room temperature for 5 minutes before using.
b5507913-65f7-4909-8cf6-4e66772f9f23 Baste your turkey.
4f48a3a3-bb01-4cfe-8317-a2b54ee33828 Gather the ingredients.
4f48a3a3-bb01-4cfe-8317-a2b54ee33828 In a small bowl, whisk together water, vinegar, mustard, oil, chili powder, garlic powder, and cayenne until well mixed.
4f48a3a3-bb01-4cfe-8317-a2b54ee33828 Let the flavors marry for a few hours in the refrigerator before using.
4f48a3a3-bb01-4cfe-8317-a2b54ee33828 This mop can be stored covered in the refrigerator for about one week.
51ec8631-a251-45d3-aa99-ebe5c02e6b95 Gather the ingredients.
51ec8631-a251-45d3-aa99-ebe5c02e6b95 Combine all ingredients in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir constantly for 5 minutes.
51ec8631-a251-45d3-aa99-ebe5c02e6b95 Reduce heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes, stirring occasionally. The sauce should be good and thick.
51ec8631-a251-45d3-aa99-ebe5c02e6b95 Remove pot from heat and allow the sauce to cool for 10 to 15 minutes before using it. If making ahead of time, cool sauce for 30 minutes and then store in an airtight container.
51ec8631-a251-45d3-aa99-ebe5c02e6b95 Enjoy!
0f5b8f4a-5acd-4c4a-9845-07e2a1203437 Gather the ingredients.
0f5b8f4a-5acd-4c4a-9845-07e2a1203437 Prepare a water bath canner and four half-pint canning jars.
0f5b8f4a-5acd-4c4a-9845-07e2a1203437 Halve, pit and chop the apricots.
0f5b8f4a-5acd-4c4a-9845-07e2a1203437 Combine all ingredients in a large saucepan or Dutch oven.
0f5b8f4a-5acd-4c4a-9845-07e2a1203437 Bring to a boil. Reduce heat.
0f5b8f4a-5acd-4c4a-9845-07e2a1203437 Cook until thick, with a syrup-like consistency. This will take anywhere from 20 minutes to an hour.
0f5b8f4a-5acd-4c4a-9845-07e2a1203437 If desired, purée the sauce using an immersion blender.
0f5b8f4a-5acd-4c4a-9845-07e2a1203437 Ladle into hot, clean jars leaving about 1/4-inch head space.
0f5b8f4a-5acd-4c4a-9845-07e2a1203437 Top with the two-piece lids and rings, and process in a water bath canner for 15 minutes.
6b5da921-f71c-4845-88f2-56f2f1b0974a Mix all ingredients in a sauce pan over low heat.
6b5da921-f71c-4845-88f2-56f2f1b0974a Cook until thoroughly dissolved.
6b5da921-f71c-4845-88f2-56f2f1b0974a Remove from heat and let cool for 10-15 minutes.
6b5da921-f71c-4845-88f2-56f2f1b0974a Mop over brisket ever hour until Brisket is cooked. Brisket will take 1 to 1 1/4 hours per pound in a smoker at about 225 degrees F/110 degrees C.
8c9e0131-cc55-48dc-a885-dea9129ed22d Gather the ingredients.
8c9e0131-cc55-48dc-a885-dea9129ed22d Combine all ingredients in a saucepan and simmer while stirring until the sugar dissolves.
8c9e0131-cc55-48dc-a885-dea9129ed22d Remove from heat and serve warm.
8c9e0131-cc55-48dc-a885-dea9129ed22d Serve with your favorite pulled pork recipe.
8c9e0131-cc55-48dc-a885-dea9129ed22d Enjoy!
4ae69279-600b-46ad-afae-5d68657318b4 In a large saucepan, add all of the ingredients. Place it on the stovetop over medium heat and bring the sauce up to a boil. Reduce the heat to a low simmer and cook the sauce for 10 to 12 minutes, stirring occasionally.
4ae69279-600b-46ad-afae-5d68657318b4 Once the sauce has thickened, remove it from the heat and let it cool for 10 minutes before using.
6f42f571-4fb0-4957-ad4d-98757daba3af Whisk together the ketchup, vinegar, sugar, water, Worcestershire sauce, chili powder, cumin and cayenne in a saucepan, bring to a low simmer and turn off the heat.
6f42f571-4fb0-4957-ad4d-98757daba3af Let the sauce cool to room temperature. This can be used as a basting sauce toward the end of the cooking time of your meat or brushed on after barbecuing, with additional sauce served on the side.
2daf27ca-27ac-4399-a136-8a1202222812 Gather the ingredients.
2daf27ca-27ac-4399-a136-8a1202222812 Melt butter in a medium saucepan. Add onions and garlic and sauté until translucent.
2daf27ca-27ac-4399-a136-8a1202222812 Add remaining ingredients and mix well.
2daf27ca-27ac-4399-a136-8a1202222812 Bring to a boil over a medium-high heat.
2daf27ca-27ac-4399-a136-8a1202222812 As soon as the sauce starts to bubble, reduce the heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes or until the sauce reaches the desired thickness.
2daf27ca-27ac-4399-a136-8a1202222812 Remove from heat and let cool for 10 minutes before using.
2daf27ca-27ac-4399-a136-8a1202222812 Enjoy!
292dcfc9-916b-4e9c-b4a8-91926fccd261 Mix all ingredients together in a saucepan and let simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from the heat.
292dcfc9-916b-4e9c-b4a8-91926fccd261 Once the chicken is cooked, shred the chicken and add the sauce to coat it. You can vary the amount of barbecue sauce added to your taste.
3a4f0959-89b9-4ad0-922b-4e77ffa177da Place all ingredients in a large pot and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes.
3a4f0959-89b9-4ad0-922b-4e77ffa177da Once sauce has cooked, remove from heat and allow to cool slightly. Use the mop on meat every hour during the cooking process.
f827871b-b7b4-4cd6-b4f5-908cd96c26f9 Heat the oven to 350 F.
f827871b-b7b4-4cd6-b4f5-908cd96c26f9 Use a towel or paper towel to grasp an end of the silver skin and pull it from the back of the ribs.
f827871b-b7b4-4cd6-b4f5-908cd96c26f9 Cut the racks into serving-size portions. Sprinkle the spareribs with salt and pepper.
f827871b-b7b4-4cd6-b4f5-908cd96c26f9 Place the ribs in a foil-lined roasting pan and cover with the onions.
f827871b-b7b4-4cd6-b4f5-908cd96c26f9 Combine wet ingredients and spices. Pour over the ribs.
f827871b-b7b4-4cd6-b4f5-908cd96c26f9 Cover the pan tightly with foil and bake in the preheated oven for about 1 1/2 hours. Baste occasionally and turn spareribs a few times.
f827871b-b7b4-4cd6-b4f5-908cd96c26f9 Remove the foil and continue baking for about 15 minutes to brown the spareribs.
83db7cbe-eb3c-46b7-9e56-63b6f77f4e32 Gather the ingredients.
83db7cbe-eb3c-46b7-9e56-63b6f77f4e32 Combine all ingredients. Store in an airtight container.
83db7cbe-eb3c-46b7-9e56-63b6f77f4e32 Apply to ribs while they are smoking in small amounts.
45626dce-227f-4a79-9e5f-6d23b21137bd Combine all ingredients in a saucepan and allow to simmer for 8 to 10 minutes.
45626dce-227f-4a79-9e5f-6d23b21137bd Once the sauce has cooked through, remove from heat and allow to cool before using.
45626dce-227f-4a79-9e5f-6d23b21137bd Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 5 days after preparation.
c299d07b-4520-4757-a7bf-3718f6140829 Combine the dry ingredients in a saucepan. Slowly add vinegar, stirring until it's well mixed.
c299d07b-4520-4757-a7bf-3718f6140829 Add remaining ingredients and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer, stirring frequently for about 10 minutes.
aeb233ea-13e2-4c30-9391-0a467e00e859 Sauté onion and garlic in olive oil in a saucepan. Cook until transparent.
aeb233ea-13e2-4c30-9391-0a467e00e859 Add lemon juice, salt and pepper, paprika, mustard, and Tabasco. Mix well. Simmer over medium heat for 5 minutes.
aeb233ea-13e2-4c30-9391-0a467e00e859 Reduce heat to low and add tomato sauce and vinegar. Let simmer for an additional 15 minutes.
aeb233ea-13e2-4c30-9391-0a467e00e859 From here you can add whatever flavor you want: brown sugar, honey or molasses for a sweet sauce; chiles and cayenne for a hot sauce; or liquid smoke for a hint of smokiness. Be creative with it. or liquid smoke for a hint of smokiness. Be creative with it.
0288cffc-1df8-489e-9a3f-6d32cf748429 Gather the ingredients.
0288cffc-1df8-489e-9a3f-6d32cf748429 Combine the ketchup, brown sugar, cider vinegar, pineapple juice, bourbon, molasses, Worcestershire sauce, hot sauce, and salt and pepper in a medium saucepan. Bring the mixture to a simmer over medium-low heat. Cook, stirring occasionally, for about 10 minutes, or until the sauce reaches the desired thickness.
0288cffc-1df8-489e-9a3f-6d32cf748429 Remove the pan from the heat and let cool. When cooled, taste and adjust seasoning. Use the sauce right away or store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 weeks.
0288cffc-1df8-489e-9a3f-6d32cf748429 Enjoy!
81b8676f-7bd3-49ad-affc-070786367179 Combine dry ingredients in a saucepan. Add enough vinegar to make a mixable paste. Mix well.
81b8676f-7bd3-49ad-affc-070786367179 Place over high heat and add remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
81b8676f-7bd3-49ad-affc-070786367179 Remove from heat and let the sauce cool completely before using.
7245a0c9-c66b-47e3-bc17-e13e3b2dc2e5 Heat oil in a saucepan. Add onions and sauté over medium heat until soft, about 3 to 4 minutes. Add garlic and cook for 20 to 30 seconds. Stir ​in brown sugar, celery salt, and black pepper. Add remaining ingredients and simmer on low heat until the sauce thickens.
7245a0c9-c66b-47e3-bc17-e13e3b2dc2e5 Remove from heat and let cool for 5 or so minutes before using. If serving as a side sauce, let the sauce cool a little longer.
7245a0c9-c66b-47e3-bc17-e13e3b2dc2e5 If making ahead of time, let the sauce cool completely (about 30 minutes) and place in an airtight container. Store in the refrigerator for 7 days after preparation. Reheat before using.
f22806b7-e313-4b73-b2c3-8871f7162ea2 Combine all ingredients in a large saucepan over a low heat.
f22806b7-e313-4b73-b2c3-8871f7162ea2 Simmer on low for 15-20 minutes, or until slightly thickened. Stir often, and watch for burning.
f22806b7-e313-4b73-b2c3-8871f7162ea2 Remove from heat, and allow the sauce to cool completely before using. Store sauce in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 1 week after preparation.
2e11f30f-813f-42a8-8f22-e40a650b9426 In a saucepan, sauté the onion, garlic, and salt, in the vegetable oil for 5 minutes on medium-low heat.
2e11f30f-813f-42a8-8f22-e40a650b9426 Add the rest of the ingredients, and bring to a simmer.
2e11f30f-813f-42a8-8f22-e40a650b9426 Cook, stirring occasionally, for about 15 minutes, or until the sauce reaches the desired thickness.
2e11f30f-813f-42a8-8f22-e40a650b9426 Taste and adjust seasoning.
78dd5132-ceaa-4be6-9c7a-51bbfc9cc4aa Lightly spray a 9x5x3-inch loaf pan.
78dd5132-ceaa-4be6-9c7a-51bbfc9cc4aa Heat the oven to 350 F.
78dd5132-ceaa-4be6-9c7a-51bbfc9cc4aa Combine the ground beef and pork, bread crumbs, egg, 2/3 cup ketchup, 2 tablespoons mustard, 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce, grill seasoning, and the onion.
78dd5132-ceaa-4be6-9c7a-51bbfc9cc4aa Bake for 1 hour then carefully drain off excess grease.
78dd5132-ceaa-4be6-9c7a-51bbfc9cc4aa Combine the topping ingredients and spread over the top of the loaf. Continue baking for 15 to 20 minutes longer.
3ca404a3-447c-431a-bc67-ad58a08f73fc Combine all ingredients together in a medium bowl.
3ca404a3-447c-431a-bc67-ad58a08f73fc Let stand at room temperature for 1 hour before using.
3ca404a3-447c-431a-bc67-ad58a08f73fc If not used immediately, store the sauce in an airtight container in the refrigerator. Stir the barbecue sauce before using it.
02e66d4e-507f-4130-9620-19abde180d76 Combine the ketchup, brown sugar, lime juice, vinegar, both chili powders, cumin, and salt to taste in a medium saucepan. Bring the mixture to a simmer over medium-low heat. Cook, stirring occasionally, for about 5 minutes, or until the sauce reaches desired thickness. Taste, and adjust seasoning.
02e66d4e-507f-4130-9620-19abde180d76 Use right away, or store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 weeks.
f57e16c1-6d50-44e0-8b94-f12d0c52bfca Gather the ingredients.
f57e16c1-6d50-44e0-8b94-f12d0c52bfca Mix all ingredients together in a large saucepan over low heat.
f57e16c1-6d50-44e0-8b94-f12d0c52bfca Simmer for about 20 minutes, stirring often.
f57e16c1-6d50-44e0-8b94-f12d0c52bfca Remove from heat and let cool for five minutes.
c2a08a91-1d6f-42d4-80e1-fe101ad721b7 Place bottled sauce and brown sugar in a large saucepan. Let mixture come to a slight boil. Reduce heat and let simmer for 2 to 3 minutes, stirring occasionally.
c2a08a91-1d6f-42d4-80e1-fe101ad721b7 Add ketchup, molasses, cider vinegar, onion powder, and hot sauce. Stir through and let simmer for 5 to 6 more minutes.
c2a08a91-1d6f-42d4-80e1-fe101ad721b7 Remove from heat and use. If making ahead of time, cool sauce to room temperature and place into an airtight container. Store in the refrigerator for up 5 days after preparation.
0edfae78-fac3-4727-8d86-6aee0893daf7 In a medium saucepan, add olive oil, garlic, chipotle powder, and cumin.
0edfae78-fac3-4727-8d86-6aee0893daf7 Allow to heat through while stirring, for 1 minute.
0edfae78-fac3-4727-8d86-6aee0893daf7 Add red wine and brown sugar. Simmer for 2 to 3 minutes.
0edfae78-fac3-4727-8d86-6aee0893daf7 Add in soy sauce, vinegar, ketchup, salt and Worcestershire sauce. Simmer for 3 minutes more.
0edfae78-fac3-4727-8d86-6aee0893daf7 Remove from heat, allow the sauce to cool slightly before using.
0edfae78-fac3-4727-8d86-6aee0893daf7 Sauce will last for up to 1 week if stored in an airtight container in a refrigerator.
c7007a82-18cd-44ab-bd61-5b1636e64777 Gather the ingredients.
c7007a82-18cd-44ab-bd61-5b1636e64777 Cut the sausage into 1-inch to 2-inch lengths and transfer them to the slow cooker crockery insert. Add the onion chunks and pepper squares, if using.
c7007a82-18cd-44ab-bd61-5b1636e64777 Combine the brown sugar, ketchup, vinegar, mustard, soy sauce, garlic powder, and melted butter. Pour the mixture over the sausage and vegetables.
c7007a82-18cd-44ab-bd61-5b1636e64777 Stir to coat all of the sausage pieces.
c7007a82-18cd-44ab-bd61-5b1636e64777 Cover and cook for 4 to 6 hours on LOW.
c7007a82-18cd-44ab-bd61-5b1636e64777 Serve and enjoy!
c2575711-331e-4f67-a084-96565e802dc7 Place all ingredients in a medium saucepan and simmer over low heat for 8 to 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
c2575711-331e-4f67-a084-96565e802dc7 Remove sauce from heat and let cool completely (about 30 minutes) before using. To give the flavors a chance to really combine, make the sauce a day ahead of time.
c2575711-331e-4f67-a084-96565e802dc7 Store the sauce in an air tight container in the refrigerator for up to one week after preparation. Warm the sauce slightly in microwave (about 30 seconds or so) before serving.
ecfe0b9a-0332-4233-8346-b6d74ca5188b In a medium saucepan, combine all ingredients and simmer for 5 to 8 minutes.
ecfe0b9a-0332-4233-8346-b6d74ca5188b Once cooked through, remove from heat and allow to cool before applying to chicken. If making ahead of time, cool sauce completely and store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 5 days after preparation.
0b85fc5f-1b2b-41d7-828c-071e272c87f1 Combine black and white pepper, onion and garlic powder, salt and cayenne in a small bowl. Set aside.
0b85fc5f-1b2b-41d7-828c-071e272c87f1 Fry bacon in a large saucepan until crisp.
0b85fc5f-1b2b-41d7-828c-071e272c87f1 Remove bacon (reserving rendered fat) and place onto a plate lined with paper towels.
0b85fc5f-1b2b-41d7-828c-071e272c87f1 Let cooked bacon drain fro 5 to 10 minutes.
0b85fc5f-1b2b-41d7-828c-071e272c87f1 Once cooled enough to handle, crumble the bacon into fine pieces.
0b85fc5f-1b2b-41d7-828c-071e272c87f1 With a spoon, remove any of the impurities from rendered bacon fat.
0b85fc5f-1b2b-41d7-828c-071e272c87f1 Place pan back on heat and add onions.
0b85fc5f-1b2b-41d7-828c-071e272c87f1 Cook over medium heat until onions are soft.
0b85fc5f-1b2b-41d7-828c-071e272c87f1 Add spice mixture and stir.
0b85fc5f-1b2b-41d7-828c-071e272c87f1 Add stock, chili sauce, honey, pecans and orange juice, bacon, garlic, Tabasco and lemon and orange rinds and pulp.
0b85fc5f-1b2b-41d7-828c-071e272c87f1 Reduce heat to low and let simmer for 10 minutes. Stir occasionally.
0b85fc5f-1b2b-41d7-828c-071e272c87f1 Remove orange and lemon rinds and continue cooking for an additional 15 minutes. Stir occasionally.
0b85fc5f-1b2b-41d7-828c-071e272c87f1 Right before taking sauce off of heat, add butter and stir in until melted.
0b85fc5f-1b2b-41d7-828c-071e272c87f1 Remove from heat and allow sauce to cool for 10 to 15 minutes.
0b85fc5f-1b2b-41d7-828c-071e272c87f1 Pour sauce into a food processor or blender and mix until smooth.
0b85fc5f-1b2b-41d7-828c-071e272c87f1 The sauce is now complete.
0440cc55-abae-4b96-bffc-48133c073666 Gather the ingredients.
0440cc55-abae-4b96-bffc-48133c073666 In a large saucepan combine lime juice and soy sauce. Heat until simmering and add sugar. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Add peanut butter, ketchup, rum, and continue stirring. Add remaining ingredients and mix well.
0440cc55-abae-4b96-bffc-48133c073666 Remove from heat and let cool to room temperature. Serve with grilled meats, especially shrimp, chicken or pork. Refrigerate for up to two days in an airtight container.
c7a8fd94-7278-44e5-b7b2-b52072d86105 Combine all ingredients, except soy sauce, butter and liquid smoke, in a medium saucepan. Simmer on low for 20 minutes, making sure to stir occasionally. Add the remaining ingredients and simmer for 10 more minutes.
c7a8fd94-7278-44e5-b7b2-b52072d86105 Remove sauce from heat and allow mixture to cool for 10 to 15 minutes before using.
c7a8fd94-7278-44e5-b7b2-b52072d86105 Use in your favorite BBQ recipe and enjoy!
47ce9235-aa27-4be8-a9d6-2a1e19452ac0 Gather the ingredients.
47ce9235-aa27-4be8-a9d6-2a1e19452ac0 Combine all ingredients in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly.
47ce9235-aa27-4be8-a9d6-2a1e19452ac0 Reduce heat to low and simmer, uncovered, until thickened and slightly reduced—about 5 to 10 minutes. Stir occasionally.
e559c6f4-6b34-4a4e-8ccf-c9b7af9b4c89 Gather the ingredients.
e559c6f4-6b34-4a4e-8ccf-c9b7af9b4c89 In a medium bowl, combine all ingredients, including the rub. Stir gently until most of the rub ingredients has incorporated into the liquid mixture. Let mixture stand for 10 minutes before using.
e559c6f4-6b34-4a4e-8ccf-c9b7af9b4c89 Use for marinading ribs.
